loans.name: Rahib

texts.en:
Rahib was born in 1974. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, known as Fuzuli town, and settled in the Fuzuli region in Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. 

He has been in this business for six years. He is married and has one child. Now he needs a loan of $1,200 to buy shoes and clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Thi Hien's Group

texts.vi:
Vũ Thị Hiên, sinh năm 1948(Ms 23060014), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.876.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Hàng ngày, cô đi chợ bán hoa quả thu nhập khoảng 50.000 vnđ/ ngày. Các con cô đã lớn và đi làm có thu nhập khoảng 2.500.000 đến 3.000.000 vnđ/ tháng. Cô rất thích cách hoàn trả vốn dần vì nó rất thuận tiện và phù hợp với khả năng gia đình cô và cô mong muốn tham gia vay vốn lâu dài. Trong nhóm vay của cô còn có:
Tạ Thị Minh Tâm, sinh năm 1978 (Ms 23060017), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Hàng ngày chị đi làm thuê thu nhập khoảng 50.000 đến 75.000 vnđ/ ngày.
Năng Thị Mai,.sinh năm 1976 (Ms 23060026), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Chị có thu nhập ổn định theo tháng, trung bình khoảng 1.500.000 vnđ / tháng.
Nguyễn Thị Thành, sinh năm 1979 (Ms 23060029), tham gia vay vốn ở mức: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ và chăn nuôi.
Hoàng Thị Hòa, sinh năm 1975(Ms 23060018), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. V. Thi Hien (ID Number 23060014), born in 1948, would like to borrow 4,876,000VND to rear pigs. Everyday, she also sells fruits at the local market, earning about 50,000VND (around 3.00USD) a day. Her children are all grown up and have stable monthly income of about 2,500,000 to 3,000,000 VND (about 156USD to 187USD). Mrs. Hien is really keen on repaying the loan on an installment basis because it is very suitable and convenient for her family. She would like to continue borrowing for a long period of time. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. T. Thi Minh Tam (ID Number 23060017), born in 1978, borrows 4,028,000VND to rear pigs. Everyday, she also works as a hired worker with the daily income of 50,000VND to 75,000VND (about 3USD to 5USD).
  • Mrs. N. Thi Mai (ID Number 23060026), born in 1976, borrows 4,028,000VND to rear pigs. She has a stable monthly income of 1,500,000VND (about 94USD).
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thanh (ID Number 23060029), born in 1979, borrows 3,604,000VND to raise livestock and do business at the local market.
  • Mrs. H. Thi Hoa (ID Number 23060018), born in 1975, borrows 4,028,000VND to rear pigs.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.en: Pierette S. was born in 1976 in Agonlin and married Benjamin Kpamegan, a gardener and refrigerator repairman.  They have four children in school.  Pierette has been in the business of selling coal for four years and paid off her first loan.  With this loan, she will solidify her client base by continuing to supply necessary fuels.  She is asking for a loan of 120,000 franc CFA ($250 US).

loans.use: To purchase 12 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en:
Dong K., 29, has one young child and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband. She sells vegetables in the market to earn a living and is able to make $5 US a day while her husband is a taxi-driver and makes $8 US per day as well.

Mrs. Dong K. would like to take out a loan of $400 US to make a new investment. She will purchase grocery products for sale.

loans.use: To open a grocery store.

loans.name: Bertha Sofia

texts.es:
Siendo madre de tres hijos y con tan solo cuarentaitres años, Bertha ha logrado construir un negocio rentable para ella y su familia. Antes de conocer a EDAPROSPO, las ventas de su tienda eran menores a las de hoy en día.

Ella atiende durante las veinticuatro horas del día un minimarket y licorería. Ella agradece que su casa se tenga buena ubicación pues la calle donde habita es muy concurrida. Sus mismos clientes muchas veces le han dado ideas sobre qué cosas debe vender y que otras no. Atender las demandas de su público es algo que esta creciendo crecer su negocio.

Su esposo es obrero textil en una fábrica. Junto con él ha logrado terminar de construir su casa y brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos. Ella quisiera seguir implementando más su negocio y poder satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes más frecuentes.
texts.en:
Bertha is 43 years old and she has three children. She had managed to build a very profitable business for her and her family. Before coming to EDAPROSPO, her sales were lower than what they are today. She runs a minimarket and a liquor store 24-7. She is very lucky as her home has a great location, so her business is very well-attended. Some times, there are her very own customers who have given her ideas about what items to sell. Serving the needs of her customers is what’s making her business grow. Her husband is a textile worker in a factory. Together they managed to finish building their home and to provide their children with a good education. She would like to diversify her business in order to be able to fully satisfy her more frequent customer’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Diversify her business

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mr. Socheat T., 28 and his wife, Mrs. Sreymom Boeun, 19, married in 2006 and just have one young daughter. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Socheat has been a blacksmith for seven years and started his own business five months ago. Before he started his own shop, he was employed in a shop near his village. His wife stays at home to take care of their daughter. Socheat lacks money to expand his business so he is requesting his first loan of US$ 1000 to purchase blacksmith's materials for his new shop.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith's materials for his business

loans.name: Vũ Văn Kỷ Group

texts.vi:
Chú Kỷ, 49 tuổi hiện đang sống cùng vợ và 2 con nhỏ đang đi học. Gia đình chú có rất nhiều hoạt động: vừa buôn bán các laọi thức ăn chăn nuôi, cung cấp rất nhiều mặt hàng cho các cửa hàng trong và ngoài tỉnh. Thu nhập gia đình chú rất ổn định trung bình khoảng 180000-200000 vnđ/ ngày. Lần này chú vay chu kỳ 2 với mức vốn 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để bổ sung vốn buôn bán. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm của chú ;
+ Chi Phan Thị Lý vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn buôn bán hoa quả.  
+ Chi Dương Thị T. vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn  bán hàng tạp hoá. 
+ Chi Dương Thị Q. vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn đi chợ. 
+ Chi Nguyễn Thị Cừ vay 4256000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn mua nguyên liệu sản xuất giấy. 
+ Chi Tô Thị L.  vay 4704000 vnđ/ 50 tuần để thêm vốn buôn bán bánh kẹo.
texts.en:
Mr Ky, 49 years old, currently lives with his wife and two young children who are still going to school. He is selling a variety of cattle food to stores inside and outside his province. His family income is very stable, approximately 180,000 to 200,000 VND per day (11 to 12 USD per day). This is his second loan cycle, and he hopes to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to have more fund investing in his business. Other members in Mr. Ky's group are: + Mrs. Phan Thi Ly wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to sell fruit. + Mrs. Duong Thi Tam wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to invest in her sundry goods store. + Mrs. Duong Thi Q. wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to sell goods at the market. + Mrs. Nguyen Thi Cu wants to borrow 4,256,000 VND (245 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to buy more materials to produce paper. + Mrs. To Thi L. wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (271 USD) for a period of 50 weeks to invest in her candy store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in small businesses

loans.name: Fatima Adoké

texts.fr:
F. Fatima Adoké est mariée à SOTON Robert et mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. F. Fatima Adoké est née vers 1966 et réside depuis 25 ans au quartier Fidjrossè de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. F. Fatima Adoké vend des tissus, chaussures, sacs, mèches, produits de beauté et tenues. F. Fatima Adoké s’approvisionne au marché international du Bénin et à Lomé Capitale du Togo, pays frontalier du Bénin. Dans le souci de répondre au mieux à la demande de ses clients, F. Fatima Adoké sollicite son troisième prêt à ALIDé.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
F. Fatima Adoké is married to SOTON Robert and is the mother of two children, who are both in school. She was born around 1966 and for 25 years has been residing in the Fidjrossè district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She sells fabrics, shoes, bags, hair extensions, beauty products, and clothing. Fatima supplies herself at the international market of Bénin and in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Bénin. Concerned about improving her response to the demands of her customers, she's requesting her third loan with ALIDÉ.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, shoes, bags, and clothing for children

loans.name: Mawero East B- Nabwire Sawuya Group

texts.en: Mrs. N. Sawuya, 42, is married with four kids. Her first born is 20 years old while her last born is 6 years old. She also takes care of three orphans, all of whom attend school. She lives in Mawero East B in Busia where she has been selling cereals (maize, beans, soya, millet, sorghum) for over 20 years. She requests a loan of USD 1800 to purchase cereals.

loans.use: To purchase cereals (maize, beans, soya, millet, sorghum)

loans.name: Bexi Yolanda

texts.es: La Sra. Bexi Yolanda G. tiene mas de 2 años de dedicarse a lo que es la venta de ropa y calzado, las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante, domiciliar y en centro de trabajos privados y estatales, ella tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela primaria del barrio en donde ella vive, con los ingresos que le genera este tipo de actividad le sirven para cubrir con los gastos familiares y cumplir con las obligaciones financieras, ella necesita el credito para comprar mas producto ya que ella esta pasando un tiempo dificil y necesita recuperarse.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bexi Yolanda G. has been selling clothing and footwear for more than two years. Sales are made by traveling to customers, to households and in private and public work centers. She has 4 children who are studying in the neighborhood primary school where she lives. Income earned from this activity is used to pay household bills and to meet financial obligations. She needs a loan to buy more products, as she going through a difficult time and needs to recover.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, footwear, skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Irene K. from Mbeya. She is a widow with three children between the ages of 12 and 18. Irene has been running a grocery business since 2008. A grocery store is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to, to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient. Irene works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week and currently earns about $120 a month. Irene is requesting a loan in order to purchase commodities in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Irene thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase commodities in bulk for her business

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric N. is married with two children. Raising pigs in Belo, Cameroon is his primary source of income. With this loan Eric will buy three piglets, five bags of feed, wooden fencing, and vaccinations for the pigs.

Eric believes that he will raise his pigs well because "I work with my wife." He also notes his plans to work hard so that he may earn the highest income. He knows that he has to be present in order to be successful.

This is Eric's second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. He used his last loan to tend to his pigs, as he will do with this loan. Eric takes out GHAPE loans because the conditions of GHAPE membership require you to pay back the loan in regular, small installments, which works well for Eric. With the profits from this loan, Eric will pay for his children's school fees, add a little to his business, and generally help his family to lead a better life.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy 3 piglets, pig feed, fencing and vaccinations.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Cataggaman Viejo is near Tuguegarao city proper. No wonder many of the residents here choose to operate tricycle transport for their livelihood. The family of Rosemarie is among the residents who depend on tricycle operation as their source of income. Her husband is the one who drives their tricycle.  

Rosemarie would like to borrow PHP12,000 from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of their motorcycle, including their license renewal. Rosemarie is 36 years old and married to Lamberto. They are blessed with three children who are studying in high school and the elementary level of education. Rosemarie hopes that through their humble business, they will someday send all their children to college.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Abdusharif

texts.ru: Саломов Абдушариф проживает в районе Шахринава. Возраст 53 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Абдушариф более 27 лет работал крановщиком. Вот как более 5 лет начал свой бизнес. Он занимается торговлей, продает детские игрушки. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Abdusharif S. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 53 years old, married and has 5 children. Abdusharif spent 27 years working as a crane operator. He started his own business just over 5 years ago. He sells children’s toys. He is requesting a loan to increase his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Forty-nine-year-old Thelma O. is a rice grower. She manages a hectare (2.5 acres) of farmland that provides her family with all their needs. Aside from the farm that she has managed for years now, she is also starting a new business, which is pigs.

Because to start a business is a bit expensive, Thelma would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers for her farm and, for her pigs, two sacks of Lactatex feed and two sacks of Gestatex feed.

Thelma is active in the CEVI credit program. CEVI provides her with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Julia Inocenta

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad.
Julia es casada, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Julia tiene una ferretería en un local alquilado en el distrito D. Carmen Alto, venD. materiales D. construcción, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus esposos e hijos.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cemento y tubos.
Los sueños D. Julia son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank “Prosperidad” (Prosperity). She is 42 years old, married, and has 5 children. Julia sells construction materials from her hardware store in the Carmen Alto district. Her husband and children help her with the business.

She needs a loan of 2000 soles to purchase cement and pipes. Julia dreams of improving her business and that her children pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement and pipes

loans.name: Wanglei A Paculal Joyce Group

texts.en: Joyce P., 37, is married with four children, three of whom attend school, and she looks after three dependents that are schooling as well. In business for over ten years, Joyce sells both stationery and charcoal.  She is now requesting a loan to purchase stationery items and 50 bags of charcoal for sale in town. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to increase her stock and improve upon her stationery

loans.use: To purchase stationery items and charcoal (50 bags) mostly from far villages for sale in town

loans.name: Molortsetseg

texts.en:
Molortsetseg P. is 41 years old and the mother of three children. She currently resides with her husband and three children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her husband is a teacher in a local high school and her eldest daughter goes to a university in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her other two children are both high school students in Arhangai province.

Molortsetseg runs a small convenience store located in the town. She has been running this small convenience store for the last nine years and this business has been a major source of family income. She mostly sells food products including baked goods, soft-drinks, etc. Since starting the business in 2000, she has been doing pretty well and her business capital has expanded from 150,000 MNT to 400,000 MNT.

Molortsetseg says that her eldest daughter is in university and she would like to secure her tuition money with her business profit. She requests a loan to purchase more goods for her small business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana S. is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Savalalo.  She is married and has 6 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Mariana owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Mariana has been engaged in this business for over 3 years.

Mariana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mariana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  Mariana is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Mariana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El microempresario Carlos Hernández García tiene 61 años de edad es casado con 7 hijos, todos estos ya han hecho su vida propia y viven en sus propios hogares. El conductor Hernández se dedica hace más de 30 años a la actividad de transporte selectivo conduciendo un taxi el cual es de su propiedad.

Este microempresario ya fue beneficiado con un crédito por parte de Kiva, el cual ya cancelo en tiempo y forma. Aprovecha a la vez para agradecer a los prestamistas que le solicitaron el crédito, ya que le fue de beneficio y pudo obtener algunos repuestos.

Sin embargo por las condiciones de las calles a estos  vehículos se les debe dar mantenimiento con bastante periodicidad y cambiarles algunos repuestos por lo que solicita se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:

1 Batería para carro a US$ 100, 2 amortiguadores delanteros a US$ 55 cada uno, 2 amortiguadores traseros a US$ 30 cada uno, 8 balineras para patente a US$ 8 cada uno, 2 aspirales delanteros a US$ 25 cada uno, 2 aspirales traseros a US$ 20, 1 alternador a US$ 120, 2 puntas flecha a US$ 20 cada una, 3 correas de alternador a US$ 8 cada una y 2 tijeras delanteras a US$ 46 cada una.
texts.en:
The small businessman Carlos is 61 years old, is married with 7 children all of whom have made their own lives and live in their own homes. Carlos is a driver who for more than 30 years has been working in personal transport, driving a taxi that he owns.

This small businessman has already benefited from a Kiva loan, which has already been paid back in a timely way. He takes advantage of this opportunity to thank the lenders who gave him that credit which was of benefit to him and enabled him to obtain some spare parts.

However, because of the condition of the streets, these vehicles have to be maintained quite often and parts need to be changed, so he requests financing to buy the following:

1 Car battery for $100

2 front shock absorbers at $55 each

2 reach shock absorbers at $30 each

8 bearings at $8 each

2 front coil springs at $25 each

2 back coil springs at $20 each

1 alternator for $120

2 axels at $20 each

3 alternator belts at $8 each and

2 front jacks at $46 each


Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare car parts

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer laboriosa de 41 años que ha sabido sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos: Anthony de 16, Lizeth de 10 y Johanna de 3 años, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. No ha sido fácil, pero lo ha logrado, y sola pues así vive muy feliz con ellos.

Ella se dedica a la asistir en diferentes eventos sociales durante los fines de semana, la contratan para apoyar en boletería, en la venta de recuerdos o para ayudar en la organización de las personas. Así pasa los fines de semana entre el bullicio de los shows, se gana honradamente la vida y está muy orgullosa de trabajar duro para mantener a sus hijos.
Yolanda dice que este negocio es muy rentable porque en los eventos pagan bien a las personas que colaboran en la producción, además ella es enfermera y también se dedica a su profesión durante los días útiles de la semana. 
Así es como ella se las ha ingeniado para mantener a sus hijos y darles una buena educación, para que en el fututo sean hombres de bien, ya que sabe que esa será la mejor herencia que les pueda dejar.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser responsable con sus pagos, ya que no le gusta tener deudas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita remodelará las habitaciones desocupadas que tiene en su casa, para alquilarlas y así obtener un ingreso adicional para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a hard-working 41 year old woman who has known how to get her three children ahead. Anthony is 16, Lizeth is 10, and Johanna is 3. She has worked with much effort and dedication. It has not been easy, but she has done it alone. She lives very happily with them. Her work is assisting at different social events during the week ends. They contract her to help in the ticket office, in selling mementos, or to help in the people’s organization. That is how she spends the week ends. She honorably earns a living among the excitement of the shows. She is very proud to work hard to support her children. Yolanda says that this business is very profitable because the people who collaborate in the production are well paid for the events. Also, she is a nurse. She works in this profession during the week days. This is how she figured out how to support her children and give them a good education. It is so that in the future they will become good people. She knows that this will be the best inheritance that she could leave them. This is her third loan with MFP. She promises to be responsible with her payments because she does not like to have debts. She will use the money that she is asking for to remodel the unoccupied rooms in her house to rent out. That way she will get an additional income for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel the unoccupied rooms in her house to rent out

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe M. is a small-businessman, married with three school children. He runs a business buying and selling music CDs at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the business goods from the wholesale suppliers and sells retail to his customers. His business income helps him to pay his children’s school fees and to capitalizing his business.

Swalehe is requesting a loan of Tsh 800,000 to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en: Mohsen is a 20-year-old single man living with his family. He has five years of experience in air-conditioning. He has owned a shop since 2004. Today he is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy a car to facilitate his business movements and satisfy the needs of customer, and increase his income.

loans.use: Buy a car for air-conditioning business

loans.name: Awo

texts.en: Awo is forty years of age. She is widowed and has given birth to two children who are both currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the occupation of the people is mainly farming. Awo is a trader in coconut cooking oil. She supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. Awo procures the oil from nearby towns. According to her, she has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy cooking oil in large quantities so she can supply to more customers.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil.

loans.name: Mukiibi

texts.en:
Ms. Mukiibi M. is married and blessed with five children of whom one child is still studying. She is a resident of Tank Hill Cell, Ruti, Mbarara.

Mukiibi is a businesswoman dealing in scrap (waste material) from the community. She is acquiring a loan to purchase more scrap to sell to the factory.

Mukiibi’s future hope is to look forward to opening a retail shop to generate more daily income.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap to sell

loans.name: Ulduza

texts.en: Ulduza B. is married and has 4 children. She is 45 years old. Ulduza is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, but is now settled in Absheron town, Masazir village. She has been in her business for 8 years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 15 sheep.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Lidia Saraí

texts.es: Lidia Saraí G. R. de 19 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Morazán, vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad en casa alquilada. Lidia se dedica a elaborar hamacas, en variedad de colores y estilos, los cuales posteriormente sale a comercializar a las zonas de turismos del departamento de Morazán. Su trabajo es muy bien pagado, ya que los precios de las hamacas pueden ser algo costosos por ser elaborados a mano, a pesar de esto no es una venta muy constante, ya que no siempre se logra vender. Es por esto que Lidia, solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar por mayor, el hilo que se utiliza para hacer las hamacas, esto con el fin e poder obtenerlo a precios más bajos y así ofrecer las hamacas a menor costo. Lidia es una mujer muy constante en su trabajo quien desea poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que esto trae grandes beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia Saraí G. R. is 19 years old and lives in the Morazán department along with her husband and two-year old son in a rented house. Lidia works making hammocks in a variety of colors and styles which she later sells in the tourist zones of the Morazán department. Her job is very well-paid since the hammocks can be somewhat expensive because they are handmade. Despite this, she does not have steady business and does not always manage to make sales. For this reason, Lidia is requesting a loan with the goal of being able to buy at wholesale the thread she uses to make the hammocks. This will allow her to get the thread at lower prices and offer the hammocks at lower prices. Lidia is a very persevering woman in her work and hopes to be able to improve her sales since this will bring great benefits to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread for making hammocks.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Ousmane  Cissé  est marié et âgée de 24 ans. Il vit chez son père dans une grande  famille traditionnelle avec sa mère et ses 5 frères dans le quartier Sébougou de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ousmane a abandonné l’école en classe de 8ème  année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour faire le commerce auprès de son grand frère qui tenait une boutique de vente d’articles divers. Après  2 années passées avec ce dernier, il maîtrise bien les rouages du commerce. Depuis maintenant trois ans, il mène seul son activité d’achat et de vente d’articles divers de boutique au quartier Angoulême. Sa boutique située auprès du   boulevard CAN 2002 est le lieu des affaires  par excellence à Ségou. 
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce il a  fait recours à     Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est en relation  depuis 24 mois. Après 2  prêts individuels tous bien remboursés, il est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, ½ tonne de sucres et 1 barrique d’huile alimentaire. 
Il s’approvisionne  à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes.
Monsieur  Ousmane  Cissé vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son père dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales. 
Son ambition est de diversifier ses activités en  ouvrir une station d’essence.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousmane Cissé is married and 24 years old. He lives in his father's house in a large traditional family with his mother and five brothers. This is in the Sébougou district of Ségou (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Ousmane left school in the eighth grade of elementary school (according to the Mali education system) to work with his older brother who had a shop selling various items. Having spent two years there, he had mastered the mechanics of business. For the past three years he has been carrying out his own business purchasing and selling a variety of items in a shop in the Angloulême neighborhood. His shop lies close to Boulevard CAN 2002, a strategic business area of Ségou. In order to increase his working capital, he turned to Soro Yiriwaso, and he has had relations with this company for the past 24 months. After two individual loans which were repaid without incident, he is on his third individual loan with which he plans to buy half a ton of sugar and a barrel of (edible) oil. He gets his supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers. Mr. Ousmane Cissé sells for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. He expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA. This profit will allow him to help his father cover the household expenses. His ambition is to diversify his activities and open a petrol station.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new tires and cement.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells local gin at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a widow with three children. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more local gin to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Tet

texts.en:
Mr. Tet T. is 55 years old, lives in Steung Sen commune, the province of Kompong Tom. He and his wife are local cultivators who work on their own farm field. They have 5 teenage children who are no longer in school. All of them are employed at different occupations and also provide their small income to contribute to their whole family.

In addition, Tet T. owns a generator and he provides a battery charging service for extra profit. Tet T. leads his charging service very well, which several day provides him with much income.

Unfortunately, the machine recently has broken and he may need to replace some problem parts. Because Tet T. doesn’t have enough money he decided to seek a loan to pay the fee for mending his old generator.

Tet T. is not in the picture because he was busy on that day so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To pay the fees to mend his old generator.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter operates a computer school and a cyber cafe where he provides Internet services to the public for a fee. He is 32 years old and unmarried. His business, which has been operational for two years, has really grown. This is because he has been saving his money with a group called Wangige Business Pioneers in Faulu, Kenya. Using his savings, he has been able to expand his business.  

He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to purchase computers and printers and to expand the business premises. He hopes to start offering web design lessons and secure contracts to train at other schools. 

In ten years, he hopes to operate a fully established computer college.

loans.use: purchase computers and printers and to expand the business premises

loans.name: Souheil

texts.en:
Souheil is a 46 year old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has six children. He has been working as a concrete carpenter. He has sixteen years of experience in this field of work. Because of his extensive experience, he has a large number of customers. His clients are people from his region, and sometimes from his surroundings. His family has always been in big support for him, either by their financial help, or simply by encouraging him. He is planning to improve his work and expand his stock which he hopes will help him improve his financial situation. He is confident that this will help get him more projects.  

Souheil is special in his work because he does a good and precise job. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he wasn’t very well known, but with time, he was able to prove himself and make himself known. He decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business. 

Today, Souheil is requesting a loan to purchase wood for his business. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda vive en la casa de su mama y su deseo es tener una casa propia, tiene 28 años y tiene 1 hijo de 10 años, Yolanda tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende carne, actividad que aprendió de su mama desde muy joven, Yolanda viaja a las ferias en donde compra los animales.
Yolanda esta ahorrando para los estudios de su hijo, lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones amenas que la distraen mucho. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de ovino y cerdos.
texts.en:
Yolanda lives in her mother's house and it is her wish to have her own house. She is 28 years old and has a 10-year-old son. Yolanda has a stall at the central market of the town of Ayacucho where she sells meat, activity she learned from her mother when very young. Yolanda travels to the markets where she buys the animals.

Yolanda is saving for her son's schooling. What she enjoys the most are the pleasant meetings of her Banco Comunal which distract her a lot. Her loan will be invested in buying sheep and pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animals.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
61-year-old Avelino C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is married to Annie and has a 21-year-old child. Avelino owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Avelino has been engaged in his business for over 40 years already.

In 2007, Avelino joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Avelino has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Avelino is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Avelino from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sussy Liliana

texts.es:
Sussy es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Sussy viaja a las diferentes ferias de la region en donde vende helados y chupetes, que ella misma prepara en su casa con la ayuda de su esposo, actividad que realiza todos los días y de las ferias compra cereales que luego comercializa en el mercado.
Sussy pertenece al Banco Comunal Lirio y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones, Sussy solicita un préstamo de 800 soles para la compra de palitos, colorantes y esencias.
El sueño de Sussy es implementar su heladería con una maquina heladera.
texts.en:
Sussy is married and has two children that are in school. Sussy travels to different fairs in the area where she sells ice cream and lollipops that she prepares in her home with the help of her husband. She does this every day and at the fairs she buys grains that she later sells en the market. Sussy belongs to the “Banco Comunal Lirio” (Iris Community Bank) and what she likes about it most are the trainings. Sussy is requesting a loan of 800 soles for the purchase of sticks, colorings, and flavorings. Sussy's dream is to open an ice cream shop with a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sticks, coloring, and flavors.

loans.name: El Hadj Fallou

texts.fr: Monsieur ElHadj Fallou N. est un célibataire âgé de 26 ans. Il fut un apprenti maçon  avant de gérer sa propre boutique.  D’ailleurs c’est avec l’aide de sa tante qu’il est devenu boutiquier,  un métier moins fatiguant pour lui,  et espére devenir un jour un grand commerçant très connu dans le pays. Il souhaitait un prêt de 75 000 FCFA pour s'approvisionner en produits alimentaires (sucre, lait…….)
texts.en:
Mr. El Hadj Fallou N. is a 26-year old single man. He was an apprentice builder before managing his own shop. It was his aunt who helped him to become a shop owner, a trade which is less tiring for him. He hopes one day to become an important businessman who is well known in his country. He would like a loan of 75,000FCFA in order to stock up on food products (sugar, milk....)

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on goods

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona J. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and dried fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions and Irish potatoes to sell. Lona is 54 years old and is married to a husband who is a head teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock onions and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn M. is from the village of Salay Angadanan, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Joylyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Joylyn owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Joylyn has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Joylyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Joylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Joylyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Joylyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and working capital

loans.name: Marvin Mateo

texts.es:
El Sr. E. C. se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado la terminal, inicia sus actividades laborales a 6:00 am y las finaliza a las  3:00 pm, antes de la adquisición de este negocio, trabajaba con su papá en agricultura.
Su carga familiar son 2 hijas y su esposa, el crédito lo está solicitando para mejora de su vivienda (concluir la construcción de un cuarto), Cliente es primer crédito que solicita con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Mr. E. C. sells vegetables in the La Terminal Market. He starts work at 6am and finishes at 3pm. Prior to acquiring this business he worked with his farmer in farming. He has a wife and two daughters that depend on him. He is asking for the loan to do some home improvements (finish building a room). This is the first loan he’s requested from our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy iron rods, cement and gravel.

loans.name: Alfonso Vicente

texts.es:
Alfonso de 30 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales. Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Escogió tener una tienda hace dos años para poder mantener a sus cuatro hijos, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. No ha tendido muchos problemas por el volumen de clientes que tiene diario porque su esposa le ayuda con la tienda. 

En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y tener otra tienda para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos pero para llegar a eso el quiere comprar con el préstamo azúcar, arroz, lácteos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Alfonso lives in the Fortín de Guayaquil, an area characterized by its unpaved roads and informal storekeepers and vendors. He has a small general store in the front of his house. He chose to open his store two years ago to support his four children. Since the opening, he has worked from 5 a.m. to 11 p.m. every day. He has not had many problems with the number of customers that he has every day because his wife helps him in the store. Looking ahead, he would like to make some improvements to his house and have another store to assure that his children have a bright future. As a first step toward achieving these goals, he will use this loan to buy sugar, rice, and dairy products for his store.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, and dairy products

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr.Guillermo; El socio tiene 47 años de edad;  él es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades con la ingeniería civil, el socio estudio ingeniería civil y trabaja en el municipio de Santiago, el socio alterna este trabajo con la compra de materiales de ingeniería para realizar un proyecto.  El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar un proyecto de inversión privada.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”. This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cuzco.  

The member is Guillermo. He is 47 years old. He has in a common law marriage and 2 children. He practices civil engineering, which he studied in the town of Santiago   He alternates this work with purchasing engineering materials to undertake a project. The member is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to undertake a private investment project.   

The member is grateful for and values the loan given ion this way and is committed to making the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: private investment project

loans.name: Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamemsu” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Masorie village, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of SLL 700,000 for each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and, consequently, improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Jatu S.. Jatu is age 30. She was born in Nahothi village. She is married to a farmer and the couple has four children who are attending both primary and secondary schools, respectively. 

Jatu is a businesswoman and a farmer. She has been doing business for 15 years now. She wants this loan in order to invest in her business. She will buy rice, groundnuts, palm oil and “bennine” in larger quantities to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, groundnuts, palm oil and “bennine” in larger quantities to sell

loans.name: Gloria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer emprendedora, casada, madre de seis hijos, de los cuales solo dos tiene a su cargo, ya que los otros son casados. 
Tiene su propio negocio, una pequeña pulpería, que inicio hace varios años con pocos productos en donde su esposo dio parte del dinero para comenzar, producto de su trabajo como cadete en un taxi.
Luego a través del financiamiento que Afodenic da. Comienza  a invertir más en granos básicos lo que para ella,  ha sido de gran apoyo económico habiendo mejorado en sus ganancias.
Ahora con este préstamo, aumentara productos de cereales, golosinas, leche en pote, productos condimentados para los alimentos, granos básicos, logrando a si crecer para un mejor equilibrio económico.
texts.en:
Gloria is an enterprising woman, married, mother of six children, two of which are still in her care, as the others are married. 
She has her own business, a small local store, which she started several years ago with a few products to start with which her husband gave her money for, from his work as a taxi driver.
Then through the financing given by Afodenic she started to invest more in staple foods, and for her it has been a great financial support having improved her profits.
Now with this loan, she will increase her cereal products, candies, jars of milk, food seasonings, and staple foods, trying to achieve growth for a better financial balance.

loans.use: Invest in staple food products, cereals, candies, milk products to improve sales

loans.name: Lesian

texts.en:
Lesian O. Koshooi, aged 54 years, is married to Molomet, a farmer aged 54 years, and together they have five children. Two of their children are married farmers, and the other three, aged fourteen, thirteen and ten years, are in school. He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

Lesian trades livestock in Enkaroni market in Bissil, which is a busy market. He sells his livestock to the Kenya meat commission and to butchers in the Kajiado and Kitengela areas. He has been running his business for ten years and earns a monthly profit of 13,500 KES.

Lesian was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela’s office. He has borrowed 40,000 KES with which he plans to use 20,000 KES to buy cows, 10,000 KES to buy goats and 10,000 KES to buy sheep for trading. If the loan boosts his business, he will buy a piece of land and build some commercial houses.

Lesian’s dream is to become a big supplier of livestock to the Kenya meat commission’s slaughter houses.

loans.use: To buy cows, goats and sheep

loans.name: Roseline Kema

texts.en:
Roseline Kema T. is 43 years old and married to Joseph, a businessman, who brings in an additional source of income for the family. The couple has five school-going children and live in one of the towns within Eldoret, Kenya. Roseline has been dairy farming for 15 years and earns a monthly profit of 7,000 KES.
Roseline learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through marketing awareness carried out in her area. She is applying for her second loan of 30,000 KES from KADET, which she intends to use to buy dairy feed. With her anticipated profits, she plans to extend her poultry farming business.
In the future, Roseline wishes to have more poultry farms since both businesses have proved to be very profitable in her area. Her deeper desire is to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Alexander has operated a vegetable-selling business for over seven years, selling wholesale to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business. With his KES 40,000 loan he wants to purchase tomatoes, bananas and potatoes for sale. He hopes to purchase a pick-up van and open a cereal shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, bananas and potatoes for sale

loans.name: Jenny Carolina

texts.es:
Jenny Carolina C. V. tiene 25 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Jenny Carolina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y hacer una casa.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en: Jenny Carolina C. V. is 26 and in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 3 children. The  V.R.C. SAN JACINTO is located in the Campo Alegre area, in the Guare Parish belonging to the Baba Canton. This area is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of corn and rice. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Jenny Carolina works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. She purchases his products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa Markets and sells them in the Lopez Market. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues and diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land and build a house. She enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosalina's Group

texts.en:
Rosalina W. is from the village of Brgy. Ibung, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old. Rosalina is the group leader of a eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosalina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosalina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her product offering

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 18 and 20, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger [traditional nomadic tent], in the outer ger districts of the city. Her husband works as a guard at Narlag shop, while both sons attend college. Therefore, her sons’ education cost is high. She worked as a book shop’s saleswoman from 1999 to 2005. Narantsetseg supports her family by operating a book and magazine retail stall at Narlag shop. When she first began her business in 2005, her working capital was 2,000,000 tugriks (MNT). Now she has 5,000,000 MNT in working capital and she sells books, magazines, newspapers and all kinds of pre-paid phone units. She bought her family's land with 4,500,000 MNT from her business earnings in 2010. Narantsetseg is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to buy more phone unit gift cards and New Year's astrology calendars to support her in this very busy shopping season of the year. Her 2011 year’s goal is to improve her business by expanding her current stall and increasing her working capital. She also wants to attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more New Year's astrology calendars and phone unit gift cards for Mongolian Lunar New Year

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 47 años D. edad.
Paulina no pudo estudiar y se casó muy joven ahora tiene  tres hijos. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez años, el primer préstamo recibido fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles,  con este dinero compró una vaquita, en aquel entonces el precio no era tan elevado como ahora.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta D. frutas y verduras, productos que compra en Yunguyo directo a los mayoristas par luego revenderlos al por menor.
Con éste préstamo D. S/ 700.00 nuevo soles, podrá comprar ocho arrobas D. zanahoria,  cinco D. cebolla, tomate, lechuga y otros.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es trabajar en grupo y compartir con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the “Túpac Amaru” communal bank located in Yunguyo district, Yunguyo province, Puno department.  She is 47 years old.  She was unable to go to school, married young and now has three children.

She has been collaborating with Manuela Ramos Movement for 10 years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used to buy a cow; back then the price wasn’t as high as it is today.  Presently, she’s a fruit and vegetable merchant, products she buys in Yunguyo district direct from wholesalers for subsequent sale at retail.

She will use this 700 new sol loan to buy 8 arrobas of carrots, five of onions, tomatoes, lettuce and others.

Her dream is to stay in business and improve income.  What she enjoys about the communal bank is teamwork and sharing with her fellow members.

loans.use: She will buy 8 arrobas (1 arroba=11.5 kilos) of carrots, five of onions, tomato, lettuce and others.

loans.name: Adelaida's Group

texts.en:
Adelaida M. is from the village of Sandiat West. She is 57 years old. Adelaida is the group leader of a 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Adelaida M..

Adelaida is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Adelaida owns and operates a tailoring business. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Adelaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 38,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as cloth, needles and threads. 

Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Adelaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Gavino

texts.en:
Gavino B. is from the village of Poblacion 1 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old. Gavino is married and has six adult children. 

To make a living, Gavino owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Gavino has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Gavino joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Gavino is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Gavino from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of hisfamily. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime S. Jr. is from the village of Kulasihan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. He is 40 years old. Jaime is married and has two school-aged children. Jaime owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling junk food, candies, biscuits, milk & choco powder & candies in the local community. Jaime has been engaged in his business for over one years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Jaime joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Jaime is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional junk food & candies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jaime from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional junk food & candies

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mut S., age 51 and widowed, sells a variety of Khmer cakes from her small kiosk in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh city. She  has many clients and receives many orders for her cakes. Her client base is continually growing and she is able to generate a small income to help support her family. 

She has five children, four of whom are unmarried. Three of her daughters are employed at the garment factory as workers, and they always contribute their profits every month to Mut S. toward the family expenses. 

Mut S. has a son who is not yet working and has no resources to start a business. His mother wishes to help get him started with a job, but she has no immediate cash to make that possible. For this reason, she would like to request a loan in order to purchase a used motor-trailer taxi so that her son can begin a service business.

loans.use: to purchase a used motor-trailer taxi so that her son can begin a service business

loans.name: Neneta

texts.en:
Neneta is married, with 5 children, four of whom are in school.. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Neneta is 45 years old.  She has a fish vending business.  Neneta requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in their community.

Neneta has been in this business for 18 years.  In the future, Neneta would like to do some house improvements and send her kids to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en: Barikisu A. sells soaps and fish at Amoanda near Elmina. She is a single parent taking care of one child.  She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy fish to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the fish business.

loans.use: to buy fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Guillermo; el tiene 45 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco y también el socio trabaja en construcción haciendo diferentes obras de construcción socio por medio de estos trabajos saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su carro para comprar algunos repuestos.                                            
             
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a member of the "Caminemos Juntas" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Guillermo is 45 years old, lives with his partner, and has three children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his transport business.  Guillermo owns a car which he uses to provide a taxi service in the streets of the city of Cusco.  He also works in construction, working on different construction projects.  Through these jobs, he manages to get his children ahead in life.  Guillermo would like to improve his taxi service.  He is requesting this loan to have maintenance work carried out on his car and to buy some spare parts.

Guillermo is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his car and to buy some spare parts

loans.name: Jivann

texts.es: Jivann, de 19 años; reside en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana), ahí formó su familia con Rosa, que desde hace un año. Y juntos están felices de recibir la pronta llegada su futura hija, que dentro de un mes nacerá. Desde niño se dedicó a apoyar a su madre en la agricultura principal actividad agrícola de la familia, desde entonces se dedicó al cuidado se los cultivos. Ya desde hace algún tiempo comenzó a independizarse de sus padres, ya que conformó su familia. Su principal actividad consta del trabajo de extracción de cítricos, café, siembra y macheteo de los cultivos en una hacienda agrícola muy importante de la zona. Su trabajó consta de lunes a viernes de las primeras horas del día hasta altas horas de la tarde. Pero consiente de sus necesidades y las carencias de su nueva familia. Los días domingos que descansa de su trabajó en la hacienda, se dedica a cosechar en otros terrenos agrícolas donde le pagan un dinero extra. Gracias a su buena disposición en el trabajó Jivann heredó de sus suegros una hectárea de terreno agrícola, donde está pensando sembrar por su propia cuenta. Asimismo construirá su casa en un pequeño espacio que le dio sus padres. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Futuro” y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Jivann, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales necesarios para mejorar su casa; asimismo en comenzar su siembra de café y plátanos.
texts.en: Jivann is 19 years old and he lives in the locality of Puente Paucartambo (central Peruvian jungle). There, he started his family with Rosa last year and together they are happy to soon welcome their daughter. She will be born in one month. Since he was a boy he has helped his mother in agriculture, as the primary agricultural activity of the family. Since then he has been in charge of cultivations. For some time now he has started to separate himself from his parents, as he has a family of his own. His primary activity consists of working in harvesting citric fruits, coffee, and to plant and prune the cultivation at a very important agricultural farm in the region. His work is from Monday to Friday, from the early morning hours to the late evening hours. But he is conscious of his needs and the needs of his new family. On Sundays he rests from his work at the farm and he harvests other agricultural farms to earn extra money. Thanks to his good work ethics, Jivann inherited from his parents-in-law a hectare of agricultural land where he is thinking on cultivating on his own account. He will also build a house on a small space given to him by his parents. He belongs to the communal bank "Luz del Futuro", meaning "Light of the Future" and it is the first loan he has with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He hopes his collaboration will help him to continue on with his goals. Jivann, on receipt of this support, will invest the funds he requested in the purchase of necessary materials to improve his house. He will also start his coffee and banana plantation.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build his house.

loans.name: Pera Group

texts.en: Marykyori is his late 20s and single. He has been running a business growing and selling fresh vegetables for three years.   He works from 6am to 4pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to extend his garden and grow more vegetables to sell. He has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for his vegetable garden. So he can grow more vegetables to sell. He will share this loan with his loan group "Pera" which has a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza mujer reconocida en la zona por su carisma.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ₡400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones), esto para obtener un equipo de computo para su negocio, el cual es una panadería. Es dueño de este negocio desde hace seis años  y todo lo ha llevado manualmente.
Ella agradece toda la ayuda que le puedan brindar para llevar la contabilidad propia de su negocio y agilizar el trabajo que necesita desarrollar para el bienestar de su familia y para dar un excelente servicio a su comunidad.
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bansuperafe S.A
texts.en:
Esperanza is a woman who is recognized in the area for her charisma. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 400,000 CRC so that she can obtain computer equipment for her business, a bakery. Esperanza has been the owner of this business for six years and does everything manually. She is grateful for all of the support given to her so that she can perform her own bookkeeping for her business and streamline her work. Esperanza wants to develop her business so that she can provide for the welfare of her family and offer excellent service to her community.

She is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of Bansuperafe, S.A.

loans.use: to purchase a computer so that she can perform the bookkeeping for her bakery business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow with two children. Her elder child is in college and the younger in high school.  She and her children manage their own household while operating a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one bottle of shampoo, a Php5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Susan gets supplies at wholesale prices and sells by the piece. Her store is located inside her house. At the same time she also manages an adjacent extension of their house as a room for rent. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 28,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of their room for rent. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Susan hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.  There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and for the maintenance of her room for rent

loans.name: Leakena

texts.en:
Leakena works in the factory with the husband. Their income is $7 per day. She has one child. He is 2 years old. 

Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 transportation and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $750 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work with her husband. 

She wants to raise animals at home to make another income when she can save enough money to buy them.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet lives in Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans). Juliet has a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 7 days a week. Juliet sells her products retail in a shop. Juliet has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. The main business challenges for Juliet include the rainy season which hinders customers from reaching her, thieves and transportation. Her business goals are to own a fully stocked salon and to buy a plot of land. Juliet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 3 children.  For the past 8 years, she has had a shop where she sells green & yellow bananas. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more green & yellow bananas to sell.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more green & yellow bananas to sell

loans.name: Santos Miguel

texts.es:
Santos Miguel es una persona servicial, humilde, comprometida con su trabajo y su familia, es ganadero, tiene 62 años de edad, viudo y padre de cinco hijos y cinco hijas, y reside en la comunidad de Arenales en el municipio de Trojes.

En el año de 1992 Don Santos inició su actividad ganadera comprando dos vacas para cubrir el consumo de leche en su casa. Luego de un tiempo al notar que las vacas que compró le daban la suficiente leche para el consumo en su casa decidió vender la leche que restaba y entonces poco a poco fue comprando una vaca mas hasta llegar a tener un hato ganadero. 

Don Santos realiza todas las actividades conciernientes al cuidado del ganado todos los dias desde muy temprano por la mañana. Parte de su hato ganadero es de engorge y el otro es lechero, asi que a parte de dedicarse a la venta de leche tambien vende carne. 

El prestamo que don Santos esta solicitando lo necesita para mejorar la calidad del pasto de su propiedad y tambien la raza de su ganado con la compra de varios toros y algunos terneros. Su sueño es tener mas de 30 vacas lecheras. 

Don Santos ha tenido tres prestamos en FAMA y ha realizado sus pagos de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Santos Miguel is a helpful, humble person, dedicated to his work and his family. The 62-year-old rancher is a widower and the father of five sons and five daughters. He lives in the Arenales community in Trojes municipality.

In 1992, Santos started working with livestock, buying two cows to cover his family's milk consumption. Later, after noticing that the cows he had bought gave sufficient milk for household consumption, he decided to sell the leftover milk, and bit by bit, went buying more cows until he had a full ranch.

Santos does everything related to the care of his livestock every day, beginning very early in the morning. Part of his herd is beef cattle, and part is dairy cows, so in addition to selling milk, he also sells meat.

The loan that Santos is applying for is in order to improve the quality of the pasture on his property, and also to improve his herd with the purchase of several bulls and calves. His dream is to have more than 30 dairy cows.

Santos has taken out three loans with FAMA, and he has made punctual payments on all his loans.

loans.use: to improve his pasture and purchase bulls and calves.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
