Sonia is a 37-year-old woman. She is married and has grown up children. 

Sonia raises and sells pigs, which helps her cover her family's expenses. 

Sonia wants to purchase feed for her pig; but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she wants to take a loan of PHP 7,000. 

When Sonia takes the loan, which is to be repaid on a weekly basis, she will able to purchase feed, vaccine and vitamins for the pig she is raising. 

She will be able to increase her family's income and create better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Alex Ouma

texts.en:
Alex is a 24 year old single man. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a a transport business where he provides transport services to the local people at Kakamega. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located along Lurambi-Kakamega road. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. 

Alex will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase a motorcycle. His business goal is to purchase more motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will purchase a van to serve more customers.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 38-year-old mother who has nine children. Her husband works in a governmental entity.

Aisha wanted to help her husband financially to be able to support their big family, so almost 5 years ago she and her husband opened  a small market selling kids snacks like chocolate, chips, ice cream, etc. Now Aisha wants to expand her business to include more items to what she sells such as rice, sugar, etc. to serve other age categories such as housewives.

loans.use: to include more items to what she sells such as rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jossefa

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane, de 43 anos solteira mãe de 2 filhos todos vão a Escola. Vive na casa própria com sua familia, não responsabiliza se por ninguem e consegue poupar 1.000.00mt na sua conta bancária. 

Muda se para o Distrito de Namaacha na companhia dos pais, trabalhou 3 anos numa Fábrica de Costura com as irmãs da Igreja Católica local. Anos depois inicia com seu próprio negócio. vende cocos no Mercado Informal Shoprite nas Quartas e Sabados e nos dias normais no Mercado Central. conta com ajuda da sua filha que lhe tem tomado conta do negocio, na sua ausência. 


Este é  o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume dos seus cocos. Os anteriores de 6.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt foram para o comércio. Esta confiante que vai pagar cem nunhum problema para aceder a mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
She was born in Inhambane. She is 43 years old and the mother of two children who attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns. She doesn't support anyone else and she is able to save 1.000mt in her bank account.
She moved to the district of Namaacha along with her parents. She worked for three years in a a sewing factory with the sisters of the local Catholic Church. Years later, she started her own business. She sells coconuts at the Shoprite Informal Market on Wednesdays and Saturdays and also at the Central Market on regular days. She gets help from her daughter, who oversees the business in her absence.
This is her third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 15.000mt, which she intends to use to increase the amount of coconuts. The first loans were for 6.000mt and 10.000mt, for her business. She is confident that she will repay without any problems so that she can obtain more loans.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for selling.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Analyn has a rice field where she grows rice that she sells as grains or rice per kilogram or sack. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

Analyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Analyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

loans.name: Jennifer Yuliana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen María se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Ciudad de clima cálido y con una variada  gastronomía.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jennifer, tiene 18 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 1 año de edad el cual requiere de muchos cuidados. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es una joven madre que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de su bebe se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja los fines de semana ya que en estos días su marido puede cuidar a su hijo mientras ella realiza sus recorridos ofreciendo y cobrando lo que tiene entregado, ya que ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez  que necesita. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal  tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado ya que con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya vive donde los suegros.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the Virgen María community bank meet in Montecristi canton (Portoviejo).  This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are well known both nationally and internationally.  This is a warm-climate city which has a rich cuisine.

Here we meet 18-year-old Jennifer who is married and has a one-year-old son who needs a lot of care.  Her husband is a builder.

Jennifer is a young mother who, in order to help her husband with their household expenses and their baby's expenses, sells all types of clothing.  She makes her sales door to door.  Jennifer works weekends as these are the days that her husband is able to care for their son while she makes her sales, collecting payment and leaving her goods on credit.  She collects payment every 8 days.  Jennifer buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to.  She has been in this business for one year and it is going well.

Jennifer will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.  She has been a member of her community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it for the help that she has received.  She used her first loan to start her business.

Jennifer's dream is to own her own home as she currently lives with her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothes

loans.name: Khakakho Group

texts.en:
Graham is the facilitator of the Khakakho group. Graham and his group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Graham takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Graham had an excellent maize yield harvesting seven and a half bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Graham was only able to harvest three and a half bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Graham and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Graham will educate his children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Khakakho group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
In the photograph above, Graham is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 46 years old and married with two children.  

Clarita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been in business for six years and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain it.  At this time, Clarita has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Clarita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Ms Hai is 49 years old with three children who are school age. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and raising poultry. She participated in the SEDA credit program in 2007 and used the loans for farming activity. Currently, she is raising chickens and oxen. For this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for her animals.

loans.use: to buy food to feed her animals.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business.

She sews clothes for her community clients. She is very skillful and her clients like her work very much and give her regular orders every month. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete the orders on time and increase her income.

Her husband sells clothes and operates his business from a little shop in the market. 

Jamila has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her daughters remain at home and help Jamila in her household work, while both sons work as laborers.

She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that an investment will be helpful for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BADEGNA  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TAGAN, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide   FATOU, 2 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de TAGAN, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Gulshahar

texts.ru:
Гулшахар  трудолюбивая женщина 49 лет. Она родилась и выросла  в семье колхозника. Она очень вежливая, добрая и порядочная  женщина.
Она рано вышла замуж, у неё пятеро детей. Вместе со своей  семьёй она живёт в деревне. Её муж трудовой мигрант в России. Её единственным источником дохода является животноводство.  Гулшахар  уже несколько лет занимается животноводством, у неё уже достаточно большое стадо овец, коров, коз и т. д. 
 Для того чтобы прокормить своё стадо, вырастить для  дальнейшей продажи  ей нужны деньги. И поэтому Гулшахар  обратилась в МДО Арванд для получения кредита. На деньги полученные в кредит она собирается купить корм для своего стадо.
texts.en:
Gulshahar is a hardworking woman. She is 49 years old. She was born and raised in a family of collective farmers. She is a very polite, kind and respectable woman. She got married early, and she has five children. She lives together with her family in a village. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. 

Animal husbandry is her only source of income. Gulshahar has already been working in animal husbandry for a few years, and she already has a sufficiently large herd of sheep, cows, goats, and so on. She needs money in order to feed her herd and breed them for further sales. Thus, Gulshahar has applied to MDO Arvand for a loan. She intends to buy feed for her herd with the loan.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more variety of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Helen has been in this business for 29 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe works with a Chilean artist who reproduces and enlarges photographs. She finds the clients for him, picks up the pictures and makes the deliveries. She must pay the artist in advance for many of the jobs, which gives her problems due to her lack of liquidity. She is seeking the loan in order to be able to ask for more jobs from the artist. She also wants to invest in a completely separate business. She once raised and sold chickens, and she is hoping to pick up this business again as a complimentary source of income.

Lupe is 45 years old and is married. She has 4 children, 2 of which have jobs but still live with her. Her husband has a part time job and is trying to finish his studies in agricultural engineering.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Pay in advance for picture reproductions

loans.name: Zacharias

texts.en:
Zacharias is a father of five children. With two previous loans, he succeeded in selling second-hand clothes and rearing pigs for food for his community. The extra income he made was used for paying school fees. The available palm cones, ever increasing demand for cooking fat (palm-oil), and the lack of equipment to produce a fraction of what is needed urged him to diversify his business. Given a loan of $200, he plans to buy a locally fabricated oil-pressing machine. 

He plans to repay his loan in 18 months. The first installment shall be due in the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Manufacturing and selling palm-oil

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Mrs. Ty P., 40 years old, is a mother of 5 children and lives in Kampongcham province, Cambodia. She makes about $8/ day in revenue by selling khmer traditional cakes and a variety of turnips. Her husband, meanwhile, helps to support the family by growing some crops and feeding fish on a farm. Three of their children work at the local garment factory, and the others are students. Ty P.  hopes to use the loan to purchase a piece of land to grow crops and to raise fish. She eventually hopes to invest in this land with a wider range of fruits and crops, especially turnips.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to grow crops and to raise fish.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil K. is thirty-seven years old and married with one child.  He was trained as a tailor in 1982 and was self-employed from 1986 until the civil war broke out in Sierra Leone.  After the war, he reorganized himself and started his business in 2002 in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone on a very small scale but could not progress due to lack of capital.  With his first loan from SMT, Khalil purchased some cotton fabric, buttons, etc. and then started getting more customers.  His business is improving and he is requesting a second loan of $175 to purchase more materials to continue to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase materials for his tailoring business

loans.name: Valentina Paulina

texts.es:
Agriculture and cattle are two of the activities that Valentina performs and she has great knowledge about. The dedication and effort that she put into them had to be put on a second plane when her husband suffered a terrible accident that left him disabled for twelve years.

Valentina made him receive innumerable treatments for him to recover his vitality and his desire to continue fighting, next to her, for her children.

Due to this unfortunate accident all the advances they had made from their joint work got reduced. Now, regardless of all the tough and sad moments they lived through, they have decided to start their business of agriculture and cattle to give their family a better quality of life.

Valentina is therefore requesting a $200 dollar loan that she compromises to return within six months. Valentina and her family thank and hope for your generous support.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La agricultura y ganadería son dos de las actividades que desempeña Valentina y de las cuales posee amplio conocimiento. La dedicación, empeño y esfuerzo que les había consagrado durante mucho tiempo, pasó a segundo plano cuando su esposo tuvo un terrible accidente que lo dejó inhabilitado por 12 años. Valentina hizo que recibiera innumerables tratamientos a fin de que recuperará su vitalidad y deseos de seguir luchando, junto a ella, por sus hijos. Debido a este infortunado hecho es que los avances que obtuvieron con el trabajo conjunto, se vieron disminuidos y ahora a pesar de los momentos muy tristes por los que tuvieron que atravesar, han decidido iniciar después de 12 años el proyecto de repotenciar su negocio agrícola y ganadero para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. A raíz de este hecho es que ella hace una solicitud de 200 dólares para impulsar su propósito con ayuda de su esposo e hijos y se compromete a retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Valentina y su familia agradecen y esperan tu generoso apoyo.

loans.use: Potentiating agriculture and cattle activities

loans.name: Silvino

texts.en:
Silvino Rios is 35 and married to Mirta Gonzalez. They have two children who are both enrolled in grade school. Since 1999 Silvino has run a kiosk from his house with the help of his lovely wife. They also opened a bakery two years ago where thay make all types of baked goods such as cookies, hamburger, hot dog rolls and so on.

Silvino is asking for a $1,025 loan in order to buy a industrial mixer. He also wishes to buy his flour products in bulk to lower his business expenses and earn a larger profit margin. His businesses are well-managed and with this loan he will be able to continue improving them.

loans.use: To buy an industrial mixer

loans.name: Wawat

texts.en: Wawat is 33 years old and has a child aged 16.  She sells kerosene and can earn US$10 per day. She also sells some spices such as pepper, garlic, etc. and puts them at the market and earns US$20 per day. Her husband, S., is an employee in Jakarta who earns US$40 per month. She has to work hard to earn extra income for the family. She requests IUS$125 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Thi Hau

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hau, 38 years old, has 4 children who are going to school. Her husband passed away. By borrowing $125 from Binh Minh CDC ( Kiva's Partner in Vietnam), she was able to sell meat in the market and increase her income to raise her children. Now she wants to borrow $150 more.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hậu, 38 tuổi, chồng mất, có 4 con còn đi học. Với số tiền 2006000 VNĐ vay theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binh Minh cdc, chị dùng để đi chợ bán thịt, tăng thu nhập để nuôi con nhỏ.

loans.use: to sell meat in the market

loans.name: Marach D(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Isa M.. She is currently in the business of selling irish potatoes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of potatoes. Isa is 40 years old, married, and has 6 children ranging in age from 3 to 20. Her children go to school. Each week, Isa makes approximately UGX 60000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Isa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Isa is joined in her small group by M. R., Evelyn A. and Issa S.. M. R. has a business selling new clothes and wants to increase her stock. Evelyn A. is currently operating a retail business and wants a loan to buy additional stock. Issa S. operates a business selling rice and wants a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Purchase more irish potatoes for sale

loans.name: Mpole's Ngagu Group

texts.en:
Mpole is 30 years old and married with 4 children (ages 3, 5, 7, and 9). He owns a small general store which he opened two years ago. He works at his shop from 6am to 11pm daily and now makes a monthly profit of about $45 from this business.

Mpole will use his share of the loan to buy more inventory for his shop. The other subgroup members have businesses dealing in clothing, fish and food sales. They ensure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his shop

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
A. Theresa is a hairdresser, and she also sells plastic bowls. She is a single parent of 2 children. Her income is not enough to meet the needs of her family. She wants to increase her income.

She is asking for a loan for $425 to buy more creams and other supplies to improve her services to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more creams and other supplies to improve her services to her customers

loans.name: Kouroka Group

texts.fr:
The Kouroke group is based in Ile de Carabane and intends to pursue commercial activity in the field of selling fresh and processed fish. Our village is full of potential in terms of seafood products which, once appropriately treated, could be a sustainable source of income for women and children. It is in this setting that we have come to ask for a loan with Kiva and SEM to be able to put in motion the marketing of the products fished by the villagers. We hope to be able to export our products using modern means to other regions of Senegal and to neighbouring countries, where there is always high demand thanks to the scarcity of fish in those areas.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupe Kouroka est installé dans l'Île de Carabane et compte mener des activités commerciales dans le genre de vente de poisson transformé et frais. Notre village a plein de potentialité en matière de produits halieutiques qui une fois bien traitées, pourrait être une source de revenu durables pour les femmes et les jeunes. C'est dans ce cadre que nous sommes venues solliciter auprtès de Kiva et SEM un prêt pour pouvoir nous activer dans la commercialisations de ces produits qui sont pêchés par les villageois. Nous comptons pouvoir ,d'une façon très moderne, exporter nos produits vers d'autres régions du Sénégal et dans les pays limitrophes, où une forte demande se fait tous les jours à cause de la rareté de poissons dans ces localités.

loans.use: To buy processed seafood products

loans.name: Ikenkechukwu

texts.en: Ikenkechukwu U. is 29 years old and married with no children. He runs a shop where he sells food. He also has a motorcycle, which he uses for transportation. Ikenkechukwu studied his trade for five and half years before opening his shop five years ago. He has applied for a loan of $1,200 to buy more food to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
The business of preparing and selling food requires a lot of hard work since one must work in high temperature conditions in the kitchen and also be aware of food preparation at all times so that they are made in the highest quality.

Aware of this fact, Mrs. Gertrudis J. puts a lot of effort into her prepared food business in her hometown of El Viejo. She has come to Ceprodel with the goal of obtaining a credit loan that will allow her to buy supplies to be used in food making.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos requiere de mucho sacrificio por la razón de que se debe trabajar a altas temperaturas en la cocina y además se debe de estar pendiente de la preparación de los alimentos en todo momento para que sena elaborados con una alta calidad.

Consciente de esto, la señora Gertrudis Juárez se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de elaboración y venta de comida en el municipio de El Viejo de donde es originaria. Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama M., aged 64 and married with five children in her care, has been a member of the Belfort Village Bank for four years. Her business consists of buying and selling palm oil and stocking up on hibiscus, lemons and monkey bread (the fruit from the baobab tree) to make fruit juices and creams. She is contributing towards improving the children's living conditions and schooling. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariama M., 64 ans mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 4 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre de l’huile de palme et de s’approvisionner en bissap, citron, et pain de singe pour faire des jus de fruit et des crèmes. Elle participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie et de scolarité de ses enfants. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Sales of palm oil, hibiscus, cream and lemons

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 33 years old. She is divorced with 3 children aged 15, 12, and 10 years old. She is a soup, potatoes, and clothes seller. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mwanahamis is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: El señor Wilson N., tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, le tiene dos hijos con edades comprendidas entre los tres y un año de edad, no estudian todavia, su esposa no trabaj de manera directa en su lugar le ayuda a ver los negocio a  su esposo, teniendo dos actividades, una pulperia que es la principal fuente de ingresos y un ciber siendo su segunda fuente de ingresos del hogar. Este señor tiene como proposito poder adquirir mas computadoras  e instalar un ciber con todos los equipos a fin de cubrir la demanda del sector ya que es uno de los barrios mas nuevos que estan surgiendo donde tiene ubcado su negocio, este señor tiene dos años de deicarse a esta actividad, el anteriormente vivia en Matagalpa pero se caso aca en leon y aqui a formado su familia, Con el financiamiento pretende invertirlo en la pulperia y poco a poco ir mejorando las condiciones de los negocios, de esta manera darles condiciones economicas a su familia y salir adelante con el apoyo de nuestra institucion y de aquellas manos amigas que buscan apoyar las ideas de negocios.
texts.en:
Wilson is 40 years, married and has two children ages 3 and 1. His wife does not have a job but she helps oversee his businesses. He has two of them: a convenience store is his main source of income and an internet cafe is another source. Wilson intends to acquire more computers and set up the internet cafe with all the amenities so he can meet demand since it's in one of the newest and fastest growing neighborhoods. He's been involved in the business for two years. Previously he was living in Matagalpa, but he got married in Leon and started his family there. With the loan he expects to invest in the convenience store and little by little improve the business' conditions, and this way he can improve his family's economic situation as well and make headway with the support of Kiva and the friendly hands looking to support his business ideas.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to the convenience store

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Akhtar baji, the wife of A. S., lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house where she has lived for the past 20 years. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. Her son has a paint shop where he sells paints. Her eldes daughter is in the 8th standard grade. Her younger daughter is in the 3rd standard grade. 

Naseem baji’s husband is a fruit seller by profession and has been selling fruit for the past 20 years. He buys fruit from fruit markets. Naseem baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

Naseem baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe-selling business. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy candies to sell in shops. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothing.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to resell

loans.name: Gatiba

texts.en: Gatiba (her son is pictured) is a mother of 4 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region, Kurdmahmudlu village. She was born in 1954. Seven years ago they started a cattle breeding business. Now, they need a loan to buy 2 calves to improve their cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S., 32, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her three children. She works in a grocery store, making around $5 US each day while her husband makes around $5 US each day as a motor-taxi driver. Inflation has caused prices to soar in Cambodia and recent hikes in oil and rice prices have made for economic struggles for many Cambodians. Looking for ways to increase her income and combat rising expense costs, Seng S. has asked CREDIT for a loan of $600 US to add to her grocery’s inventory. She sees this loan as an opportunity to increase her income and to expand her business.

loans.use: To add to her grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Siendo madre de seis hijos, Jovita siempre se vio en la necesidad de buscar un ingreso económico extra en la familia. Lo que ganaba su esposo nunca era suficiente para mantenerlos a todos. Es así que desde hace veinticinco años ella ha tenido que trabajar en diferentes cosas; vendiendo chupetes, cerveza, gaseosa, verduras, etc.

Actualmente, Jovita con sesentaisiete se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño puesto ambulante cerca a su casa. Ella cuenta que las ganancias las dedica en los gastos básicos de su hogar. Ya tiene a sus seis hijos mayores así que solo se ocupa por ahora de su salud y de mantener su casa.  

Por las noches continua vendiendo comida, pero ya dentro de su casa por la seguridad.
texts.en:
As a mother of six children, Jovita always had to seek extra income for her family. Her husband's income was never enough to provide for everybody. So, for the past 25 years, Jovita has had to work different jobs, such as selling baby bottles, beer, soda, vegetables, etc. Currently, Jovita is 67 years old, and sells food at a small stand near her home. She mentioned that her sales profits are spent on basic household items. As her six children are now grown, Jovita is only occupied by her health and maintaining her home. In the evenings she continues selling food, but inside her home for reasons of safety.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for her business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha M. owns a neighborhood store. She sells a variety of goods that brighten her customer's lives and provide them with something good to eat. “I am dreaming of having a grocery store business someday," she said. “I want to do my very best to help my family and send my children to school." she added.

Her business is located next to her house near the San Jose elementary school. She is lucky to have the school so close to her store, because the students provide Editha with regular business and income. Editha is asking for a CEVI loan of 21,000 PHP to purchase meat, vegetables, and various goods for her store.

CEVI helps entrepreneurs like Editha to grow their businesses. CEVI provides credit assistance, training, and insurance services to their clients.

loans.use: Purchase meat, vegetables, and goods to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth H. is 54 years old and is currently residing at Polo, Dapitan City. Her husband is a government employee and they have one child. She noticed that food vending is in demand in their town, so she began to engage in this business and started selling 3 kinds of food. Later on, she wanted to expand but her capital was not great enough to open up an eatery. Hearing good things about Paglaum MPC, she automatically registered for membership on December 26, 2007. She diligently paid back her first loan, and now because she would like to expand her eatery business, she is requesting 50,000 Php. The loan will be helpful to her in buying additional spices and food for the business. She is very excited at the outcome of her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 36 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos; Esteban de 11 y Katherin de 10 años. Actualmente espera otro bebé y está muy feliz por ello, ella y su familia viven en su casa propia. Siempre ha sido emprendedora para realizar todo tipo de negocio, pero ya que sus hijos aún estan pequeños y viene otro en camino, ha optado desde hace 3 meses por trabajar en la venta de productos de belleza desde su casa, gracias a su buen trato y su capacidad de persuasión ha obtenido una gran cantidad de clientela en su vecindario. Es así que muchas vecinas y amigas suyas vienen a solicitar los productos que ofrece por catálogo. Desde hace 10 años atrás tenía un puesto en el mercado de venta de jugos, pero por los cuidados que debe tener en el embarazo lo dejó y se dedicó netamente a la venta de productos de belleza, pero cuando su bebé nazca y ella se encuentre mejor poder reiniciar su negocio de venta de jugos pero en un local mucho más grande y estable para generar mayores ingresos a su hogar. Juana tiene varios años con MFP, pero este es su primer préstamo en un grupo más pequeño conformado por ella y con dos amigas, con las cuales se lleva muy bien y son muy puntuales en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, y quiere aumentar las ventas para generarse mayores ingresos, ya que su bebé está pronto en llegar.
texts.en:
Juana is 36 years old, married and has two children, Esteban, 11 and Katherin, 10. She is currently expecting a new baby and is very happy about it. She and her family live in their own house. She has always been entrepreneurial and in many types of businesses, but since her children are still young with another on the way, she decided 3 months ago to work selling beauty products from her house and thanks to her good customer care and persuasion abilities she has managed to obtain a large client base in her neighborhood. Many neighbors and friends of hers come to request the products that she offers via catalog. Ten years ago she had a booth in market selling juices, but due to her pregnancies she stopped and dedicated herself solely to selling beauty product, but when this baby is born and she finds herself better able she wants to restart the juice business but in a larger and more stable locale to generate higher income for her household. Juana has been with MFP for several years, but this is her first loan in a smaller group consisting of herself and two other friends, with whom she gets along really well and are puncual in their payments. With the requested loan she will buy a larger quantity of beauty products and would like to increase her sales to generate more income, since her baby will be arriving soon.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise of beauty products

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Madame Georgette ANAYADRI a pour activité la vente de pagnes, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2006 à Nukafu, son point d’approvisionnement est le grand marché de lomé. Elle veut agrandir son stock raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier cycle de prêt qui lui permettrai d’acheter des pièces de pagnes de haute qualité. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est  un conducteur de Taxi, avec le revenu qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle aide son mari dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
Ms. Georgette ANAYADRI works in the business of selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She has been in this business since 2006 in Nukafu. The grand marketplace of Lomé is where she acquires her supplies. She wants to expand her inventory, which is why she’s requesting her first loan from WAGES. This loan will enable her to buy bolts of high quality pagnes. She is married to a gentleman who is a taxi driver. With the revenues she earns from her commerce, she helps her husband with day-to-day household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es: El Sr. Isidoro S. G. tiene un pequeño taller de satreria hace 23 años, este opera bajo el nombre de Satreria S., su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion y es atendido por el y su esposa donde confeccionan ropa de varon y de damas para toda ocacion siendo una de las especialidades los pantalones y camisas de varon. el Sr. S. es muy conocido por su espiritu de superacion y conducta moral, honestidad, en este momento nos comento que este oficio le ha generado los ingresos en su hogar para poder sacar adelante a su familia dandoles estudio a sus hijos que hoy en dia son profesionales.
texts.en:
Mr. Isidoro S. G. has had a small tailor shop for 23 years which operates under the name of S. Tailor Shop. His business is located in his home and is run by him and his wife where they make clothing for men and women for all occasions. Their specialties are pants and shirts for men. Mr. S. is very well known for his spirit of self-improvement and his moral conduct and honesty. He told us that this profession has generated the income for his home to be able to move his family ahead, educating his children so that today they are professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and sewing accessories

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
Thuỷ Hoàng Thị makes a living primarily from raising cattle for sale. She is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xuong. She is married and has three adult children. Thuỷ has just started this business and earns approximately 500,000 VND a month.

In 2005, Thuỷ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her situation and enable her to engage in business activities. Thuỷ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Thuỷ is now requesting a loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her fifth loan from TYM Fund. Thuỷ plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

No. 1434050976.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Hoyo Del Toro 1 Group

texts.en:
Hoyo del Toro is a small community on the side of the road to San Pedro de Macoris. Yicer A. (group coordinator) is married to Filiberto Heredia and they have 4 children. Yicer sells different kinds of food. Her best selling items are mabi (a Dominican drink made of boiled roots) and sorbet-like ice cream. With summertime approaching, she expects these sales to pick up, so Yicer will use this loan to buy fruit and plastic bags for the ice cream, and bottles for the mabi drink, along with the roots to make it. Yicer expects her sales to allow her to expand her business and make it into a cafeteria. Yicer wants to see her children choose a profession freely, graduate and have successful lives in the workforce. 

Please help us support Yicer's dream, along with the other entrepreneurs in this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase food items to sell more portions.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is engaged in a food vending business. The business has become a big help in supporting the education of her children. She is married to Romeo, who is a farmer, and they have nine children. One is already married, two are working and helping them earn a living, three are still in school, and some are still young. Having a big family is not that easy, Concepcion says, because it is accompanied by great responsibilities. 

She is thankful that she has been able to maintain her food vending business in their village. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request to borrow 7,000 PHP to further develop her business. Through the added capital, she will be able to increase her daily income, and she looks forward to being able to support the educational needs of all her children. Concepcion also dreams of expanding her business into a typical store in the future.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Salma M. from Mwanza. She is married, with five children between the ages of 5 and 11 years old.

Salma has been running a café business since 2008. Her business is called Café/Mama Lishe. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.

Salma works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. She currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase potatoes and wheat flour. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Salma thanks you for your support!


About SELFINA: 
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and wheat flour

loans.name: Yar Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Y. M. is the group leader of Y. M. group. There are five members in this group and each of them would like to receive money for their business. Therefore, they have requested a group loan of 50,000 Afghani. 

Y. M. wants to take a loan for his business as a taxi driver.

M. Hasham and Laylama want to take a loan for their general store businesses.

A. kafell wants to take a loan for his metal-shop business. He has just begun his business wants to develop it.

Zowjana wants to take a loan for her beading business.

They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan and thank AFSG and Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for his business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna S. is from Binuangan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married to Norberto and they have six children, all of whom are in school. She is a new member of PAGLAUM MULTI-PUPOSE COOPERATIVE. Myrna decided to join PMPC because of the loan facilities and other incentives for members. She reached MPC for her capital needs. She has applied for a PHP 3,000 loan to buy farm fertilizers. She deeply wishes that their family's living condition will improve and with a good farm harvest.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her farm

loans.name: Erick Otieno

texts.en:
Erick Otieno is thirty one years and married to Lilian. They have three children aged 7, 5 and 3. He runs a shoe selling business and is assisted by his wife. He's been in this business for the last three years. Erick buys shoes from vendors in Nairobi and sells them for a profit in Migori, a populous town.

Erick learned about KADET Ltd from a friend who is an existing client. This is his first loan. He is excited about the loan and has ambitions to grow the scale of his business. He intends to use the loan to increase stock in readiness for the school re-opening and the approaching festive season, when he expects to make great sales.

He harbors a dream to expand his business and start importing expensive shoes, thereby changing his target market and profits.

------------ About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Increase stock of shoes.

loans.name: Soronzonbold

texts.en:
Soronzonbold Banzrach is a 43-year-old man and lives with his wife and 18-year-old daughter. He currently lives with his family in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. This is Soronzonbold's second Kiva loan. He took his first Kiva loan to purchase spare parts for his truck. But he needed more funds to repair his truck engine and other parts. Thus he is requesting a greater loan. He is a XacBank (Kiva's partner Microfinance institution) repeat client.

Soronzonbold has been in the trucking business since 1998. He owns an old Russian truck that he uses for carrying freight between his city and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family is very supportive of his business and helps whenever he needs some help.

Soronzonbold says that he works hard to make sure that his daughter receives good education without any financial strain. Further, he dreams of exchanging his old truck for a new, powerful one.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his truck

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es: José Mauricio V. A. reside en la capital de El Salvador. José tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposa, sus tres hijos, una sobrina y su madre. José lleva consigo una gran responsabilidad al velar por el bienestar y estabilidad económica de su familia, el se dedica a su negocio, una panadería que surte a muchas tiendas de los alrededores y colonias cercanas, José necesita de su automóvil para movilizar con eficiencia sus productos a sus clientes, el crédito que solicita es para su carro; ya que la caja de velocidades se ha arruinado y necesita cambiarla.

loans.use: Reparacion de su automovil

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
Ludith tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy amable y alegre, vive en su cada propia, es soltera y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

La vida de Ludith ha sido muy difícil, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar mucho para poder mantenerse. Con el tiempo, su arduo trabajo dio frutos y poco a poco pudo construir una casa con un patio enorme, el cual ahora ha convertido en una cochera donde guarda los carros de sus vecinos y en este negocio le va muy bien, ya que por día guarda cerca de 20 carros.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de tiempo para realizar sus tareas domesticas, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse en la madrugada para atender a algunos de sus clientes que desean guardar su carro. 

Para más adelante, Ludith anhela poner una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil quinientos soles que ahora solicita planea arreglar su cochera para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ludith is a kind, cheerful, single, 55-year-old woman who lives in her own home and more than anything else wishes to have a peaceful old age. Ludith's life has been very difficult since she has had to work to support herself from a very early age. With time, her hard work yielded some benefits and little by little she was able to build her house with a large yard which she has now turned into a car port where she lets her neighbors store their cars. This is a profitable business for her since she can store nearly 20 cars daily. She has been doing this for 8 years and what she most likes about her job is that it allows her time to do her domestic chores and believes that the most difficult aspect of it is having to get up at dawn sometimes to attend to some of her customers who wish to store their car. In the future, Ludith would love to have a grocery store which would produce better income. This is her second loan with MFP and she expects to repay it on time since she doesn't want to cause the other members of the communal bank any problems where whe is held in high regard thanks to the discipline she imposes on the group. With the 1,500 soles she requests she plans to improve her car port so as to provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her car port.

loans.name: Vianca Vanessa

texts.es: Vianca es una mujer colaboradora y alegre, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 24 años y es madre de un menor, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, pues cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es jefe de almacén de una tienda de repuestos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “La Lupuna”, desde hace 3 años, el primer préstamo fue de 300 soles que  utilizó para invertir en productos para su bodega, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de abarrotes y bebidas para  vender en su bodega. La meta de Vianca es tener una distribuidora de gaseosas.
texts.en:
Vianca, 24, is a cheerful, cooperative woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has one child and sells groceries from a store that she has set up in her home. Her husband, who is the warehouse manager at a replacement parts store, supports her. She has been a member of the "La Lupuna" communal bank for the past 3 years. Her first 300 sol loan was used to buy inventory for her store and she needs a 1500 sol loan to buy more inventory items, groceries and beverages, to sell. Vianca's goal is to be a soft-drink distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and beverages.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and maize flour and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.  Grace is 25 years old and is married.  Her husband is a car driver. They have two children who attend school.  With the extra profits she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

About BRAC:
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Muyumbu Kagara Provia Group

texts.en: K. Provia, who represents her group, is 48 years old and married with 14 children, all of whom attend school. She also has two other dependents who are in school. K. Provia is a farmer and she has been a farmer for over 28 years. She is using the loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and so forth, for planting. She is hardworking and active. Her dream is to educate her children and improve upon her farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farming supplies

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es:
José P. de 27 años de edad, vive en el sector de la Perimetral de Guayaquil,  cuenta en su vivienda con agua, alcantarillado, luz y caminos pavimentados su casa es de ladrillos pero quiere seguir construyéndola, José se dedico a la venta de víveres hace ya muchos años atrás ya que vio que todos sus familiares han tenido negocios similares y han sido prosperados e independientes y el decidió que fuera igual su futuro.

Ahora José trabaja en su tienda desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h00 de lunes a domingo, comprar arroz a $ 0.25 la libra y la vende a $ 0.30, colas a $ 0.28 y las vende a $ 0.35 c/u y aceites a $ 1.80 y los vende a $ 2.20 c/u una de las mayores dificultades es la delincuencia ya que no dejan que la tienda prospere, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio a veces pero para sacar mas ingresos para su familia ella se dedica a la venta de legumbres, no tienen hijos porque primero quieren asegurar su futuro.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz a $ 25.00 cada quintal, aceites a $ 22.00 cada caja y colas a $ 8.50 cada jaba, en el futuro poner otro local y seguir con su  negocio para poder asegurar el futuro de su familia y terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
José P. is 27 years old and lives in the area surrounding Guayaquil. He has water, sewage, and electricity at his home, and a paved road in front of it. His house is made of brick but he would like to continue building it. José started selling produce a long time ago after seeing all of his relatives prosper and become independent with similar businesses. José decided he wanted the same future. Today, José works at his store from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. seven days a week. He buys rice at $0.25 a Lb. and sells it at $0.30; soft drinks at $0.28 and sells them at $0.35 each; and oils at $1.80 and sells them at $2.20 each. One of the biggest problems is crime, which impedes the store from getting ahead. Sometimes, José's wife helps out with the business, but to help increase the family income, she sells vegetables. They don't have any kids because they want to have a secure future first. With the loan he is requesting, José wants to buy rice at $25.00 per "quintal" (46 Kg); oils at $22.00 per box; and soft drinks at $8.50 per crate. He would like to start another store and continue with his business to ensure a good future for his family and to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, soft drinks, and oils

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is thirty-six years old, is single, and has no child. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercially dominated community. She is a hardworking young woman.

Comfort is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves). She hawks to sell (goes door-to-door) and also sells by the roadside in her community.

Comfort procures bags of maize (corn) and other ingredients from nearby communities. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure maize in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy K. is a businesswoman. She is 45 years old. She owns a retail shop and has worked in this business for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as soap, rice, maize flour, sugar, sweets, bread, drinks like soda, milk, water, and so forth to meet her clients’ demands. Her future dream is expanding her shop to wholesale.

loans.use: Purchase retail items such as soap, rice, maize flour, sugar, sweets, bread, drinks like soda, milk, water, etc.

loans.name: Elsy Guadalupe

texts.es: Elsy Guadalupe V. D. L. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilopango, departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Elsy posee una tienda D. productos perecederos en su propia casa D. habitación, negocio en el cual se encarga D. comercializar productos D. primera necesidad. Este negocio nació con la esperanza D. poder obtener ganancias extras, a través D. las cuales fuera posible brindarle estudios a sus hijos y así mismo una vida mejor. Elsy solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos perecederos, aumentado la cantidad D. los que ya posee y obteniendo nuevos, D. esta manera ella podrá obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales sean D. gran beneficio para sus hijos y para todo su hogar, ya que será posible contar con una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Elsy Guadalupe V. D. L., age 42, lives in Ilopango in the San Salvador department. She lives with her husband and two children. The children go to school. Elsy has a store, which carries perishable products, in her own house. She sells basic needs products. This business was born with the hope of being able to get extra income to give her children an education and a better life. Elsy is asking for a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of perishable products. That will increase the quantity that she has and add new products. That way she will be able to get greater earnings, which will be of great benefit to her children and the whole household. It will then be possible to have economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable products

loans.name: Ta Marr Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Ta Marr' group from the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have applied for a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders of SLL 500,000 for each person in order to expand their businesses in size and quality. 

Forty-five-year-old Kumba T. is the leader and head of this group of entrepreneur. Born in Magburaka town, she is married to a subsistence farmer and they have 6 children. Two of her children are already married and 4 are attending secondary school. For many years now, Kumba has been selling chains, earrings, and cosmetics. With her share of the loan, she will invest in jewelry and cosmetics. 

(On the right in the photo is Loan Officer, Abdul Karim C., handing over the loan during disbursement.)

loans.use: Buy jewelry and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Amida

texts.en: Amida A. is 27 years old. She was born in Sokodé, in the center of Togo and now lives in the Agoé district of Lomé. She is married to a technician and has one child. Mrs. A. purchases grocery products from the Grand Marché in Lomé, and then sells the products outside of her home. She began this business in 2006 and is now requesting her first loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase two sacks of rice, two boxes of powdered milk, and dried gombo, a fruit used in a popular Togolese dish served with smoked fish.

loans.use: To purchase rice, powdered milk, and local fruit

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn O. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Marilyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie E. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Norie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Norie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Norie has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Norie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Norie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Norie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto chijini de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja en una empresa pública como secretaria.

 El crédito que solicita es para pagar la consulta médica de su señor padre el cual esta enfermo y no cuenta con seguro medico.

Es la primerva vez que solicta crédito en Impro y  por el carácter social del mismo, Lourdes puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives in her parents' home in the Alto Chijini area of the city of La Paz; she works in a public company as a secretary. She is seeking a loan to pay for medical help for her elderly father who is sick and has no health insurance. This is the first time she is seeking a loan through Impro, and due to her social character, Lourdes should receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical consultation and medicine for her father who has no health insurance

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Collana Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Santa de Rosa de Collana”, actualmente se encuentra en el VI ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El banco comunal está representado por los socios; Erika Maritza es la presidenta, Florencia es la secretaria, Jeannete es la tesorera y Deivis es la fiscal. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en la comunidad de Collana del distrito de San Jerónimo del departamento de Cusco. 
       
Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta de comestibles, venta de anticuchos, elaboración de bordados y estandartes, venta de chicha, cerveza y gaseosas, venta de comida, crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Otros socios brindan servicio de taxi y sastrería. 

Remigia, tiene 47 años, tiene seis hijos y vive en la comunidad de Collana. 

Remigia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Santa de Rosa de Collana”  somos 13 integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Su actividad económica principal de la señora Mercedes es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, ella tiene un pequeño corral donde tiene 75 cuyes y varias gallinas que se encuentra en su domicilio. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Su actividad económica complementaria es la agricultura, ella alquila un terreno para sembrar papa, maíz y otros productos más. Remigia requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para los animales como por ejemplo forraje y también va comprar pollitos para criar.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa de Collana community bank is currently in its sixth loan cycle. It is made up of hardworking and enterprising people who are always seeking opportunities to get ahead in life, and to provide their children with a brighter future by working hard every day. The following people are members of the community bank: Erika Maritza is the president, Florencia is the secretary, Jeannete is the treasurer and Deivis is the auditor. The members get together every month in the community of Collana, San Jerónimo district, in Cusco department. Members have jobs in different fields. For example, some sell food, some sell anticuchos (Peruvian kebab); others do embroidery or make banners. Some sell chicha (drink made from corn), beer, and soft drinks; others raise animals such as chickens or guinea pigs. Some members drive a taxi or are seamstresses. 47-year old Remiga has six children and lives in the community of Collana. She tells us: “In the Santa Rosa de Collana community bank, there are thirteen of us. They chose me as their representative to give information about my work." Her main job is raising animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She has a small pen in her house in which she keeps 75 guinea pigs and several chickens. She’s had this business for two years and it’s doing well. Remiga also does some farming. She rents a piece of land and grows potatoes, corn, and other produce. Remiga needs a loan to buy food such as fodder for the animals and also young chickens to raise.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animal food

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is from the village of Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 56 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Anita owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Anita has been involved in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Anita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma A. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 52 years old. Vilma is married and has three school-aged children. Vilma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Meissa

texts.fr:
Voilà 15 ans que Monsieur Meissa D. fait du commerce après une courte expérience d’apprenti chauffeur. La vente de mil, arachide ou de niébé l’intéresse le plus et il les place en gros à ses clients. 
Agé de 44 ans, Monsieur D. est à sa deuxième demande de crédit et sollicitait 250 000 FCFA pour compléter son approvisionnement.
texts.en:
Mr. Meissa D. has been is sales for 15 years after a brief stint as an apprentice driver. He focuses primarily on millet, peanuts, and black-eyed peas, which he often sells to his customers in bulk. This is the second loan application for Mr. D., age 44. He is seeking a credit of 250,000F CFA to supplement his stocks.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on supplies

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James T. is a fifty-year-old teacher as well as a businessman. He is married to a teacher with five children: two are in primary school and the other three are in secondary school.

James established a bar business three years back when he noticed that he needed another source of income to support his family. His bar is located in Njai Town, Bo. His college teachers and other people in the Njai town community spend their leisure time in his bar, particularly in the evening.

James has a good loan repayment history. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL so that he can fully stock his bar as he has more customers now, including his colleague teachers who love to spend more time at the bar.

James believe that the proceeds from this loan will help him provide livelihood for his family, educate his children and enable him to start to building a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for his bar

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie R. is from the village of Centro Sur, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 58 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Tessie owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Tessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Tessie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 57 year old widowed woman and mother of one child.  She works selling coffee in a nearby school. Siham started this work in 1995, after her husband’s death, in order to raise her only daughter and to insure a secure life. Siham is proud of herself and of what she achieved until now

This is her sixth loan with Al Majmoua and she’s requesting a loan in order to buy necessary merchandise for her business. She hopes to open a coffee shop in the future as she likes this business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana A. García tiene sesenta y cinco años, vive en Santa Catarina Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Esteban Reyes López, en total tuvo diez hijos quienes todos ya están casados, en su poder tiene a una nieta de nueve años Lithiel Reyes Hernández que cursa  el cuarto grado en la primaria.

    Ella  se dedica a la venta de quesos desde hace diesi ocho años  y  otros productos como son: pinol blanco elaborado de maíz, plátano, hoja de plátano para tamales entre otros, lo cual comenta que la va muy bien con esta actividad y que la asacado de apuros con los gastos de su hogar.

    Su inspiración por este tipo de trabajo, comenzó cuando Hera muy joven ya que ayudaba a su mama a vender en el mercado y cuando se cado dejo de practicarlo, pero cuando se vio en la necesidad comenzó de nuevo y gracias a dios le ha dado buen resultado.

    Con las ganancias que obtiene de su venta, se surte de nuevo para obtener mejores ingresos cada día y para que su clientela adquiera lo que busca para su hogar.

   Su seño es tener trabajo mientras dios le preste  vida  y a horrar para apoyar a su nieta a que termine una carrera y tenga buenos inicios en  la vida, teniendo un buen trabajo para que pueda Salir adelante siendo independiente.

  Juana formo el grupo con sus con pañera ya que le intereso mucho como se trabaja en el programa y se animaron a pertenecer a dicho grupo llamado santa María la razón del nombres por que donde se ubica el grupo se llama santa María.

   Las personas que integran en el grupo son la siguiente:
Juana A. García: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de quesos, como también frutas para venderlo en el mercado.

   Amparo Villarreal M.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de quesos, como  también compra frutas para venderlo en la misma región.

   Aurora Sánchez C.: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de carnes variadas, viceras para venderlo en l misma región.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana A. García is 65 years old. She lives in Santa Catarina, Copainala municipality, Chiapas state, México. She is married to Mr. Esteban Reyes López. She had a total of 10 children who are all married now. She has a nine year old granddaughter, Lithiel Reyes Hernández, in her care who is in fourth grade. She has sold cheese for the last 18 years. She also sells other products like: white pinol (a drink made from corn), bananas, banana leaves for tamales, among others. She tells us that she does quite well in this work since it has solved many difficulties regarding household expenses. Her inspiration for this kind of work started when she was quite young for she helped her mother sell in the market. When she married she stopped doing but when she found herself in need she started up again and thanks to God it has had good results. With profits from her sales she stocks up again to earn daily income and so that her customers can find what they are seeking for their homes. Her dream is to have work while God gives her life and to save to support her granddaughter until she finishes a career and has a good start in life, having a good job that she can go forward with and be independent. Juana formed the group with her fellow members because she was very interested in the way the program works and they were encouraged to belong to the group called Santa María, so called because that’s the name of the place it’s located in. The group members are: Juana A. García who will use the loan to buy and sell cheeses as well as fruits in the market; Amparo Villarreal M. who will use the loan to buy and sell cheeses as well as fruits to sell in the same region and Aurora Sánchez C. who will use the loan to buy assorted meats and offal to sell in the same region.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk for cheese making as well as to buy regional products like: banana leaves and chayote, among others.

loans.name: Seidy

texts.es: Seidy tiene la edad de 37 años, es casada, y tiene trés hijos de 10, 15, y 18 de edad. Ella quiere comprar cerdos para el engorde. Ya cuenta con un local adecuado para el engorde de los lechones. Está el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera de tener más ingresos para invertir y con las ganacias brindarle a sus hijos una mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Seidy, 37, is married and has three children who are 10, 15 and 18 years of age.  She wants to buy pigs to raise.  She already has a site that is adequate for piglet raising.

This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the terms offered.  She hopes to have more income to invest and to use the profits to provide her children with better economic stability.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Tas-Wop N' Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
