Mrs. Isatu K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 45 years ago in one of the villages that makes up Sanda, Isatu is married and has four children.  For many years now, Isatu has been selling palm oil (the favorite cooking oil), vegetable oil, fish, etc.  Isatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business. She will buy palm oil, vegetable oil and fish in large quantity. 

This is not the first loan that Isatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this new loan however, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower, Fatu K., who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy palm oil, vegetable oil and fish in large quantity

loans.name: La Loma De San Juan Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama La Loma de San Juan porque  la casa  de reunión se realiza en una loma en la localidad de san Juan,  el grupo está formado por 11 personas.La señora rosa Hernández  es casada tiene tres hijos, es la presidenta del grupo, la actividad a la que se dedica es la siembra de maíz, lo ocupa hasta que está convertido en mazorca listo para nixtamal, posteriormente elabora tortillas de comal, menciona que tiene a sus clientes por lo que la mitad de sus ventas son puros pedidos, así mismo tiene un puesto colocado en una población cercana a su casa. También se dedica a la siembra de frijol, lo desenvaina y lo vende por medios kilos. La clienta nos comenta que con las ganancias de la venta de sus tortillas y el frijol espera seguir ayudando a su esposo para darle escuela a sus hijos y sean personas de provecho.
texts.en: This group is called the Hill of San Juan because they meet on a hill in the town of San Juan.  The group is made up of 11 people.  Rosa Hernández is married and has three children.  She is the president of the group and grows corn.  When they are ready, the ears of corn are treated with lime, and are then used to make tortillas on a griddle.  She has customers, and half of her sales are orders.  She also has a stand located in a town near her house.  In addition, she grows beans, shells them, and sells them by the half kilo.  She tells us that with the earnings from the sale of her tortillas and beans she hopes to continue to help her husband give their children an education so they will be successful.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 30 years old. She is married and has four children who are between three and ten years old. All her children are enrolled in school except the youngest. Her husband works as a stonemason. Jeanne has a restaurant business. She has been doing this business for a period of five years. 

Jeanne would like to get a loan to purchase more utensils and other food and beverages to sell. With the profit from the business, she would like to establish a new business of tailoring because she is qualified in that field. Her business helped a great deal as she has managed to raise enough to help with construction.

loans.use: To buy more food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L., 57, is married and her family lives in the town of Sta. Josefa.  To make a living, she raises crops, mostly rice.

Lolita joined CEVI to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Lolita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP  to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rhodah

texts.en:
Rhoda is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transport.

She has operated a clothes selling business going door to door, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Rhoda faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and become a wholesaler of clothes.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of no harassments of clients.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel  tiene la edad de 42 años, casado con una familia de cuatro hijos, trabaja a una empresa privada como técnico en mantenimiento desde hace siete años, en donde ha venido mejorando la infraestructura de su casa. 
Cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposa ya que labora como maestra de primaria. 
Hoy mediante el financiamiento es para poder terminar de cerrar todo el techo de su casa, comprara ventana y puerta ya que solo las tiene con verjas lo que le es de gran relevancia poder tener en mejores condiciones de privacidad a su familia. Lo que comprara láminas de zinc, golosos, ventana y puertas hechas para cerrar.
texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old, married and has four children.  He works in a private company as a maintenance technician.  He has been in this job for seven years and, over this time, he has been improving the infrastructure of his home.

Manuel has the financial support of his wife who works as an elementary school teacher.  He is requesting this loan so that he can finish off the roof of his house and buy a window and door since he only has iron grilles right now. This would help to improve his family's privacy.  He will buy sheets of corrugated metal, bolts, a window and a door so that he can close up his house.

loans.use: To buy sheets of corrugated metal, a door and a window so that he can finish closing up his house

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is 63 years old, married to a midwife and has 10 children, all of whom live in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is known for being very hard working and has made a living for the last 40 years by raising animals and selling milk. He has earned enough money to educate six of his children, and would like to improve his prospects further by setting up a ranch. He has applied for this loan to buy a cow to raise and breed.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise and breed.

loans.name: Sonanet

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonanet U. is 48 years old. Her husband, Mr. Vanthan MoU., is 56 years old. They live together on an island of the Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1982 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. 

Sonanet has been a weaver since she was eighteen years old. She sells her finished products to a retailer who then in turn sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a construction worker. 

She is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase weaving materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elvira Pérez Hernández, vive en Chicoasen Estado de Chiapas México, es casada  y tiene dos hijos a su responsabilidad, quienes son: Kevin Jasiel de trece años y la más pequeña es Martha Eunice de once años de edad.


        El préstamo que ha estado solicitando para invertir en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, en donde lleva ocho años y comenta que le va bien ya que le ha dejado buenos ingresos en su hogar.


        Con esta actividad  y inicio por el ánimo de sus suegra ya que ella era la que tenia este tipo de negocio, pero luego decidió vender verduras  y se lo dejo a su nuera para que se apoye con sus gastos  de sus familia.


       Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte en la compra de más mercancía, para que se vea  mejor surtida y sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan  comprar, y mejor sea su ganancia en su actividad.


        Lo que  desea es lograr ahorrar para que  ha sí logre aumentar más su negocio, como también de eso mismo obtener para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira Pérez Hernández lives in Chicoasen in the state of Chiapas, México.  She is married and has 2 children in her care, who are: Kevin Jasiel, 13, and Martha Eunice, 11.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store, which she has had for 8 years.  She comments that the business is going very well, as it has provided a good income for her household.

Her mother-in-law, who had a grocery store, encouraged her to work in the business. Later, her mother-in-law decided to sell vegetables and left the business to Rosa so that she could help support her family.

With the earnings that she is getting she invests in the purchase of more merchandise, so that she can better stock her store and so her customers can find what they are looking to buy.  In this way she can improve her profits.  What she wants is to be able to save so that she can manage to expand her business, and so that she can provide for her two children, who are in school.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Morng

texts.en: Morng S., age 31, owns a small kiosk where she sells meat, shampoo, soft drinks and food in her village in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She typically makes around 5 USD in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. She has a life partner in her husband who is a car taxi driver at the local factory. He has an income about 5 USD each day and shares responsibility with Morng S. to support the whole family. She now has two school-aged kids, both of whom attend school. She will use her first loan to buy a tractor for her husband to dig land. This loan is going to improve the whole family with additional assets, and earning more profit.

loans.use: To buy a tractor

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma E. is from the village of Tambo, Iligan City. She is 42 years old. Salma is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Salma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & beverages in the local community. Salma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Salma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Salma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Salma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods & snack foods.

location.town: Tambo, Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 40 years old and married with four children. Two of her children attend school. Mary is currently in the business of selling soft drinks and is requesting a loan to stock more soft drinks. In the future, Mary hopes to construct a house with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
A product line that never ceases to gain regular customers is one that serves the food market. Sarah M., 62, banks on this fact and runs a food micro-enterprise. Sarah is married to Wilfredo, a driver, and together they have raised children who are now in college. Sarah is out to prove that having finished only three years of high school does not limit her in business.

At present, Sarah runs a food stall, called a "carinderia", in the Philippines. The carinderia is annexed to their house, so she is able to manage both the household chores and the daily routines in the carinderia. This business of hers has been running for 15 years now, and with the diligence she puts into her work and the quality training and spiritual support she receives from CCT*, Sarah manages to earn Php 15,000 net income every month. She has one employee hired to help her with the daily tasks in her carinderia.

Because Sarah aims to serve nothing but quality food to her customers, she decided to borrow Php 10,000 to better finance her business. She intends to use this loan money to purchase meat products, vegetables, and other nutritious ingredients to come up with daily sumptuous meals. With this loan, Sarah is also equipped to meet the daily needs of her family and pay for the tuition fees of her children.

One challenge Sarah faces is the competition she has in the community, since there are not a few business-minded people like her who have set up food stalls in the vicinity. But Sarah is not going to give up the fight. She holds on to the hope of making her business grow, so that she may be able to finance the education of her children up to college and take care of the family's health.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: purchase of daily ingredients and condiments.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in an industrial city of Pakistan known as Faisalabad. She has been living in the area of Dhanona in a two-room brick house for the past 25 years. She is 35 years old, married to M. A. and has two sons and two daughters. None of the children has attended school (except the eldest one, who studied 'til 10th) due to the poor financial conditions of Naseem and her family. Now that son operates a timber selling business while the others stay at home. Her son’s business is going well because most of his clients live in areas where gas is not available and they use wood for cooking food. 

Naseem's husband runs a construction supplies business. He makes deals with different construction companies and individuals and makes profit by fulfilling their orders. 

Naseem is a housewife. She spends most of her time at home and carries out her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her son's business. With the loan, he will buy timber in bulk quantity that will help him fulfill the demand of his clients and make extra income. Naseem is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her son. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: to buy timber for a timber selling business.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine M. N. is 40 years old and has two children, 4 and 14 years old. He and his wife hope to give their children good education to the university level. Justine's business is located in Thika, a region in Kenya known for pineapple production.

Justine has been selling brake fluid, brake pads, clutches, corner lights and headlights to minibus, truck and car owners in Thika for two years and he says that this business is profitable. The major challenges he faces are financial constraints and lack of proper business management skills. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well. He is using this loan of KES 20,000 to buy brake fluid and brake pads to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. In the future, he hopes to open a big auto spare parts store in Thika. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy brake fluid, brake pads, etc.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: La Sra. Alejandrina tiene su casa en la zona D. Tutimayu,  D. la localidad D. Sacaba Cochabamba, tiene un hijo  su esposo es agricultor, su hijo se encarga D. ayudar al Papa, ella realiza la venta D. chicharrón solo los días domingos en un puesto alquilado que se encuentra sobre una avenida, Los Sábados se levanta desD. tempranas horas D. la mañana  para ir a comprar carne y ya la prepara para elaborar el riquísimo chicharrón el día domingo,  tiene muy buenas ventas ya que la Sra. Alejandrina es muy conocida por la buena elaboración del chicharrón por la calidad del preparado, el préstamo lo invertirá para la compra D. material D. construcción para hacer construir un  cuarto en la casa para a si brindar mayor comodidad a su hijo, es una persona muy trabajadora y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Alejandrina lives in the town of Sacaba, in Tutimayu region, in Cochabamba.  She has one child (a son) and her husband is a farmer.  Her son helps his dad and Alejandrina sells 'chicharrón' (fried pork rinds) every Sunday from a stall that she rents on an avenue.  On Saturdays she gets up early in the morning to go and buy meat and prepare it for making her delicious 'chicharrón' on Sunday.  She makes good sales since she is very well known for the quality of the 'chicharrón' that she prepares.

Alejandrina will invest her loan in buying construction supplies so that she can build another room in her house and make her son more comfortable.  Alejandrina is a very hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support that they have given her.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo hombre de 45 años casado y con  2 hijos en las edades de 21 y 22 años, tiene un negocio de venta en mayor cuantía de lácteos y víveres que distribuye entre muchos clientes que a su vez venden al detal. Él compra de contado buscando entre sus proveedores los mejores precios, para poder ofrecer sus productos en condiciones competitivas y su negociación sea: yo gano tus ganas. Su negocio inició cuando él y su esposa vivían en otro país y  enviaba estos productos a una familiar y de allí aprendió mucho, primero lo hacía entre unos pocos clientes y ahora tiene un local como punto comercial con muchos más clientes.  Para Gustavo negociar con víveres y queso se convirtió en el sustento de su familia, su actividad es el principal ingreso y por eso tiene como meta hacerla crecer para cumplir sus sueños de lograr cada día mayor bienestar para su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante su credikiva y con el surtirá su negocio comprando en mayor volumen, queso,víveres, pollo y verduras, para continuar ofreciendo un servicio de excelencia y productos con muy buenos precios.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a 45 year old man, married with 2 children aged 21 and 22. He owns a business selling dairy and food products wholesale, which we distributes to his many customers who in turn retail them. He buys the goods in cash, looking for the best prices amongst his suppliers, so as to be able to sell his goods in competitive conditions and under a win-win premise. 

He started his business when he and his wife lived abroad. He used to send this kind of products to a relative and that's how he learned a lot about the business. He initially had few clients and now he has many more, as well as business premises. Trading with food and cheese is supporting Gustavo's family. His business is the main source of income and that's why his goal is to grown it so he can fulfil his dream of providing his family with a better quality of live. 

This is his first loan application for a Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With it he will stock up and buy cheese, food, chicken and vegetables for his business in larger quantities, so as to continue to provide an excellent service and products at very good prices.

loans.use: to buy cheese, food, chicken and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor, 29, is married and has three children who attend school.  For two years, he has been operating a retail shop.  He was previously employed in an industry.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable because he has managed to improve his business. He dreams of venturing into more business in the future so as to generate more income.  He has requested 15, 000 Kenyan shillings to open another retail shop.

loans.use: To open another retail shop

loans.name: Oty Katty

texts.es:
La señora Oty es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Lleva muy poco tiempo como socia de Manuela Ramos, pero tiene todas las ganas de querer trabajar  y salir adelante por ese motivo ahora ha tenido la idea de poner una tienda de comestibles (bodega).

Con su nuevo préstamo S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 estante de madera, 2 mesas, 8 sillas, 2 docenas de escobas, 1 docena de recogedores, 3 paquetes de agua mineral, 2 paquetes de gaseosa.
Su esposo es de profesión administrador y es quien le da las pautas de cómo manejar su negocio.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado.  Gracias a los préstamos ha podido hacer realidad uno de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Oty is a member of the 'Mujeres del 2000' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 23 years old, married, and has one child.  She has not been a member of Manuela Ramos for very long but she has a great desire to work and get ahead in life.  For this reason, she decided to set up a grocery store.

Oty will use her loan for 1,700 Peruvian soles to buy: 1 wooden shelf, 2 tables, 8 chairs, 2 dozen brooms, 1 dozen dustpans, 3 packets of mineral water and 2 packets of soda.

Oty's husband is an administrator by profession and he provides her with guidance on how to run her business.

Oty is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support they have provided.  Thanks to their loans, she has been able to make one of her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy a wooden shelf, tables, mineral water, etc.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, aged 40, is married and blessed with six children. He does farming, mainly tea growing and dairy keeping, which he has been doing for four years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 30,000.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy a dairy cow for milk production. He intends to use the expected profits to educate his children and hopes to be a renowned farmer in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Erdenetsooj

texts.en:
Erdenetsooj, age 45, lives with her family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the outer ger districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a construction worker at a local company while her son works at a cashmere manufacturing company. Her 4-year-old daughter attends kindergarten.
 
Erdenetsooj has been operating a cooperative felt-manufacturing business since 2006 with 24 partners. They produce pure felt out of raw felt by themselves; hence the products are completely handmade and qualified. They make various products such as baby boots, slippers, hats, blouses etc., and sell them to the local souvenir shops in Ulaanbaatar. 

Erdenetsooj is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy raw materials with the intention to increase production before the end of this summer since large numbers of tourists interested in Mongolian felt and cashmere products. 

She is working hard to achieve her goal which is to expand her business by opening several branches around the city.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to increase sales

loans.name: Ivania Isabel

texts.es:
Ivania de 29 años de edad, vive en Chacaraseca una comunidad de León, esta casada, es madre de tres hijos, es comerciante, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, lleva 6 años dedicándose a este negocio. Inicio a los 23 años de edad con el apoyo de su esposo quien le enseño a como criar y vender cerdos este negocio lo tienen en su finca , cuando obtuvo su primer ganancia ella compro una manzana de tierra mas para utilizarla como terreno de siembra . 
Solicita el préstamo para  comprar cerdos de desarrollo y componer el establo para los cerdos. Con esta inversión podrá adquirir con más facilidad la compra de cerdos e invertir para acondicionar mejor el lugar para crianza de sus animales. 
Su meta próxima es sembrar maíz.
texts.en: Ivania is 29 years old and lives in Chacaraseca, a community in León. She is married and is a mother to three children. She is a trader. She is dedicated to raising pigs. She has been dedicated to this business for six years. She began when she was 23 with the support of her husband who taught her how to raise and sell pigs. She has this business on her farm. When she obtained her first earning, she bought one more block of land to use it as planting land. She is requesting the loan to buy pigs for development and build a barn for the pigs. With this investment, she will be able to acquire with greater ease the purchase of pugs and to invest in better conditions for raising animals. Her next goal is to plant corn.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and compose the barn for the pigs.

loans.name: Jamilya

texts.en:
Jamilya is 53 years old. She purchases and resells cattle with her husband. 

Jamilya would like to request a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to purchase additional cattle to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. 

In the future, Jamilya would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cattle and increase their income further. For this reason she applied for a 1,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase three baby calves.

loans.name: Maria  Magdalena

texts.es: La Sra. María  se  preocupa  por acondicionar  su  vivienda  en esta   ocasión  ella desea    realizar   acabados  en  el interior  y exterior  de  su  vivienda, primeramente   requiere   pintar  su  hogar , para  de  esta  manera  brindar  a su  familiares  y  amigos  que  la  visitan un  ambiente   agradable  así  como también  requiere  realizar   acabados  en el  exterior  de  su  domicilio,  agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto .
texts.en: María is concerned about making her house livable and on this occasion she wants to complete the interior and the exterior finishing touches; in particular, she needs to paint her house to provide her family and friends who visit a pleasant environment.  She also needs to do some of the exterior finishing touches.  She is grateful for the support provided to carry out her project.

loans.use: to paint the exterior of her house.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Tessie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Tessie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.fr:
Cliente de 39 ans, mariée et mère d'un garçon age de 9 ans, elle se lance dans le commerce bientôt 8 ans, quand elle finit ses études universitaires.
Parmi les première cliente de Hope, elle a déjà bénéficie de 3 cycle de prêts, elle a toujours eu  une grande capacité de remboursement et détient des épargnes considérables, ses revenus ont largement augmentes, elle vend en moyenne 25.000 fr a 100.000 fr par jour.
Pour ce quatrième prêt , elle persévère en achetant plus de marchandises, continuer avec la vente des produits divers , comme poisson sale, le poisson fume, les produits d'alimentation, elle fait les gâteaux, du yaourt,tous  ce dont les clients cherchent.

Toujours motivée par ce qu'elle fait , elle tient a aller loin , atteindre ses objectifs et être une femme d'affaire.
texts.en:
A client aged 39, married and the mother of a son of nine years old, she got into business about eight years ago when she finished her university studies. 

Among the first clients of Hope, she has already received three loans and she has always had a great capacity for reimbursement and has put aside considerable savings. Her income has gone up a lot and she makes sales for on average between 25,000 and 100,000 francs per day.  

For this fourth loan, she will persevere in buying more merchandise and continue selling various sorts of goods such as salted fish, smoked fish, grocery items. She has cookies, yogurt, everything her customers are looking for. 

Always motivated by her business, she intends to go far, attain her objectives, and become a businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy items for her business to bolster her stall inventory.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is a 43-year-old man, and he is married with five sons and three daughters. He has a grocery store in addition to a project of raising sheep and poultry. Yousef wants to purchase more groceries for his store in order to have a better collection for sale and increase his income, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Yousef gets the loan, he will be able to purchase more groceries and have a better collection. This will increase his sales, improve his income, and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 6 children, all of whom go to school, and also takes care of two other family members (father and mother). Tessie operates a rented retail shop where she sells her products. Her customers are her neighbors. She has been in business for the last 5 years and works seven days a week.

Tessie has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, 50 kgs. of rice, soap, and maize flour. Her goals and aspirations are to own a wholesale shop, to buy a plot of land, and to educate her children to university level. Her major challenges are defaulters and transportation. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, 50 kgs. of rice, soap, and maize flour

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is from Calabayan in Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old. Edna is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 43 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has three children between 20 to 25 years old. All of them are living on their own.

For the past five years she has been selling charcoal in the community. She makes more profit and has more customers, since she is the only one who sells charcoal in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, a 24-year-old single mother of two children, both attending school, lives in Caldwell where she has been selling red oil (palm oil) and plantains in the local market for the past two years. One of her main challenges is fluctuating prices.

Josephine is now requesting a loan to purchase more red oil and plantains for her business. in the future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase  more red oil (palm oil) and plantains for her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is married with eight children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Vivian is forty years old and has five children who are in school.

Vivian has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Vivian has been in this business for six years. In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcos tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la Ciudad de Itá , aun vive en el terreno familiar pero con casa y actividad propia, se independizó y posee su propio taller de confecciones ,posee dos maquinas rectas industriales y una overlock de 5 hilos.
El se define como un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor, que lucha por un futuro mejor, ya que pese a su corta edad desea salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia y también en los gastos de la casa. Quiere seguir creciendo con su negocio por lo que desea poder seguir invirtiendo en el.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, cierre y demás insumos con los cuales podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Marcos is 19 years old, single, and lives in the city of Itá. He still lives on his family’s property, but in his own house and has his own business. He became independent and has his own tailoring shop, where he has two industrial machines and a 5-thread overlock sewing machine.

He considers himself to be a very hardworking and enterprising young man who fights for a better future. Despite his young age, he wants to get ahead so that he can help his family and contribute to the household expenses. He wants his business to continue to grow, which is why he wants to be able to continue investing in it.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabric, thread, zippers and other supplies to meet his customers’ demands. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity provided to him.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers and other supplies.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUISSEME  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FARANI, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  NAMINATA, 1ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de TAGAN, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Maa Chanchala Shg(A) Group

texts.en:
Labani is a 41-year-old divorced woman who lives with her four children in a small village in Odisha, India. She is engaged in paddy cultivation. Her husband was doing the same business, so after the separation from her husband, she continued this. 

Some years ago, Labani formed a group with nine other women from her village with the group name of "Maa Chanchala Shg." All the group members are engaged in different business activities like selling milk, vegetable cultivation, etc., to alleviate their poverty. Labani is the president of this group. She motivated all the group members to form this group so they could help and support each other in their business and personal lives. 

Labani and her group requested a loan of 150,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family, and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosita sells pots and other kitchenware. She has been working in this line of business for 2 years after being taught the ins and outs of the trade by her brothers. With $50 in capital she bought some merchandise and began selling door-to-door. Rosita is in need of financing in order to increase her product line. She has always had a scarcity of capital and this has restrained her business from growing. She plans to purchase a variety of products from wholesalers in order to increase profits.

Rosita is 30 years old, is married, and has three children. Her husband is very supportive of her activities and helps her buy and transport the goods. They work very hard to provide an education for their children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Rosita is in need of financing in order to increase her product line.

loans.name: Martha Francisca

texts.en:
Martha has three children who are already married and her husband is a laborer. The income he receives is very low. For this reason, she has been selling used clothing from her home and also in the street markets near her home for the past 15 years. Martha is requesting a loan of $550 to buy an inventory of clothing for the new season with the purpose of offering a better variety to her clients, and thereby being able to improve her income.

Martha is a very enterprising woman who needs your support to be able to achieve her goals. This is the way she can get ahead, so please support her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Martha tiene tres hijos que ya están casados, su esposo es obrero y el ingreso que recibe es muy bajo, por este motivo hace 15 años que se ha dedicado a la venta D. ropa usada, que realiza en su domicilio y en mercados ambulantes que se ubican cerca D. su hogar. Martha solicita un préstamo D. $550 dólares para surtirse D. ropa D. nueva temporada, con la finalidad D. ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y poder obtener mejores ingresos.

Martha es una mujer emprendedora que necesita D. tu apoyo para poder lograr sus metas, esta es la manera en la que ella pueD. salir adelante, apóyala.

loans.use: To buy inventory of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 steers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. D. B. has her own greenhouse at her house. She grows her own plants and trees to sell. Victoria is 49 years old, married, and the mother of one daughter. Her daughter will turn 15 years old in October.

Victoria has clients all over the country. She sells about 200-300 plants per month. She started her business 10 years ago, but has been working as a gardener for many years before that for other people. Her husband and three other people also help her in her greenhouse. Victoria works everyday from 7 am until 8 pm.

Victoria needs a loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizer to increase her business.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hayde Lourdes

texts.es:
Hayde has three school-aged daughters. She creates her sweaters, shawls, hats and other items at home so that she can give ample attention to the task of raising her little girls. Over time, her hard work has given her some notoriety throughout the city as a fine weaver. Because of the quality of her sweaters, and the varied designs of her bedspreads the number of orders from her clientele continues to increase. Hayde would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials to build up her stock of products and to meet the demands of her clients. To do this, she is asking for a $325 loan, which she has committed to repay within 6 months. With this investment she will increase sales and be able to continue to supply her current clientele, in order to increase the quality of life for her family. Hayde and her daughters await your help to begin development of this project.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Hayde tiene tres niñas todas en edad escolar. Debido a ello es que sus actividades de confección de chompas, chalinas, gorras y demás las realiza dentro de su hogar a fin de no descuidar la atención que le demanda la crianza de sus pequeñas. Durante mucho tiempo su ardua labor a hecho que su fama de excelente tejedora se extienda por la ciudad debido a la calidad de sus chalinas y diversos diseños de sus colchas sus clientes cada vez le hacen mayor cantidad de pedidos y el deseo de Hayde es invertir en la compra de materia prima para aumentar el stock de sus productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello su solicitud haciende a un monto de 325 dólares, los cuales se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses. Con esta inversión para aumentar la venta además de beneficiar a su exigente cartera de clientes podrá elevar la calidad de vida de su familia. Hayde y sus niñas esperan tu pronta ayuda para iniciar el desarrollo de este proyecto

loans.use: The manufacture of more sweaters and bedspreads will help Hayde to fulfill her clients' orders and improve her daughters' quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing more electronic appliances for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchanside for the holiday season.

loans.name: Saidat's Group

texts.en: Saidat sells used clothes, moving from door to door. With the profits from her  business, Siadat will buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana J. lives in her domestic partner’s grandparents’ house, located on 12 de Octubre Street in the Tembladerani sector of the city of La Paz. She has a 4-month-old baby. She sells fast food in the city of El Alto, where she rents a shop that opens only on Thursdays and Sundays, the days in which the markets operate.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase wholesale goods such as rice, noodles, etc., thus lowering her expenses.

She does not have a credit history with Impro, but she qualifies for the loan because of her steady financial income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana vive en casa de los abuelos de su concubino en la calle 12 de octubre de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un bebe de 4 meses, la actividad que realiza es la venta de comida en la ciudad de El Alto, lugar donde alquiló una tienda que funciona únicamente los días jueves y domingos, fechas en que se realizan las ferias.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar los insumos como ser arroz, fideo etc., al por mayor y de esta manera bajar sus costos.

No tiene antecedente con Impro pero califica para acceder a un crédito por el análisis de su flujo de caja.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, noodles, and other ingredients for the preparation of meals

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth J. lives in the Shibiri community of Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 37 years old and has three kids. She sells foodstuff in her community. She needs a loan of $275.00 to buy more food items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase parts

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia is a humble mother of a hard-working and perseverant family. The training that she obtained from her family heritage has turned her into a magnificent producer of cheeses, which has become an important source of income for her loving family. She has a dream to improve her cow's food and diet. Her cow is very important and provides her every day with the necessary and indispensible means to make her cheese and as a result, improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia, es una humilde madre de familia trabajadora y empeñosa, el aprendizaje que obtuvo en la cuna familiar la ha convertido en una magnífica productora de quesos y se ha convertido en una fuente importante de financiamiento para los propósitos de su amada familia. Ella tiene el deseo de mejorar la alimentación de su vaca que le proporciona a diario el insumo necesario e indispensable para fabricar sus quesos y a través de el mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchased healthy food for her cow

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. makes a living selling food and provisions, and has been in this business since 2001. She is 40 years old and lives in the town of Afro-media in Lagos State, Nigeria with her husband and three children. She has been active in LAPO Microfinance as a client for the past three years. Grace has applied for a loan of $1,200 to buy more food and provisions to sell to her customers, and wants to express her gratitude to Kiva and the people who lend to her.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and food to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Ms. Clara is a member of the communal bank “Brave Women,” located in the Jr Coronel Portillo 836, of the District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. Ms. Clara is 37 years old, her husband is a mechanic, but their income is not sufficient for their needs, so Ms. Clara with the first loan received from Manuela Ramos S/. 300, decides to invest on a small business. Currently, she gives manicures and facial cleanings. She gets up at at 7 o'clock in the morning, she prepares her husbands breakfast and then begins seeing her clients. With this loan of S/. 1500 which will be paid in 4 months, Ms. Clara bought diverse products for her business such as nail polish, scissors, etc. She realizes that as days pass by she has more and more clients, which is due to the good service she offers. , Ms. Clara’s profits have allowed her to better cover the expenses of the home, and improve the services she offers at her business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Clara pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Coronel Portillo 836, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años, su esposo es mecánico, pero los ingresos económicos no son suficientes para la economía familiar, es así que Clara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un pequeño negocio. En la actualidad ella realiza maniquiure y limpieza facial, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de su esposo, de allí se dedica a atención de sus cliente. Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró diversos productos para su negocio como esmaltes, tijeras, etc. Clara esta se da cuenta que sus clientes cada día van aumentando debido al buen trato que les da, esto se ve reflejado en sus ganancias ya que le permite apoyar en los gastos de su hogar para tener una mejor condición de vida y para mejorar los servicios que ofrece en su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Elías

texts.es:
Elías, 50 years old, lives with his wife Loysi who is his greatest support, above all when it comes to his business. He has 2 children, both of whom are independent and have their own families. He learned to make cakes when he was a youngster, and is now a great baker, and many different shops and stalls in the markets now demand his product. He started this work 9 years ago, and so far it has gone well. Thanks to his hard work and good business management he has bought a tuk-tuk (motocarro) and uses this to deliver products to his customers. He works all day, and what he loves most about his work is the amount of people who enjoy his cakes. He is requesting a loan to build an additional oven so that he can make more cakes. In the future, he would like to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Elías, de 50 años de edad vive junto a su esposa Loysi quien lo apoya mucho, sobre todo en su negocio, tiene 2 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes y de familia. Aprendió a preparar pasteles desde muy joven, ahora es un gran pastelero, ya que muchas vendedoras de distintos puestos de los mercados requieren de su producto. Este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 9 años y por lo visto, hasta la actualidad le va muy bien. Gracias a sus ganancias y su buena administración compró su motocarro, donde lleva sus productos para entregar a sus clientes. Trabaja todo el día, y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que muchas personas degusten de sus pasteles. Solicita este préstamo para construir otro horno pastelero y desde luego implementarse con más productos e insumos, posteriormente le gustaría mejorar las infraestructura de su vivienda.

loans.use: To build an additional oven to make his cakes

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela tiene 46 años, es soltera, vive con sus hijos; Luis Alberto de 13, Rocío estela de 11 y Flor de Maria de 8. Se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de hoja de coca, en su pequeño puesto de un jirón de su localidad, la hoja de coca se comercializa en esta zona del país, para hacer mates, para la lectura de la suerte, lo cual es muy común y también para consumo personal, a lo que le llaman “Pijchar” que no es otra cosa que masticar las hojas de coca.Por todo esto la venta de hoja de coca es rentable, pero hay ciertos problemas en su compra, ya que en algunos lugares no ingresa con mucha facilidad, pero Estela es perseverante y muy trabajadora.
Ella quiere que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro con estudios y actividades diferentes al comercio.
Con el dinero del préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería, y con el tiempo tener algún tipo de negocio adicional, como por ejemplo una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Estela is a 46 years old single mother of three; Luis Alberto 13, Rocio Estela 11 and Flor de Maria 8. She has a street business selling Coca Leaf at a little stand in Jiron, her hometown. In this zone of her country they use the Coca Leaf for mates (similar to tea), fortune telling, which is very common, and also for personal consumption, what they call “Pijchar” which is nothing else than chewing the leaf. This is why selling this leaf it’s a good source of income, it’s not always easy to acquire it, due that it’s produce in places that are hard to get to, but Estela is persevering and hard working.

She wants her sons to have a good future, go to school and learn different businesses. With the loan she wants to buy more products and with time have another business, for example a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Doña Martha D., es una cliente con 28 años de edad, tiene dos hijosde 8 y 2 años rspectivamente cursan la primaria en colegio publico, su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañileria en el vecino pais de Costa Rica, desde donde le envia remesas, doña Martha se dedica al comercio de cosmeticos actividad que tiene mas de cinco años de ejercer como producto de la necesidad de empleo, esta joven microempresaria fue una de las sobrevivientes del Uran Micht, en la actualidad ademas de vender cosmeticos como perfumes tambien se dedica al comercio de ropa nueva actividad que desempeña por encargo, su proposito en la vida es poder sacar adelante a su familia y con los creditos poder mejorar sus condiciones economicas y ampliar su negocio a fin de logar mas adelante quizas poner una pequeña tienda de ropa en su casa o en el mercado.
texts.en:
Martha D. is 28 years old and she has two children aged 8 and 2 and they are currently attending a public primary school. Her husband works as a laborer's assistant, working in the neighboring country of Costa Rica. He sends her support from there. Martha has been selling cosmetics for the last 5 years. She started this business because she needed a job. This young businesswoman is a survivor of Hurrican Mitch. In addition to selling cosmetics she also sells perfumes and new clothing, a business she runs by taking orders. The life's purpose is to provide for her family and with the loan to improve their financial situation. She wishes to expand her business and perhaps one day set up a small clothing store from her home or in the market.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoun S. is a villager in Deum Pour village in Takeo Province. She is a 35-year-old widow and mother. Her child attends the local school. She owns a small piece of land, where she cultivates rice. She faces some difficulty recently, however, because her field is infertile, and she cannot afford enough laborers to help her improve the soil.

Thus Mrs. Ngoun S. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to help her improve her field’s productivity. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to help her improve her rice field’s productivity.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. Vann P. is a villager in Svay Chuor village in Kandal province. She owns a small place where she sells rice soup in the local area. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who has a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. The soil in her field is poor so she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Mao Heng, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Vann P. is 53 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom works in a small company and the other is a seller in the local market.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Aum

texts.en: 36-year-old Aum K. lives in Banteay Meanchey Province.  She looks after three children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is a policeman who currently gets salary about $80 per month. For a living, she has been selling second-hand cloths outside of the local Seri Soaphoan Market since 2006. Her clothes range from the price of $1 or $1.50. K. is applying for a loan to purchase second-hand clothes for future sale and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes

loans.name: Raida

texts.es: Raida tiene 33 años, tiene 14 años viviendo con su pareja, es madre de dos hijos y propietaria de una casa y un auto. Desde el momento en que comenzó a vivir con su esposo, se inició en la compra y venta de frutas mientras que su esposo se dedica a su chacra y en otras oportunidades como chofer y cuando él tenía tiempo preparan juntos la fruta para enviar a Lima. A consecuencia de este esfuerzo pudieron comprar una camioneta;  ahora ha dejado el negocio de las frutas y se dedica a administrar su camioneta, que trabaja transportando carga desde las chacras más lejanas a la ciudad, y su esposo    trabaja ahora fuera de casa como chofer de un bus interprovincial. Raida busca dar un precio módico a sus clientes, nos dice que en estos tiempos ha bajado la demanda del transporte, y solo realiza dos viajes al día, pero hay meses donde está muy bien y llega a sacar hasta 4 cargas diarias. Raida está contenta porque pudo adquirir su carro y construir su casa en su pueblo, pero aun tiene anhelos de tener su casa en la ciudad, para que su esposo les pueda visitar con mayor frecuencia, porque donde viven ahora no hay mucha accesibilidad. Anteriormente trabajó en su banco comunal con el cargo de secretaria, y lo hizo con gran responsabilidad, y no descuido sus cuotas fijadas, como tampoco lo hará con este crédito. El dinero que ha solicitado se invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su vehículo, para que de ese modo siga trabajando y genere ingresos económicos para su hogar y para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Raida is 33 years old, has lived with her husband for 14 years, and is a mother of two children and owner of a home and car. From the moment that she began to live with her husband, she began buying and selling fruit while her husband tended to the farm and other work as a taxi driver, and shen he had time they would together prepare fruit to send to Lima. Because of the effort they were able to buy a small truck. They no longer have the fruit business, instead they continue with the truck, working to transport cargo from the most distant farms to the city, and her husband works away from the home as a interstate bus driver. Raida tries to charge a modest price to her customers, she tells us in these times the demand for transportation has diminished, and she only makes two trips a day but there are months where things are going well and she makes up to 4 trips a day. Raida is happy because she was able to rent her car and build a home in her town, but she still has dreams of having her home in the city so that her husband can visit them with greater frequency, because where they live now there isn’t much accessibility. Previously she worked in the communal bank as its secretary and she did so with great responsibility, did she not neglect her payments and will not neglect them with this loan. The money she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of parts for her vehicle, so that she may continue working and generate the income for her home and for the well-being of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Vicki A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Vicki M. from Mbeya. She is single with 2 children, at the ages of 3 and 4. Vicki has been running a local restaurant known as ‘Mamalishe’ since 2002.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by her mother. Vicki currently earns about $80 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $250 USD in order to purchase more rice, cooking oil, salt and beans in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of goods for the business. Vicki thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, cooking oil, salt and beans in bulk

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells drinks wholesale and retail to her customers. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa María S. tiene poco que adquirió su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental el cual FVP le presto para la diferencia que tenia y así le pudieran  entregaran su casa  mas pronto, este crédito lo pago puntual mente.
Está solicitando un préstamo para poner  las protecciones en las puertas y ventanas ya que solo viene en esa casa ella y su hija y no tiene nada de sugerida y temen que les pueda pasar algo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa María S. recently acquired a home thanks to a government loan. FVP lent her the difference between her government loan and the cost of the house, so she could have her house sooner. She made her loan payments on time.

She is asking for this new loan to install security grates on her doors and windows, since she lives alone with her daughter and they have no security, and fear that something might happen to them.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Placement of protective grates on the doors and windows of her house

loans.name: Afde N°4 Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes du groupe Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE N°4  ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Mbambara Aly LO (région de Thiès). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent presque la même activité de Jumbo, crème glace, poissons secs et poissons fumés. Elles sont très sollicitées dans ces activités. Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de la qualité de leurs services et l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe confiance ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de micro finance IMCEC avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).  Leur premier prêt était  correctement remboursé. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour constituer un stock important de Jumbo, crème glace, poissons secs et poissons fumés. Les Jumbo, crème glace, poissons secs et poissons fumés sont vendus en détail, au comptant au marché grand Thiès.  Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The 5 women of the "Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE N°4" group have an average age of 40 and live in big extended traditional families in the Mbambara Aly LO district (Thiès region). They met because of living in the same neighborhood or being related to each other. They have almost the same businesses selling Jumbo (bouillon cubes), ice cream, dried fish and smoked fish. They are much sought after in these activities.

In the desire to improve the quality of their services and expand the size of their businesses, the members of the trust group decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC, with whom they are on their second solidarity loan. Their first loan was correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to stock up on Jumbo bouillon cubes, ice cream, and dried and smoked fish. These items are sold retail, for cash, in the big market of Thiès. They each hope to make an average profit of 25,000 F CFA during this loan cycle, which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and cover the needs of their extended families, investing any remainder back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: building up their inventory

loans.name: Azizahon

texts.ru: Азизахон стала заниматься предпринимательством совсем недавно. Ее мать которая торгует рядом обучила ее всем правилам данного бизнеса и постепенно Азизахон научилась и покупать зелень оптом. И продавать ее в розницу. Так как заработной платы по основной своей работе не хватает на жизнь, занятие бизнесом позволяет получать доход, и покрывает многие расходы семьи. Азизахон собирается расширить товарооборот и поэтому подала заявку на займ КИВА.
texts.en:
Azizahon has recently started her own business. Her mother, who works near her, has taught her all of the rules of business, and gradually Azizahon has learned to buy greens wholesale and sell retail. Though she does not make enough to support herself, working in business provides an income and defrays many of the family’s expenses. Azizahon is going to expand sales and consequently has applied for a loan from Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Johny

texts.en:
Johny Y. is forty-five years old. He is married and has two children, a son and a daughter, both of whom are currently in junior high school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Johny’s wife works to support him financially. She is a teacher by profession.

Johnny is a carpenter by profession. He makes furniture such as wardrobes, beds, chairs, etc. for sale. He wants a loan to procure working materials such as plywood, foam, nails, etc. Johnny has been in business for ten years. He has a workshop in his community. Johnny is hoping to expand his business and give his children the best possible education.

loans.use: Materials for furniture production

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia E., 36, is from the town of Lopez Jaena. Celedonia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Celedonia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Celedonia has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns ~6,000 PHP a month.

In 2002, Celedonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celedonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Celedonia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be her 11th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. sells clothing and fabrics. She has received a junior high school education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a trader. Gladys is responsible for paying school fees and other domestic expenses.

Gladys has been selling clothing since 2003. Her loan will be used to buy more clothing for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Bella Rose Ann

texts.en:
Bella Rose Ann M., 19, is single and works as a hairdresser in an established salon in Concepcion, Marikina City. She was trained by the owner of the salon when she was 13 years old and has been working there up to the present. She receives a regular income of P300-P500 per day. 

Every Tuesday and Sunday, when she is on her day off, she has her own beauty care service, where she does home service for her established clients and where she earns as much as P1,500-P3,000 a day.

Now she is requesting her loan of P10,000 with Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She will use her loan to buy her own blower, manicure set, nail polish and chemicals for hair treatment and coloring. Bella hopes to put up her own salon in the near future.

Bella has been a member of CCT for a year now. CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: To buy her own blower, manicure set, nail polish and chemicals for hair treatment and coloring

loans.name: Yeyen

texts.en:
Yeyen C. is from the village of Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 59 years old. Yeyen is married. To make a living, Yeyen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling personal home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Yeyen is just starting this business.

In 2009, Yeyen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yeyen successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Yeyen is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Yeyen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona tiene 60 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Cirilo D. 68 años y sus dos hijos Isidoro D. 39 y Mario D. 28, a quienes quiere dejar una buena herencia. Simona toda su vida a trabajado mucho por salir adelante, actualmente tiene una tienda donD. venD. D. todo, la cual es muy visitada por sus clientes, ya que ella es muy alegre y siempre los atienD. muy bien. A Simona le gusta mucho conversar con sus clientes e informarse sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 10 años en este negocio y anhela que su tienda se convierta en la principal D. su barrio, pero sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para lograrlo. Lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro D. su tienda y soportar el frió que hace ahí, ya que su trabajo le exige quedarse tiempo completo y no tiene tiempo para salir a distraerse un rato, ella desea salir adelante y tener un futuro mejor. Este es el segundo préstamo D. Simona con MFP, se siente muy feliz D. la oportunidad D. crédito y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Ella es nueva en su banco comunal y ha sido bien recibida por el resto D. las socias, por lo cual se siente muy contenta. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para mejorar el stock  D. su tienda.
texts.en:
Simona is 60 and is a very simple and happy woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Cirilo, who is 68. They have two children: Isidoro, who is 39, and Mario, who is 28. She wants to leave them a good inheritance. Simona has worked a lot all of her life to get ahead. Currently she has a store where she sells everything, and her customers come there a lot because she is very happy and always gives them good service. Simona likes to converse with her customers and to inform them about the things that happen in their neighborhood. She has had this business for 10 years, and she hopes that her store becomes the main one in her neighborhood, but she knows that she has to work hard to accomplish this. The thing she likes least about her job is having to stay insiD. her store all day and having to tolerate the cold there. Her job demands that she stays there full time, and she doesn't have time to go out to distract herself for awhile. She hopes to get ahead and to have a better future. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very happy to have the opportunity to have a credit, and she is willing to make all of her payments on time. She is new to her communal bank, and she has been well-received by the rest of the members, about which she is very happy. With the 500 PEN that she is requesting, she will buy more products to improve her store's inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Hermisa

texts.en:
Hermisa P. is from the town of Dumalinao. She is 43 years old. She is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Hermisa owns and operates a general store. Hermisa has been in business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10000.00 PHP a month.

In 2009, Hermisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000.00 PHP from PMPC to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Hermisa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase more fabrics and materials. This loan will be the 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support herbimmediate members.

------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is from the rural community of Bantay Solana, Cagayan. She is 44 years old and married to Alexander, a farmer. They have four children: Erwin, 27 years old; Sheryl, 24; Sherlex, age 19, a college student, and Sheila, 16, a 4th year high school student. The eldest two are already married.

Shirley has been managing her village store for more than 20 years. She and her husband are working hard in order to provide the needs of their family. Her goal in life is to become successful in the business thus, she wants to take out a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP6,000 as additional business capital. She hopes that her request will be granted so she can purchase more groceries that she can sell in her store and have an increase in income and be able to support the education of their children until college.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen  es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 65 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada tiene 2 hijos, vive en Cuturapi sector Peña y no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio compra venta D. polleras.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar polleras, mantas, ponchos, también comprara ganado menor ovinos y chanchos.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.

loans.use: Para la compra de polleras, mantas, ponchos.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 51 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en una casa alquilada y tiene muchas ganas de sobre salir en la vida. En el barrio Zarumilla de la ciudad de Juliaca, Virginia tiene una tienda, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas; como cerveza, gaseosas, vinos, piscos, etc, los cuales son rápidamente consumidos, por sus vecinos, ya que Virginia tiene la fama de vender sólo bebidas de buena calidad y no adulteradas.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, de esta manera hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que quedarse hasta altas horas de la noche atendiendo a algunos clientes que desean sus productos. Con el tiempo, desea hacer arreglar la infraestructura de su tienda, para poder brindarles a sus clientes una mejor atención. 

Este es el segundo préstamo de Virginia con MFP y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los mil soles que solicita comprará más bebidas para implementar mejor su tienda, con la cual podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Virginia, 51, is a very hard-working and determined woman. She rents a house and very much wants to make something of her life. In the Zarumilla neighborhood of the city of Juliaca, Virginia owns a store where she sells beverages such as beer, soft drinks, wine, and brandies from grapes (piscos), etc. that her neighbors readily buy, as Virginia is known for selling drinks of only the best and purest quality. What Virginia likes best about her job is conversing with her customers, making her long workdays more pleasant. She has had this job for four years, and the part she considers the most difficult is having to stay late into the night tending to customers who want to buy her products. With time, she would like to fix up her store's layout so as to better serve for her customers. This will be Virginia's second loan with MFP, and she is ready to work hard in order to make her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her community bank and is always aware of the agreements reached by the group.
