The 1,000 soles ($350) she's asking for will be used towards the purchase of more beverages to stock her store with and to offer a wider selection to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her selection of merchandise

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 57 years old. He is married and has three children ages 19, 17, and 15. Only the youngest is in school - the older two have jobs.  His business is the creation and sale of large baskets, rope and leather pieces. He has had this business for 19 years.

This loan will go towards the purchase of materials to make his crafts. Antonio hopes that he will one day be able to include in his inventory products like hammocks, chairs and embroidered products. Antonio has been a good client of Fundacion Leon 2000 for many years.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mirzorasul

texts.en:
Mirzorasul is married and has three children. He sells flour, macaroni, tea, coffee and other groceries in the local market. His vending stand is well known for the prices he offers and the affordability compared to market prices. Mirzorasul knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them the best quality in groceries. He has been selling goods for 10 years with consistent profits. Mirzorasul has been dreaming of opening a small grocery store for a long time. Now he is requesting for a loan of $1500 in order to increase the range of his selling goods. He has planned and envisioned the plans for expansion for his trade and believes that it will be truly helpful for his entrepreneurial endeavors. This loan will help Mirzorasul persist and take the necessary steps to achieve the success he has been dreaming of.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.  But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand the selection in his shop.

loans.name: Francisca Susana

texts.es: Francisca Susana  es soltera, tiene 4 hijos, 3 son mayores y tienen su familia propia y le ayudan economicamente a su madre, solo tiene a cargo al menor de 17 años quien estudia su ultimo año de bachillerato.  Trabaja desde hace 6 años en el INACH de Juigalpa como conserje.  Esta solicitando su 5to credito a AFODENIC para mejorar su casa embaldosando su casa (sala y cuartos) pues actualmente es de tierra y durante el invierno se le hace lodo por las lluvias. Doña Francisca se caracteriza por ser muy responsable en sus compromisos, es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo que cariñosamente le dicen Susanita.  Ademas expresa sentirse agradecida con esta institucion porque gracias a los creditos que le brindan ha podido ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca Susana is a single mother with four children, three of whom are adults and have their own families. They help their mother financially. Francisca is responsible for her youngest child who is 17 years old and in the last year of high school. She has worked for six years as a caretaker for the organisation INACH in Juigalpa. She is seeking her fifth loan with Kiva partner AFODENIC to improve her house by tiling the living room and bedroom floors which are currently made of earth. During the winter rains they turn into mud. Doña Francisca is noted for living up to her commitments and is much liked by her work colleagues. To show their affection they have given her the nickname Susanita. Francisca feels very grateful for the loans extended to her by AFODENIC as they have enabled her to improve her own life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to tile the living room and bedroom floors

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: S. Victorine est née en 1954 et vit depuis près de 35 ans à Hindé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DOSSOU-SOYON Christian, Victorine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Victorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Hindé. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Victorine n'a fait que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Victorine vend divers articles (riz, sardine, savons, liqueur, huile végétale, eau minérale, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) dans sa boutique size à Hindé. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Victorine s'approvisionne. Victorine a six ans d'expérience dans ce domaine et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Victorine a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu'elle avait obtenu auprès de ALIDé. En vue de renforcer son activité, afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Victorine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Victorine S. was born in 1954 and has lived for almost 35 years in Hindé à Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Christian Dossou-Soyon, Victorine is the mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Victorine lives together with her children and her husband in Hindé. The couple manages the family expenses together. Victorine only completed primary school. To meet her needs, Victorine sells various goods (rice, sardines, soaps, liquor, vegetable oil, mineral water, pastas, etc.) in her shop located in Hindé. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Victorine has six years of experience in this area and is on her third loan from ALIDé. Victorine has repaid the last two loans she obtained from ALIDé. Victorine is seeking a third loan through ALIDé in order to reinforce her activities and to better satisfy her customers,

Translated from French by Alex Cho, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of boxes of pasta, sacks of rice, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a thirty-year-old married mother of three children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. Elizabeth works hard to help her husband to provide for their family. 

Elizabeth prepares and sells porridge on a table top by the roadside in her community. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Elizabeth has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima, 38, is married with five children between the ages of 3 and 10 years old. All her children go to school. She resides in, and owns, a one-room house where she is staying with seven people. Salima takes care of additional family members, too. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. 

Salima incurs transport costs to and from buying merchandise from Kikuubo shops, one of the busiest places in Kampala city. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day and sells at retail prices to all categories of people. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children. Her major business challenge is transportation during the rainy season, which hinders her customers being able to reach her as she works from a muddy place. 

Salima has been in this business for 15 years and with MCDT for six years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. Salima joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of soap, cartons of salt and bags of sugar. She aspires to see her business grow and to be able to start selling on wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap, cartons of salt and bags of sugar

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria B. is currently in the business of selling beans, sodas and beer and is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beer and sodas to sell. Victoria is 27 years old and is married to a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Nyakatookye Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
S. Florence is in the small photo at the top left. She missed the group photo, but she is the leader of this lending group. She is 40 years old and married with six children between the ages of 10 and 22, including three dependents in her care. 

Florence deals in the sale of produce from Nyakatookye and just like the name of her business location, banana growing is the major activity that she has been dealing in for 10 years. She sells matooke (plantains) and hopes to expand her business by buying more from fellow farmers in case her stock is not enough so as to increase her income and sustain her customers. Florence needs a loan to be able to buy more matooke for resale.

loans.use: Buying more matooke for resale

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela es una señora que está Casada, tiene 25 años de edad y también tiene con su esposo un hijito de dos años de edad, actualmente alquila no cuenta con un domicilio propio así es que la familia alquila una casita para vivir, con el crédito Gabriela y su esposo se compraron un lote de terreno para construir su vivienda. Hace bastante tiempo ella trabaja como secretaria de una Coop.de Transporte de la provincia, actualmente la han trasladado a la ciudad, paralelamente ella comercia con cosméticos negocio que le da buenos resultados generándole un ingreso extra. En su trabajo tiene un ingreso seguro, el negocio de cosméticos hay bastante competencia, pero ella tiene la ventaja que le vende a los mismos socios de la cooperativa en la que trabaja. El crédito se compró un lote de terreno para construir su vivienda. Gabriela es una buena persona que ha cumplido hasta la fecha con sus pagos correspondientes.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 25 years old and married; she and her husband also have a little two-year-old son. She currently rents and does not have a home of her own; the family rents a little house to live in. With the loan, Gabriela and her husband bought a plot of land to build their home. Starting quite a while ago, Gabriela has worked as a secretary for a transportation cooperative in her province. Recently, they have transferred her to the city. Parallel to this, she also sells cosmetics, and this business is going well and generating extra income for her. From her work she has a steady income; there is plenty of competition in the cosmetics business, but she has the advantage of selling to the members of the cooperative where she works. The loan was used to buy a plot of land to build their home. Gabriela is a good person who has made all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a lot and paying debt

loans.name: Odinaka

texts.en: Odinaka is a businessman. He sells motor spare parts at retail prices. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is married with two children. He is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more motor parts to sell. He hopes to grow his business to become bigger and stronger. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor parts to sell

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa runs a small store located at her house. She is 67 years old and has three children. She sells fruits, bread and many other items. She hopes that her store will grow so that she can help improve her family’s living conditions. She also works hard for her children who still go to school. She wants them to finish college and have a bright future. Generosa applied for a loan of Php13, 000, which she will use to buy supplies for her store. This loan will help her achieve her goals in life.

loans.use: Additional inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Phin Yeum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In the village of Tramug Chrum in Takeo province, there are seven people who are requesting a village bank loan together. The group members will each use their loans for different purposes. 

Mrs. Phin Yeum, who is a village bank president, has been selected by the members as their group leader.  She and her husband, Mr. Phach S., are farmers who own one hectare of land, which they use to cultivate rice to make a living and support their family.

Although they try to work hard, they do not earn much income. Mr. Phach S. and Mrs. Phin Yeum do not have children, but they live in a household with three other members. So in order to improve their family's living condition, Mrs. Phin Yeum decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding and also some pig food.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Margarida

texts.en:
Margarida C. was born in the Maputo province 30 years ago. She studied until the 12th grade, the last one before university, but was not able to continue beyond that. She is now a teacher and lives with her partner. She has three children who range in age from four to 10. All of them are in school. She has been living in the Boane district of Maputo province for the last three years. Before that, she was in Matola, right next to Maputo city, where she trained for two years as a teacher. 

She is currently teaching nine-year-old children from 7 a.m. till noon. She earns enough money to save a small amount every month, using a savings group she belongs to. She learned about our microlending organization, Hluvuku, and about Kiva through a friend who is also a client.

Margarido has applied for a loan to buy cement and iron to improve her home. With the help of Kiva lenders, she dreams of finishing its construction and giving her family a good place to live. She hopes to continue teaching in the future and become completely settled in the job. 

In the picture she is standing by her partially-completed home.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron and other construction materials needed to finish building her house

loans.name: Carlos Freddy

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos casado, que trabaja en transporte desde hace 15 años, en el sindicato de taxi Trufi Litoral, es esposo de una cliente antigua, quien recomendo a su esposo, tiene un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, la esposa trabaja de empleada del hogar, el Sr. Carlos, tiene su casita propia pero ahora vive en un departamento en anticretico, esto debido a que su vivienda fue afectada por la construcción del camino a Palca por la Costanera, lugar donde vivio muchos años, zona que se encuentra en final Los pinos, el destino del crédito es para el mantenimiento y arreglo de caja de cambios, ya que debido a un asalto que tuvo, donde le robaron el vehiculo, lo recupero, pero le faltaban repuestos y los comprara con el credito solicitado, A pesar de las adversidades el Sr. carlos supo salir adelante y esta muy agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carlos is married to a former client who recommended him. He has worked in transportation for 15 years and belongs to the taxi union Trufi Litoral. He has a school aged son and his wife is employed as a domestic worker. Carlos owns a small house but is currently living in a rented apartment because his home was affected by road construction happening on la Costanera, the road leading to the town of Palta. He lived there for many years. Carlos had his car stolen, but was able to recover it, though some parts were missing. He will use the loan to repair and maintain a gearbox and to replace stolen parts. In spite of these adversities, Carlos has learned to press on and is very thankful for the support offered to him.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: VEHICLE REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo B., 41, from the town of Sto. Niño, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Leo has been planting and harvesting rice for sale for over 10 years now.

Leo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan from CEVI, he is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be Leo's ninth loan from CEVI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 32-year-old woman who owns a business that makes metal window frames. She has one employee and her biggest business challenge is local competitors.

Jane is married and has a daughter who is 2 years old. Her husband is self-employed. 

Jane plans to use the 40,000 Kenya shilling loan to purchase another welding machine for her business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 shillings.

Jane hopes to expand her business and, in five years time, she sees herself as “the CEO of my own welding company”. She describes herself as hardworking, self-motivated, and humble.

loans.use: To purchase another welding machine

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, who are in school, and also takes care of  her parents. Rose has a business selling tomatoes. She has been in this business for four years and works 6 days a week. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to  buy more boxes of  tomatoes.

Business challenges for Rose include transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to earn more profit for her family. She Joined MCDT to acquire additional capital. Rose lives in a home that she rents. She does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food 

About MCDT SACCO:  This loan is administered by MCDT SACCO, a savings and credit institution that uses the Grameen Bank model of solidarity lending  MCDT's cooperative structure also affords clients the opportunity to own shares of the organization and benefit from its financial performance.  The mission of MCDT SACCO is to provide sustainable financial services to the lower strata of Uganda's poor, especially women, for their economic and social development. For more on MCDT SACCO, please see our partner page at http://www.kiva.org/partners/112, and join our lending team, Friends of MCDT SACCO, at http://www.kiva.org/team/friends_of_mcdt_sacco

loans.use: to  buy more boxes  tomatoes

loans.name: Bendiya 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENDIYA 4 est constitué de sept femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans,  4  enfants et vivant  dans des  familles polygames à MOSSIBOUGOU un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
La spéculation  principale cultivée est le pois sucré.  
MACHITAN C., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, avec son prêt, des intrants, les petits matériels et le désherbage de 1hectare. 
La production est vendue après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au niveau du village, au marché du village de DALLEN et au marché de LOULOUNI. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45 000FCFA par campagne. Son bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et à préparer le trousseau  mariage de sa fille.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The group BENDIYA 4 is made up of 7 married women with an average age of 34. They each have 4 children on average and live in polygamous families in Moosibougou, one of the villages in the commune of Loulouni in the Sikasso Region of southern Mali. They collaborate with the Microfinance insitution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their agricultural activities during winter. This is their second loan with the institution, with the first being duly repaid. Their principal activity is cultivating pois sucre nuts. MACHITAN C., the president of the group, intends to use her loan to pay for agricultural products, tools and weeding for 1 hectare. The produce is sold after the harvest to male and female clientele in the village, and at the markets in Dallen and Loulouni. She hopes to generate an average profit of 45 000FCFA each season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to prepare her daughter's wedding dress. She hopes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to cultivate a larger plot of land and make even bigger profits.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, petits matériels agricoles et frais de main d’œuvre.

loans.name: Reyna Matilde

texts.es: Reyna Matilde B. de 59 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su nieta de 13 años de edad, la cual estudia y se encuentra en total cuidado de Reyna y así mismo vive junto a una empleada la cual le ayuda con todos los oficios del hogar y la panadería. La señora Reyna posee una panadería, en la cual se dedica a trabajar desde hace 12 años atrás, es por esta razón que ella es muy conocida en la zona ya que siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora la cual entrega todos los pedidos a tiempo y que cuenta con muy buenos estándares de calidad. En muchas ocasiones su nieta le ayuda a repartir el pan por los diferentes lugares en donde posee clientes fijos. Reyna solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, miel, azúcar y otros ingredientes más, los cuales son necesarios para la elaboración del pan. Reyna trabaja arduamente día con día para poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su nieta, y así también poder mejorar el negocio, el cual ha sido muy rentable para ella.
texts.en:
Reyna Matilde B. is 59 years old, and lives in the municipality of Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her 13-year-old granddaughter, who is in school and for whom Reyna is solely responsible. She also lives with an employee, who helps her daily with housework and the bakery. Reyna owns a bakery, where she has been working for 12 years. Thus, she is well known in the area, since she has always been a hard-working woman who delivers orders on time and who maintains a high quality standard. Her granddaughter often helps her distribute the bread to the various places where she has regular customers. Reyna is asking for a loan to buy flour, shortening, honey, sugar, and other ingredients needed for bread-making. Reyna works very hard each day in order to provide the best she can to her granddaughter, and thus improve her business, which has been highly profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for bread-making

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes A., age 51, and her husband, Remy, have six children.  Three of their children are working, one is in college, one is in high school, and one is in elementary school.  Lourdes works hard to cover the family's daily expenses and to pay for the children's education.  

Lourdes has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 to help her purchase additional seeds and fertilizer for her farm.  Crop failures and pests can make her farming an unpredictable business and the loan should help her ensure than she can continue to generate income.  

Lourdes has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) through several loan cycles and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.*  She hopes that her children will successfully complete their education and that over time her farming business will expand.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Griselda Azucena

texts.es:
Griselda D. 45 años, tiene una pequeña papelería en L. parte delantera D. su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral, tiene dos hijos D. 15 y 13 años. 

Inicio con L. motivación D. su esposo ya que el antes D. casarse tenia una tienda pero debido a L. falta D. oportunidades tubo que comenzar con mas actividades. Ahora los dos trabajan en su papelería desD. las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm y pasan mas tiempo con sus hijos. Venden cada cuadernos a $ 1.25, perfumes a $ 27.00 etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio surtido elL. quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos. En el futuro quiere termina D. construir su casa y tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Griselda, age 45, has a small stationery store in the front section of her house. She lives in a peri-urban zone called Perimetral and has two children ages 15 and 13.

She got started because of her husband's motivation to do so. Before getting married, she used to own a shop, but had to pursue other activities due to a lack of business opportunities. They now both work at their stationery store from 7:00am until 7:00pm, and they are able to spend more time with their children. They sell notebooks for $1.25 and perfumes for $27.00, etc.

In order to keep their business well-stocked, she would like to purchase more notebooks with this loan. In the future, she would like to finish building her house and to start another business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks and pens

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta tiene 59 años, es una madre de familia muy amable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hija mayor, quien cursa estudios superiores. El negocio al que  Modesta se dedica, es la venta de galletas, chocolates, gaseosas y demás golosinas, negocio que le ha generado regulares ganancias, debido a que se encuentra ubicado en la primera planta de su casa y muchos de sus vecinos y amistades acuden a ella para comprar algún producto que posee. En ocasiones su esposo lo ayuda en el trabajo y junto sacan adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es realizar las compras en el mercado; ya que ahí puede comprar un poco de todo con la finalidad de variar y diversificar su negocio; es así que lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es no contar con dinero suficiente para abastecer su negocio. En adelante, planea convertir su negocio en la tienda más surtida de productos comestibles, ya que por su zona no hay bodega. Es su 15avo créditos con MFP y está muy feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que invertirá todo el aporte en su negocio, ya que quiere mejorar su vida. En su grupo comunal es muy respetada por su responsabilidad demostrada. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará  gaseosas, diversas galletas y papelería en general.
texts.en: Modesta is 59 years old. She is a very friendly wife and mother who lives in her own house with her husband and oldest daughter who is in college. The business that Modesta has is selling cookies, chocolates, soft drinks and other snacks. This business has generated regular income for her since it is on the first floor of her house and many of her neighbors and friends go to her to buy a product she has. At times, her husband helps her at work and together they get the business ahead. What she likes the most about her job is making purchases at the market. There she buys a little of everything in order to vary and diversify her business. She has been doing this business for 3 years and she considers the hardest thing to be no having enough money to supply her business. In the future, she plans on making her business the store withe the widest variety of food products, since there is no grocery store in her area. This is her 15th loan with MFP and she is very happy to be able to get it. She says that she will invest it all in her business, since she wants to improve her life. She is very respected in her community group because of the responsibility he has shown. With the loan that she is asking for, she will buy soft drinks, various cookies and general paper products.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and cookies

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline A. is a married lady with four children between the ages of two and six. Her husband is self employed. They hope to provide a good education for their children, educating them to the university level. Caroline is served by the Kitengela branch of SMEP. Her business, Mama Davy's shop, is located at Mukuru kwa Njenga and is well known. At Mama Davy's shop, Caroline provides tailoring services by making suits, skirts, and trousers for local people. Also in her shop, she stocks rice, bread, sugar, detergents, and other general items, which she sells to her repeat customers. She says that this business is profitable and she only has one major challenge: customers have a variety of choices because there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to buy more fabric to expand her business and meet her customers' demand. In the future, she hopes to open her own boutique. She describes herself as hardworking and humble.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Aurelia Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Aurelia Esperanza tiene 61 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad. Aurelia se dedica a la venta de calzado y ropa, los cuales vende en su casa en un municipio de malpaisillo. Es importante mencionar que, ya la señora tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual dio inicio vendiendo poca cantidad de mercancías, debido a que lógicamente no tenía la clientela, esto fue debido a que su familia la apoyo para que ella tuviera de donde obtener ingresos, ya que los trabajos están escasos. El crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de calzado y ropa. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y brindar estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en: Aurelia Esperanza is 61 years old.  She is a single mother and has 3 grown-up children.  Aurelia sells footwear and clothes from her home in the district of Malpaisillo.    Aurelia has been in this business for 6 years.  She started selling a small quantity of merchandise since logically she didn't have a large number of customers.  Her family supported her so that she had a source of income since jobs are scarce.  This loan will be used mainly to buy footwear and clothes.  Her dream is to improve her business and provide her family with financial stability.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha K. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her parents). Aisha has a retail shop. She has been in this business for four years and works 6 days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. Her main business challenges include transportation and competition. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand. 

Aisha lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain the health of his plants

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 49 years old. Elsa is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lolita also plants and harvests cassava. She is a 43-year-old married woman from the town of Sto. Niño. She has three children, ages 20, 18 and 6. Lolita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To buy additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is currently in a business of selling Kimbo, Dodo, fish and beans.  She is 33 years old, married to a teacher with four Children and only two of them go to school.  Joice borrowed a loan for selling Kimbo, Dodo, fish and beans.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Selling kimbo,Dodo,Fish and Beans.

loans.name: Handaa

texts.en:
Handaa B., 49, is married and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She lives with her family in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her son's backyard. 

She started her retail trading by selling candies at a local market in 1999. Now she rents a much bigger stall at the same market and operates her food trading business. 

She is one of the regular customers of our bank. Her family has a decent standard of living. Handaa is a very hardworking and active person. Her family members support the idea to get a loan for further development. She says, "I would like to have my own place where I could operate my business constantly." 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more candy at the wholesale price and to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more candies at the wholesale price

loans.name: Dulce  Deyanira

texts.es: La Sra. Dulce es una persona muy seria y respetuosa ella es casada, tiene un negocio de comida y venta de accesorios en su casa, en un futuro quiere ampliar su negocio si dios le da vida  para  de  esta  manera  tener  mayores  ingresos  por  los  servicio  prestados ya  que   esto  representa  el  único  sustento con el  que  cuenta  por  lo  cual  día  con  día se  esfuerza  cada  vez  mas  para  salir  adelante.
texts.en: Sra. Dulce is a very serious and respectful person.  She has a food business and also sells accessories from her home.  In the future she wants to expand her business, God willing, so that she can generate more income for the services she provides.  This is her only livelihood, so she strives each day to get ahead.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nansalmaa is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They do not have their own plot of land and currently they live in a 'ger', the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on Nansalmaa’s sister’s plot of land. 

Nansalmaa sells underwear and lingerie at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. Once or twice a month she travels to Ereen, a Chinese border city, and buys her products from wholesalers. She is planning to buy a car to use for transportation of her products. Every morning she has to carry her products to the market and in the evening she carries them back home, because she rents a stall in the market and there is nowhere to store her products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a small car to carry her products to the market.

loans.use: to buy a small car to carry her products to the market

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Kung C. has been in the farming business for a long time, in Kompong Cham province. Kung C. plants rice crops as her annual business, and she can make a profit of approximately $1 per day. 

Her husband is currently a recycling seller: He buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods he deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires, cans, plastic products and bottles. 

Kung C. will use her loan to buy a plot of farmland, which she has saved some money for before. She is going to use this land to enlarge her rice crops.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland for her farming business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a thirty-three year old single mother of five children living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. 

For twenty years she has been selling fresh food in the market and has been able to maintain the loyalty of her customers. She started with capital of 50,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) and she currently has 1,000,000 UGX as working capital. 

She has a challenge of food going bad and her desire is to buy a fridge. Margret needs the loan facility to buy fresh food for resale.

loans.use: to buy fresh food

loans.name: Djromahouton Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHOUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble et pratiquent tous la même religion. La représentante du groupe, Cyanath (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est mariée à un architecte nommé Ismaël. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Cyanath vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Donoukin à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Il y a près de quinze ans que la famille s'est installée dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Cyanath vend depuis sept ans déjà, divers articles à son domicile. Cyanath s'approvisionnne au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Cyanath désire obtenir un autre financement. Plus tard, Cyanath ambitionne acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
DJROMAHOUTON is a group of three individuals who come together to practice the same religion. The representative of the group, Cyanath (who has her hand raised in the photo), is married to an architect named Ismaël. The couple have three children, all enrolled in school. Cyanath lives with her husband and her children in the Donoukin neighborhood in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. They came to live here almost 15 years ago, and the spouses share the financial responsibility for their family. 

Cyanath has been selling various items out of her home for seven years already. She buys her goods in Nigeria, a neighboring country of Bénin. She has been a client of ALIDé for a long time and has appropriately reimbursed prior loans. Wishing to bolster her business and satisfy the demand of her clientele, Cyanath has requested a new loan. Later, she hopes to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and various other products for resale.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is a married woman from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has 3 children aged 20, 18 and 17.

Gemalyn is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Gemalyn works hard to provide for her family. She needs seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs for her rice farm. She requested a loan to purchase the supplies required for her farming needs.

Gemalyn hopes for her family's living conditions to improve and for her children to finish college and to find decent jobs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Alice Josephine

texts.en:
This is Alice. She is 63 years old and married with six adult children ages 40, 39, 37, 35, 32 and 29. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her relatives.  Alice established a palm oil business in 1991. She started her business at a time when things were very difficult and her husband was not able to provide food for the family. “I started a business to save my husband and family from stress,” said Alice. She works six days a week, ten hours a day, to earn 1,800,000 SLL every month. 

Alice is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy additional palm oil. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. Alice thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to sell

loans.name: Olga Natalia

texts.es:
Olga tiene 27 amos de edad, es soltera. Vive en la casa de sus padres la  cual está ubicada en la provincia de Cajamarca, ella vive en la zona  urbano marginal de la ciudad de Cajamarca. Cuenta con  servicios básicos (agua y luz).

Olga se dedica a la comercialización de golosinas en general, esta actividad la realiza desde hace mas de 4 años en los exteriores de un  colegio, aprendió esta actividad de sus familiares hace varios años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro, en todo este tiempo también se ha hecho acreedora de clientela fija y fidelizada a su negocio.

Olga está solicitando un crédito  a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 para que ella pueda compra mayor cantidad de mercadería la cual es solicitada en temporada escolar. 

Olga es una persona  honesta y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olga tiene 27 amos de edad, es soltera. Vive en la casa de sus padres la  cual está ubicada en la provincia de Cajamarca, ella vive en la zona  urbano marginal de la ciudad de Cajamarca. Cuenta con  servicios básicos (agua y luz).

Olga se dedica a la comercialización de golosinas en general, esta actividad la realiza desde hace mas de 4 años en los exteriores de un  colegio, aprendió esta actividad de sus familiares hace varios años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro, en todo este tiempo también se ha hecho acreedora de clientela fija y fidelizada a su negocio.

Olga está solicitando un crédito  a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 para que ella pueda compra mayor cantidad de mercadería la cual es solicitada en temporada escolar. 

Olga es una persona  honesta y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para sus negocio.

loans.name: Triphine

texts.en: Triphine is 41 years old, married and has 6 children who are ages 10-21 years old. Her husband is a driver. Triphine has been selling charcoal for the past 19 years. She is a very hard worker.This business has enabled her to accomplish several things including renovating her house. She is requesting a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to make more profits. With the profits she plans to expand her house.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a fast learner and hard working. She is married and blessed with two children; one child is one years old and the other is 4 years old. She has been running a retail shop for the last two years. She also owns a cafeteria which earns her extra income.  In addition, she does tailoring.  In the next five years, she hopes to have a stable and ample capital base and a business that runs on honesty and integrity.  

She wants 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy a container as a storage facility.

loans.use: To buy a container as a storage facility.

loans.name: Ellonor

texts.en:
Ellonor is 37 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and a mother of five school-aged children. Ellonor has a motorcycle transport service business. She provides passenger services in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years with a monthly income of PHP 6,000 from these activities. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 at GDMPC to purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts.
Ellonor has been a member of GDMPC for two years. Ellonor hopes to buy an additional motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Ruth has a business selling firewood.  She has been in this business for four years and she works seven days out of every week. Ruth sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Ruth has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of firewood. The main business challenges for Ruth include seasonality and transport. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only. Ruth lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of firewood

loans.name: Rai

texts.en: Having life, it means that time for solving with struggles and problems. To living in good standard as others, so lots couples co-operate and try to effort to find which job that suitable to gain more money family as other family in village. In the many choice of works, Mr. Rai and his wife always negotiation with each other for finding solution to growing all children in comfortable and study at higher degree as rich family. Currently, they are farmer. They have nine children in responsibility. To glorify the family in honor and prosperity, Mr. Rai and his wife would like to borrow in amount about $500 in the purpose to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Raeeda

texts.en: Raeeda is 31 years old and lives in Madaba, Jordan. She is applying for a loan for 400 JD to buy products to sell in her store. Her goA. for the future is to expand her store to include some additionA. nearby commerciA. space.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni is 28 years old and single with six children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread, oil, and flour in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Poni requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 37 años de edad y tiene un hijo, él es policía. En esta oportunidad Juan requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para pagar unas deudas de dinero. Su sueño de Juan abrir una tienda de abarrotes en un centro comercial.  

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Juan was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the same city.  He is 37 years old and has a son.  He is a policeman.  On this occasion, Juan needs a loan for personal use, specifically to pay off some debts.  His dream is to open a grocery store in a shopping center.

The 'Comuzone I' community bank meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is known as being a touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world: Machupicchu.

loans.use: to pay off some debts

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is married with three children. She is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines

Angelita is a farmer and grows  corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase corn seeds to raise. 

Angelita has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Angelita hopes to send her children to school to finish a college degree.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds to raise.

loans.name: Alain Christian

texts.fr:
Client de 44 ans, marie et père d'une fille de deux ans,il se lance dans la vente des livres chrétiens et bibles il y'a de cela 11 ans, quand il était a l'université, et il  est client de Hope  bientôt une année. 
Ayant déjà bénéficie de plusieurs cycles de prêts, il rembourse sans difficultés et a une capacité d’épargnes énormes.
Ses recettes sont de 200.000 fr a 1.000.000 fr par jour. Avec ce nouveau prêt , il va acheter  10 des  cartons de bibles, 10 cartons  des livres chrétiens de différents genres, des livres religieux.

Il a des stratégies de vente et de distribution très efficace, il fait la livraison a domicile, des ventes a crédits.
Il est entrain de construire une grande librairie et veut dans peu de temps faire la vente en gros des livres chrétiens.
Comme bon père , il s'occupe valablement de sa famille.
texts.en:
This client of 44 years old is married and the father of a daughter two years old. He got into selling Christian books and Bibles 11 years ago, when he was still in the university and he has been a client of Hope for almost one year. 

Having already received several loans, he reimbursed them without difficulty and has a capacity for enormous savings. His receipts are from 200,000 to 1,000,000 francs per day. With this new loan, he is going to buy 10 cartons of Bibles, 10 cartons of Christian books of various sorts, and other religious books.  He has sales and distribution strategies that are very efficient. He makes home deliveries and sells on credit. 

He is building up a big library and intends soon to sell Christian books wholesale. As a good father, he takes suitable care of his family.

loans.use: to buy Christian books and Bibles.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 45-year-old married woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She has a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years.

Nora requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more fish for sale. She will use the profits to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié sans enfants.Après avoir arrété ses études faute de moyens , il a appris la coiffure et a ouvert un salon de coiffure pour homme et dames.Son activité est assez rentable surtout en cette veille de fete.Il entretient sa petite famille avec les revenus tirés du salon.Il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter du matériel de coiffure.Son ambition est d'ouvrir un second salon.
texts.en: This borrower is a young married man with no children. After ending his education due to a lack of means, he trained to become a hairstylist and opened his own hair salon for men and women. His business is quite profitable, especially before the holidays. He supports his small family with the income from the salon. He is seeking a loan of 500,000 F to buy hairstyling equipment. His ambition is to open a second salon.

loans.use: To buy hairstyling equipment.

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
This is Renelyn, 31, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Maximino, a mason. They have three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Renelyn operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell those items with a little profit. Her products are pants, cargo shorts and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of pants to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Renelyn dreams of growing her business in the coming years and also of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities and varieties of pants to expand her inventory

loans.name: Maria Joecylyn

texts.en:
Maria Joecylyn is 30 years old, married with three children and she's from Santo Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Maria Joecylyn is running a general store selling a variety of food and home products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, and soaps, among others. She has been in this business for 1 year and she earn 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Maria Joecylyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Joecylyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Maria Joecylyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santo Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна постоянно использует кредиты давно и берет их постоянно, так как всегда нужны средства на приобретение новых товаров.В этот раз Татьяна берет кредит на закупку семян, удобрений, хозтоваров для магазина.
Предыдущий кредит был использован для тех же целей - увеличение ассортимента, закупки новых семян и удобрений.

Татьяна постоянно пополняет товар, завозит новинки в магазин, много работает. Летом она брала отпуск на две недели ездила на отдых на море.

(на фотографии Татьяна вместе со своим работником)
texts.en:
Tatyana uses loans regularly and takes them often, as she always needs funds to purchase new goods. This time, Tatyana is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and household goods for the store. Her previous loan was used for the same purpose- to increase her range of products and purchase new seeds and fertilizer.Tatyana constantly replenishes her goods; bringing new things to the store is a lot of work. In the summer, she took a vacation for two weeks to go to the sea and rest. 


(photo of Tatyana with her employee)

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and household goods for the store

loans.name: Ma.nilfa

texts.en:
Ma.Nilfa is 47 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma.Nilfa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma.Nilfa has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es: María Francisca de sesenta y ocho años de edad vive con su hija. Ella posee una pupuseria que es la que le ayuda a sostener los gastos del hogar, vende pupusas de frijoles, queso y chicharrón, es muy conocida en la localidad pues hace las pupusas más exquisitas, a un buen precio y con material de excelente calidad; María es una mujer emprendedora a pesar de su avanzada edad siempre está dispuesta a trabajar para salir adelante, piensa que al sembrar una idea, se cosecha un deseo y el suyo es hacer crecer su negocio ya tiene experiencia crediticia y es por eso que se animo a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, frijoles, chicharrón, queso etc. María Francisca tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Francisca is 78 years old and lives with her daughter. She has a business selling pupusas [thick, hand-made corn tortillas stuffed with other ingredients], which helps her to keep up with the household expenses. She sells pupusas filled with beans, cheese and pork rinds. She is very well known in her locality because she makes the most exquisite pupusas, sells them at a good price, and uses ingredients of excellent quality. María is an enterprising woman who, despite her age, is always ready to work hard to get ahead. She believes that once you plant an idea you can harvest a wish, and hers is to expand her business. She already has borrowing experience so she is excited to request a loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will let her buy corn wholesale, as well as beans, pork rinds, cheese, etc. María Francisca is confident that this will help her give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale, as well as beans, pork rinds and cheese

loans.name: Raniya

texts.en:
Raniya (pictured above) is a 23-year-old young woman. She is married with no children yet. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary. 

Raniya has had a project of raising sheep since two years ago. It is a beneficial project, as she sells the sheep products to the public and stores in the area where she lives. Raniya wants to expand her project by purchasing more numbers of sheep, so as to benefit more from selling their products and increase her income. But, since her husband's salary and her income are low and not enough to pay for the sheep, Raniya needs to take a loan from FATEN. 

Getting this loan will enable Raniya to expand her project and increase her sales and her income. She will depend more on herself and that will give her more self confidence.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Dunhill

texts.en:
Dunhill is a 60-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past six years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,500, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Dunhill will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Miracle De Dieu Group

texts.fr: MIRACLE DE DIEU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Agathe Adjouavi (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 41 ans. Agathe Adjouavi n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Agathe Adjouavi est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Thomas. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Agathe Adjouavi et son mari. Pour cette raison, Agathe Adjouavi vend des condiments à son domicile depuis six ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Agathe Adjouavi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Agathe Adjouavi sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIRACLE DE DIEU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments.

loans.name: Anta

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by twelve women from Elinkine, a fishing village at the mouth of the Casamance River. Represented by their leader Anta F., the group describes their enterprise as follows:

“The village of Elinkine is located in the south of Senegal 55 km from the regional capital of Oussouye, the capital of the department. Elinkine is today one of the most popular villages in the region, or even the country, on account of its geographic position which makes it a very important and strategic crossroads in various sectors, of which fishing is the most famous. This is especially true since 1997, when the fishermen of Diogué resettled in Elinkine.

The principal objective of the members of the Saxal Diam group is to improve their living conditions and contribute to the development of the village of Elinkine and its environs by producing and selling dried seafood. The commercial activities of the group are focused on small-scale trade; this consists of buying and reselling various beauty products as well as dried fish in our village and in the rest of the country, especially the dried fish which is in high demand throughout the country and in the countries bordering Senegal [i.e. Gambia and Guinea-Bissau]. The members of our group will need a loan equivalent to 600,000 francs CFA [about $1175] for the purchase of fresh fish, salt, and knives needed to make the dried fish. The working capital needed for the sale of beauty products will also be taken from this amount.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: le village de Elinkine est situer au Sud du Sénégal à 55 Km de la capitale régionale et à 18Km de Oussouye, capitale départemental. Elinkine est aujourd’hui l’un des villages les plus sollicités de la région voir du pays a cause de sa position géographique qui lui confère de carrefour très important et stratégique dans différents secteurs dont la pêche qui est le plus connu et ceci depuis les années 97 avec le déplacement du village des pêcheur de Diogué à Elinkine.

Objectifs du Prêt : l’objectif principal des membres du groupement Saxal Diam est : de part la transformation des produits halieutique et de leur vente parvenir à amélioré les conditions de vie de leur membre et de contribuer au développement du village d’Elinkine et de son entourage.

Activités : Les activités du groupement sont entre autre le petit commerce : il s’agi d’achat et de ventes de produit divers de beauté, de poisson séché dans le village et dans le pays ;en ce qui concerne le poisson sec qui est demandé partout dans le pays et dans les pays limitrophe Les membres du groupement auront besoin comme fond de roulement un montant égal à 600 000F CFA pour l’achat des poissons frais, du sel, des couteaux, des coupe-coupe, pour la transformation. Elles auront aussi pour besoin pour la vente des produits de beauté d’un fond de roulement qui sera tiré du même montant. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products and  fish-processing equipment; transportation of goods to market

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is 42 and mother of 3 children. She sells cassava in the community market. This has been her business over the past 5 years. She procures her supplies from outlying villages and transports the supplies to the town. Since cassava is a perishable commodity, she is compelled to buy only what can be sold within, say, 3 days. However, she sees the potential to purchase more for onward sale to other retailers in the satellite markets within the town for additional profit. She plans to invest the KIVA loan in this business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 43, and she has 5 children. Her husand works in construction and earns very little. To help him, she sell various items (pots, shopping bags, cups, plates and home-items). She keeps her merchandise in her home and generally travels to sell it, all the way to the Lacandona forest, which is 7 hours from her home. She then stays in this area until she has sold all of her items to the inhabitants there, who are generally indigenous peoples. With what she earns, she buys new merchandise. At this time, she needs a loan because she has nothing to sell. She is part of the group Laguna Azul (Blue Lake).

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

MARIA TIENE 43 AÑOS, CINCO HIJOS SU ESPOSO TRABAJA DE ALBAÑIL Y GANA MUY POCO. ELLA PARA AYUDARLO SE DEDICA A VENDER (OLLAS, BOLSAS PARA LAS COMPRAS, VASOS, PLATOS Y ARTICULOS PARA EL HOGAR). TIENE EN SU CASA LA MERCADERIA Y VIAJA GENERALMENTE A VENDER SUS PRODUCTOS HACIA LA SELVA LACANDONA LA CUAL QUEDA A SIETE HORAS DEL LUGAR EN EL QUE VIVE, POR LO QUE DEBE QUEDARSE AHI HASTA QUE VENDE SUS PRODUCTOS A LOS HABITANTES DE LA ZONA, GENERALMENTE INDIGENAS. CON LO OBTENIDO DE LAS VENTAS INVIERTE NUEVAMENTE EN MERCADERIA. EN ESTE MOMENTO NECESITA EL CREDITO PORQUE NO TIENE NADA PARA VENDER. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO LAGUNA AZUL,.

loans.use:
"Vender"

COMERCIANTE

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description

José started his business ten years ago. He sells juices, snow cones, and soft drinks in different flavors. He gives his customers excellent service every day from nine in the morning to six in the afternoon

Purpose of Loan

José needs this loan to restock his business, buy new products, and also to purchase a new tricycle vending cart. In his expanded business, he will be able to offer his younger brother a job.

About the Applicant

José is twenty-one. He is single and lives with his parents. He is the eldest of four brothers. He learned this business from his father when he was just a boy. At night, he works repairing electric appliances from his home. He hopes to improve and enlarge his business so that he can contribute more toward household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

José inicio su negocio hace 10 años. Los productos que vende son: Jugos, granizados y gaseosas en vasos en diferentes sabores. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 9am-a -6pm.

Uso del Préstamo

José necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de más y nuevos productos y también la adquisición de un nuevo triciclo. Dado que se le ha presentado la oportunidad de expandir su negocio ofreciendo empleo a su hermano menor.

Información Personal

José tiene 21años. Es soltero vive junto con sus padres. Es el mayor de sus 4 hermanos. El negocio lo aprendió de su padre desde cuando era niño. Por las noches realiza trabajos de reparación de artefactos eléctricos. Por lo que para su negocio utiliza espacio de la casa don de vive. Aspira ha mejorar y crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera colaborar de mejor manera y cubrir los gastos de la casa.

loans.use: To buy juices and soft drinks and purchase a new vending cart

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en:
Lagi S. is a hard-working woman of sixty-three, married with eight children. Her business is selling homemade donuts to school kids of her village. She’s been doing this almost two years now and she believes she’s doing fine.

Together with the assistance she gets from her husband and children, she is able to get her donuts ready to be sold early in the morning. She plans to use her loan to produce more products for her customers. Lagi appreciates the help of the S.P.B.D programme, lending her the money to help her with financing her business needs.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her donut stand

loans.name: Tajeddin

texts.en: Tajeddin B. is a meat and fish vendor at the bazaar in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 51 years old, married with three children and has been a vendor for the last 12 years. He has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit proving that he is a trustworthy customer. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $725 in order to purchase a refrigerator for his business as well as make some minor repairs to his business.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and make minor repairs to business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE A COPY MACHINE AND MAKE SMALL RENOVATIONS NEEDED TO BETTER SERVE HER CUSTOMERS

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is unemployed. They live in a rented house and she has a small sewing shop in the house. She applied to get $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and new fabric, renovate the shop, and do some advertising in order to increase her income and develop herself to provide a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering her name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus is a 45-year-old man who dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He currently relies on two vehicles for his public transport business, one of which he drives personally (the taxi), and he rents the microbus. He has a wife and a 20-year-old only son who depend on him.

Jesus has about six years of experience in the public transportation field, and the competition is rather high in this business since there are so many people who need it. His current request is so that he can maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade. This is the fourth loan that Jesus has had with the institution, and in this time, he has shown himself to be responsible and punctual with the payment of his loans.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Jesus es un señor de 45 años de edad que se dedica al transporte público en Micro y en Taxi. Actualmente cuenta con dos vehículos que trabajan para el servicio público, una de las movilidades la conduce personalmente (taxi) y el micro lo alquila. Tiene bajo su dependencia a su esposa y su único hijo que tiene 20 años de edad. Jesus tiene una experiencia aproximada de 6 años en el rubro del transporte público, si bien la competencia es bastante elevada en ese negocio, por la cantidad de población la demanda también es elevada. La presente solicitud es para efectuar el mantenimiento correspondiente a su movilidad, ya que es su herramienta de trabajo. Esta es la cuarta solicitud de Jesus con la institución y en este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: Maintaining his business vehicles

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo has recently married and now has the huge responsibility of taking care of a new life. His agricultural work has provided him a decent living, but he would like to increase his income in order to give stability and security to his child. To this end, he plans to increase his working capital with the goal of starting up a small grocery store, which his beloved wife will run. Your help would contribute to the achievement of this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Eduardo, acaba de conformar su hogar y tiene la inmensa responsabilidad de velar por una vida nueva en nuestro planeta, su labor agrícola han podido otorgarle bienestar pero desea acrecentar sus ganancias para brindarle estabilidad e seguridad a su pequeño, para este fin tiene pensado incrementar su capital de trabajo con el objetivo de establecer en poco tiempo un espacio de venta de abarrotes para desarrollo y ocupación de su querida esposa.Vuestra importante ayuda contribuirá con la realización de este deseo.

loans.use: To improve the products he plants

loans.name: Thim

texts.en: Thim S. is a 65-year-old widow living in the Prey Kao commune of Kampong Cham. Since 1980, she has worked hard as a rice and vegetable farmer making less than $1 per day. All of her children are single and live at home. With this small loan, she hopes to purchase better-quality land that will allow her to grow rice even during the dry season in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy better-quality farmland.

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.es:
After the separation from her husband 10 years ago, Betzabe has constantly fought to fulfill the roles of both mother and father to her children. Her desire to succeed has inspired her to create hand-knitted items according to meet the high number of orders she receives. She wishes to continue with this work which benefits her beloved family and she is asking for a loan to acquire a great quantity of wool in order to continue making her beautiful articles of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Tras la separación de su esposo hace 10 años Betzabe ha luchado constantemente para desempeñar los papeles de padre y madre para sus hijos. Los deseos de seguir adelante la animaron a realizar trabajos de tejido a mano de acuerdo a los pedidos que ahora alberga y en mayor número.Desea continuar con esta labor en beneficio de su amada familia y solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de lana para seguir con la confección de sus bellas prendas.

loans.use: Purchase a great quanity of wool

loans.name: Shemiddin

texts.en: Shemiddin A. is a 50 year old man who keeps a herd of sheep in the southern part of the Bilasuvar region in Azerbaijan. He has more than 15 years of experience in sheep breeding. He is married and has six children. He applied for 800 USD loan to purchase 10 sheep, at 60 USD each, and fodder for 200 USD.  As summer is high wedding season in Azerbaijan, selling a lot of sheep during this period will help him increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi M. U., 26, is single with no children. She has many years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the villagers 7 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1000 Tala (~416 USD). SPBD loans are Aliitasi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is a single female running a small shop in the village of Faleseela. She's supporting her parents and sisters.

loans.use: Restock her shop, to have enough supply

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
