Juliana is 25 years old. She is married with two children aged nine and four years old. She began selling bananas in 2003. Every day she works from 8am to 4:30pm and earns a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Juliana now hopes for a loan to buy more bananas to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her business.

loans.name: Three Sisters Group

texts.en: Fatmata L. is the leader of her microfinance borrowing group, which is called the "Three Sisters," and includes her friends Mariama K. and Edaline B..  Fatmata is 42 years old, married to a police officer, and has five children, all of whom go to school.  While her husband usually pays their children's school fees, Fatmata is usually responsible for their well-being and therefore works hard to take care of them and provide for them through her business.  Together the women in the Three Sisters borrowing group sell "gara lappers," or locally dyed clothes with fabricated designs, in Makeni City.  They started their business with previous loans by purchasing 150 yards of plain cotton, which they dyed and sold in their community.  The Three Sisters  are now finding that added capital would allow them to expand their capacity by purchasing another 90 yards of cotton, and are therefore requesting a loan of $1050.

loans.use: Expand on their businesses

loans.name: Puleono

texts.en: Puleono K., 22, is married with 1 child. She has 3 years of experience in the lawn mowing business. She provides this service to the village and general public 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Puleono's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. earnings will be use to improve business and help out with family husband operates the the lawn mowing business

loans.use: To improve business status and also help to improve her home

loans.name: Mrs. Ty Song Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ty S. was selected as the group leader of five people requesting a loan in Tumnob Leu Village in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Ty S. owns a small field where she cultivates rice. Mrs. Ty S. is a 45-year-old widow whose only child runs a grocery store. As her child’s business is doing well, she would like to help expand it. She will use her loan money to buy more grocery products to increase the store’s inventory of goods. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

All the members in her group loan have end-of-term loans (EoT), which means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. This type of loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her family's grocery store.

loans.name: Juma

texts.ru: Ярикулов Джума житель города Яван. Занимается животноводством уже 17 лет. Кроме этого бизнеса больше ничем не занимается. Значит  животноводство является основным источником дохода его семьи. он покупает и продает молодых бычков. Бизнес приносит неплохой доход. Теперь для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота он планирует получить кредит и закупить комбикорм. Хорошее питание даст хорошее потомство. Погасить кредитсможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Juma Y. lives in the city of Yavan. He has been raising livestock for the past 17 years. This business is the only thing he does, meaning that the livestock provide the sole source of income for his family. He buys and sells young bull calves. The business brings a fair profit. Now, in order to increase his head of cattle he decided to take out a loan for buying pre-mixed complete feed. Good nutrition will lead to good offspring. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of complete feed

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: N. Flavia has been operating a clothes business on a retail basis for a period of 3 years.  Due to increased customer demand, she is using the loan to purchase more clothes, a move to brace her self for the Christmas season. She is 35 years old, married with 3 children. She resides in Kasangati, a residence she has acquired due to her hard work. She now has the dream of seeing her children through school successfully.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena es casada, tiene 48 años,  solo vive con su esposo en su propia casa que adquirieron recientemente. Desde hace 2 años, junto a su esposo trabaja en su pequeño aserradero, donde elaboran todo tipo de mangos para instrumentos y herramientas; como picos, palas, martillos, etc. Su trabajo consiste en buscar la madera, que principalmente es el eucalipto, y los fines de semana van a repartir su producción a las principales tiendas de herramientas. También llevan grandes cantidades a la ciudad de Lima cada 15 días, para obtener mayores ganancias. Elena se encarga de la administración del taller, y es quien consigue a los clientes, que son los dueños de las tiendas. Es la segunda vez que Elena tiene un préstamo con MFP, para ella es una gran ayuda formar parte de su banco comunal, porque le permite socializar con los integrantes de su grupo y también crecer económicamente. El dinero que solicita es para comprar una máquina cortadora de madera llamada torno y está valorizada en  1800 a 2000, de sobrar una cantidad comprará madera para abastecerse.
texts.en:
Elena is married, is 48 years old, and lives alone with her husband in their own house that they acquired recently. For two years, alongside her husband, she has worked in their small sawmill where they make all types of handles for instruments and tools such as picks, shovels, hammers, etc. Her work consists of looking for wood, principally eucalyptus, and on the weekends going to sell their work to the main tool stores. They also bring great quantities to the city of Lima every 15 days in order to obtain greater earnings. Elena is in charge of managing the shop and finding the customers who are owners of the shops. This is the second time that Elena is receiving a loan from MFP. For her, it is a great help to be part of her community bank because it allows her to socialize with the members of her group and also grow financially. The money that she is requesting is to purchase a wood cutting machine named a lathe and is valued at 1800 to 2000. Any money leftover will buy wood supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a wood cutting machine.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Salimata S. a 34 ans mariée et vit avec son époux et ses quatre (4) enfants (2 garçons et 2 filles) à Banconi, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Salimata S. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, elle  opta pour le commerce de  céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho) il y a maintenant sept (07) ans. Elle dispose son magasin à Kaboïla I en face de la B.O.A. (Banque Ouest Africaine).
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant cinq (5) ans. Après 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association Kotognogontala de Banconi), elle est actuellement à son 4ème prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 23 sacs de Maïs, 10 sacs de Sorgho et 11 sacs de Mil.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso avant de les revendre soit en gros à une clientèle composée généralement de revendeurs, soit en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement composée de chefs de famille.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  payer les intérêts de son prêt, contribuer aux dépenses de la famille  et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Salimata S., 34, is married and lives with her husband and her four children (two boys and 2 girls) in Banconi, and outlying neighborhood of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Salimata S., after having tried various businesses without success, decided to sell cereals (maize, millet, sorghum) 7 years ago. She has a little store in Kaboïla I opposite the Bank of West Africa (B.O.A.)

With the intention of better satisfying the needs of her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After 5 solidarity loans (group loans) in an association with women from her neighborhood (Association Kotognogontala of Banconi), she is now on her 4th individual loan and all the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed. With this loan she intends to buy 23 sacks of maize, 10 sacks of sorghum, and 11 sacks of millet. She does her buying in places near the town of Sikasso before selling either in bulk to a clientele composed in general of retailers, or retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele essentially composed of heads of families.

She expects to make, thanks to this loan, a monthly profit of 200,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to pay the interest on her loan and help support her family, investing any remainder back into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing cereals for re-sale

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
Umedjon is married with two children. He is a market vendor from Dushanbe where he sells teenagers' clothing. Umedjon is very enterprising, has vast experience working as a vendor, and is full of creative ideas. A reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in his work and have helped to ensure the success of his business. Umedjon has been running his business for many years. In general he has about 6 years of experience selling clothing. Currently, he is requesting a loan of $900 USD to increase his inventory. He promises to repay the loan within 12 months. He believes that having this additional turnover capital will help him minimize his sales risk and provide stable financial support for his family. Moreover, it will help him get closer to his ultimate goal of purchasing a big store of his own. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new goods for resale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M., forty-nine, is a widowed mother of six children, four of whom are males and two females. According to her, she lost her husband three years ago. One of her children is in the university and two are learning trades. The rest are in the junior high and the basic schools. She says she is the sole provider for the children. Ama lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Ama works very hard to provide for her family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called “Ga-Kenkey”. Kenkey is produced from corn dough. The cooked dough is balled in corn husk and cooked again. It is served hot with pepper and fried fish. She sells by the street in the evenings. Ama has been in this business for three years. She wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity sells drinks, foodstuffs and general provisions. Charity is 45 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is a teacher.

Charity needs a loan of 70,000 NGN ($475) to buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy drinks, foodstuffs  and provisions for sale.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
"Business-minded woman" describes Mrs. Charlita E.. She is 44 years old, married, and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City with her husband who is a tricycle driver. Their other source of income is from her business doing manual photo lamination. She learned this skill when she was in high school.

She started her business with Php 3,000 in capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Today, she is applying for a Php 7,000 loan. She will buy materials for photo lamination and “bugang” (Visayan term for a native grass used for broom making) for her new business. She aims to build a photo shop someday. She hopes and prays that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To buy photo-lamination and broom-making supplies

loans.name: Phung Thi

texts.en:
Thuận Phùng Thị (1219030729) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Thuận owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock and making and selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs and making tofu for sale.  Thuận has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, Thuận joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thuận has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Thuận is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies and invest in her business.  The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Thuận plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mahsud

texts.ru: Махсудчон мужчина , который имеет бизнес производства и продажи домашних национальных лепёшек, хлеба. Махсудчон  каждый свой кредит использует на свой бизнес (покупку угля, несколько тонн муки, и.т.д.) Следующий займ он планирует  использовать на закуп небольшой партии муки первого сорта. У него хлеб имеет большой спрос из-за хорошего качества и товарного вида. При каждом мониторинге мы убеждаемся, что у Махсудчона стабильный доход с его бизнеса-производства.
texts.en:
Mahsud owns a business, a bakery, where he bakes special Tajik flatbreads for sale. Every loan that Mahsud had with us he has used to improve his business (purchase of coal, a few tonnes of flour etc.). He is planning to use this loan to purchase a small batch of highest quality flour. Mahsud's flatbreads are very popular due to their excellent quality and appetizing looks. Every time we visit Mahsud we are convinced that his business yields a steady income and is very reliable.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
B. Đỗ Thị, 57, lives in the town of Ninh Giang. She is married and has two adult children. To making a living, B. owns ans operates a restaurant where she sells a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. B. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month.

In 2004, B. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. B. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. She used this previous loan to expand her business. B. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND that she will use to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be her fifth loan from TYM Fund. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Betty Kabuye’S Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is the leader of a 4-member group. She is a 52 years old and married with nine children aged between 15 and 33 years. Four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with seven people. There is electricity and piped water at her home and the family gets three meals a day.

Hadjah resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She deals in local gin in Bakuli, one of the Kampala suburbs and has been in this business for the last eleven years. She sells mainly wholesale and sells to an average of twenty people a day. She sells to adults, excluding children. She works six days a week. She uses public transportation to and from shopping from Kampala city and goes for shopping twice a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for the business premises.

Hadjah has been with MCDT for over seven years and is servicing her eighteenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local gin and to pay school fees for her children at higher institutions of learning. Hadjah is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Toet

texts.en: The smiling person shown in the picture above is Toet S., 32, at work on the farm. She has been farming rice for more than ten years. In addition, she has built a small stall next to her house where she raises a few pigs for sale. To help her with the hard labor on the farm, her husband works with her in growing the rice crop. Toet S. is married and has been blessed with two school-aged children. Toet S. will be using the loan to add to her little personal savings to purchase a small plot of neighbor’s farmland which she will use to cultivate rice.

loans.use: To purchase a small plot of neighbor’s farmland

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a member of the Mafifi south in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 27 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child,Her child is aged 4 years.

Christina started her own business selling maize 3 years ago,she works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is christina first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for the sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Christina hopes to save more money,get more food for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Alberto T. nasceu no Município da Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira de Suazilândia, tem 44 anos vive maritalmente é pai de 7 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 2 meses aos 16 anos, de mães diferentes,  não responsabiliza se por ninguém e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00MT.

Aberto quando concluiu a 10ª classe faz o curso de professorado que durou três anos, (tempo regular) após concluir é afecto numa localidade que dista 45 km da vila do Município é funcionário permanente a mais de 15 anos com a categoria de director da Escola auferindo mensalmente um valor de 7.799.00MT. Sendo único com fonte de rendimento na família, não consegue satisfazer as suas necessidades e aproxima se ao BIM (Banco Internacional de Moçambique) solicitando um empréstimo para dar inicio da sua obra que devido ao elevado custo do material não foi concluída. 

Então aproxima se a uma outra instituição bancaria ProCredito solicitando um empréstimo para dar continuidade da mesma que pagou com muito sucesso. Mas devido à distância opta em trabalhar com a Hluvuku e solicita um valor de 15.000.00MT para concluir as mínimas partes da sua obra (compra de material de construção).


Este é primeiro empréstimo de Alberto na Hluvuku e Kiva. Serão usados para fazer a conclusão da sua obra, pois esta muito ansiosa em concluir porque seus bens estão dispersos e sem cuidados pessoais. Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir novo empréstimo para fazer um murro em sua residência.
texts.en:
Alberto T. was born in the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland. He is 44 years old and lives with his common-law wife. He has 7 children between the ages of 2 months and 16 years, with different mothers. He doesn't support anyone else economically and is able to save 1000 meticals a month. When Alberto finished 10th grade he did a three-year teacher training course. When he finished, he went to a community 45 km from Namaacha, where he's been a school principal for more than 15 years, earning 7799 meticals a month. Since his salary is his family's only source of income, he's not able to meet all their needs and approached BIM (International Bank of Mozambique) requesting a loan to begin building a house, which he was unable to finish because of the high cost of materials. He then approached another bank, ProCredito, requesting a loan to continue the work, which he paid back successfully. But because of the distance, he has now chosen to work with Hluvuku and has requested another loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals to buy construction materials and finish the work. This is Alberto's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. He will use the money to finish his project, since he's eager to finish his possessions are scattered and neglected. He is confident that he will be able to pay back the loan with no difficulty and then request another to build a wall around his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Yèyinou Béatrice

texts.fr: Z. Yèyinou Béatrice est née en 1972 à HOUNVE, commune d'Adjarra. Béatrice est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux scolarisés. Béatrice  vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille grâce aux revenus de son activité. Pour arriver à mieux aider son mari, Béatrice veut mieux développer son activité. Pour y arriver, Béatrice compte équiper son salon de couture de matériel nécessaire. Alors, Béatrice sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Z. Yèyinou Béatrice was born in 1972 in HOUNVE, in the community of Adjarra.  She is married and the mother of three children, of whom two are in school.  Béatrice comes to her husband's aid in meeting family expenses, thanks to the revenues from her business.  To be able to help her husband further, she wants to improve her business.  To do so, she plans to equip her dressmaking salon with the necessary supplies and equipment.  Béatrice is therefore requesting the financial support of ALIDé to achieve this.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado D. Pusuyo del Distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. el Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 45 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda tiene 04 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Pusuyo, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 4 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. aves D. corral.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino  y aves D. corral, ella los adquiere en Ilave y las comunidades cercanas y los venD. en las ferias D. la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is a 45 year old widow with four children. She lives in the Pusuyo community. She did not have the opportunity to get an education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost four years. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase capital in her business of buying and selling poultry. She currently needs a new loan for 700 PEN, which will allow her to buy sheep and poultry. She gets them in Ilave and neighboring communities. She sells them in regional fairs. Her biggest desire is to continue working. She likes the savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Maria Celeny

texts.es: Maria Celeny vive en su propia casa con su hijo que todavía depende de ella. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa. Anteriormente ella no tenía el capital suficiente para seguir adelante, ya para iniciar a trabajar una amiga le facilito un préstamo y poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su humilde vivienda para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Celeny lives in her own house with her child, who is still dependent upon her. She has been selling clothes for over ten years. Previously, she did not have enough capital to get ahead. In order to start to work, a friend provided a loan. Little by little her business has been growing. The loan she is asking for is to buy products. Her wish is to provide improvements to her humble home for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She manages the business to support her home financially. With the loan of N80,000, she plans to expand her business, which is now booming. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. ‘My customers patronize me because of the local dishes I prepare,' says Mercy. She is 30 years old, and married with 2 children. She lives in Delta State, Nigeria.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio O. is married and has two adult children. When he was young, Antonio helped his father, who worked at a club, and was responsible for the music selection. Antonio decided to open his own night club in Caacupe, and has been very successful in providing a fun and entertaining watering hole for locals. Antonio will use his loan to buy a projector, so that he can play music videos and movies on the walls of his club, to improve the ambiance. Antonio wants to constantly innovate his club and be at the forefront of entertainment in Caacupe. Antonio wants to leave his legacy to his son, who is currently working with him and learning the trade.

loans.use: To purchase an image projector

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en el cuarto ciclo del proyecto Mujeres Emprendedoras y sus integrantes se encuentran muy satisfechos por esta iniciativa que proviene D. la Fundación  ya son mujeres D. escasos recursos  y conseguir un crédito para trabajar se hace imposible para ellas. Mediante la ayuda crediticia que brindada  por la Fundación cada una pudo comenzar, seguir y mejorar la actividad que realiza. 
Se pueD.  hablar D. la Sra. Hilda B. D. 46 años D. edad , tiene 1 hijo estudiante D. nivel terciarios, Hilda trabaja fuera D. su casa  pero los fines D. semana ella prepara comestible y lo venD. en frente a su casa .Es una señora luchadora que se dedica a múltiple actividades para ayudar con los gastos D. la casa. 
Tiene una casita pequeña , que desearía ampliar para para abrir una despensa y dar vianda, agradece por la ayuda recibida.
Las actividades que cada integrante realiza.
Myriam A. R.. Venta dezapatos y carteras
Maria Del Carmen G.. Pèluquera
Sabina Lopez Notario. Venta D. merceria
Lidia M. InsaurralD. N.Venta  D. carbòn
Cinthia n. F. R.Venta D. Ropas
Maria B.R..Venta D. frutas 
Claudia R.G..Venta D. comestible
Noelia C. S..Venta D. empanadas
Marta S. M.Venta D. ropas
Nilda I. D..Venta D. plateria
Miryan E. Agüero.Venta D. ropas
Maura C. A..Venta D. Tele Bingo
Maria L. V..Modista
Justina G. M..Venta D. lenceria
Hilda J. B..Venta D. cosmestibles
Miryan T..Venta D. comidas
Karen M. Mendez.Venta D. cosmeticos
Amelia C. G..Venta D. comidas
texts.en:
This group is currently in the fourth round of loans with the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women) Project and its members are very satisfied with this initiative from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya because they are low-income women for whom obtaining working capital is impossible. Thanks to the credit provided by the Fundación, each member could start, continue, and make better the activities they carry on. For example, we can talk about Mrs. Hilda B., who is 46 years old and has a son attending college. Hilda works outsiD. her home, but on weekends, she prepares food to sell in front of her house. She is a strong woman who carries on multiple activities to help with the household's expenses. Hilda has a small little house to which she would love to make additions to open a convenience store and start a catering business. She is grateful for the help she has received. Each member has the following businesses: Myriam A. R.. Selling shoes and bags Maria del Carmen G.. Hair salon Sabina Lopez Notario. Selling buttons, ribbons, and other notions Lidia M. InsaurralD. N. Selling coal Cinthia N. F. R.Selling clothes Maria B.R.. Selling fruit Claudia R.G..Selling food items Noelia C. S.. Selling "empanadas" (turnovers) Marta S. M. Selling clothes Nilda I. D.. Selling silver items Miryan E. Agüero. Selling clothes Maura C. A.. Selling lottery tickets Maria L. V.. Seamstress Justina G. M.. Selling lingerie Hilda J. B.. Selling make-up and cosmetics Miryan T.. Selling food items Karen M. M.. Selling make-up and cosmetics Amelia C. G.. Selling food items

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to increase their sales

loans.name: Independece Group Ii

texts.en:
Maame is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Maame prepares and sells kenkey (corn dumplings steamed in banana leaves) with fried fish. She is the leader the Independence II trust bank. The members of the group are mainly traders. They are hard-working, trust themselves, and want the loans to invest in their businesses. 

Maame, the group leader, is seated in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a business man. He is 30 years old, married, and the father of two children. He owns a timber business, and he has been in this business for over five years. He is using the loan to purchase and stock timber for customers’ orders. His future desire is to educate his children and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase and stock timber

loans.name: Cilla

texts.en:
Cilla C. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol and beer out of her home and is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to use. Cilla is 20 years old and is married to a husband who is a security guard. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar and restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more materials to use

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy staples for local population

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra Patricia J. de 23 años de edad, reside en el Cantón del Plan del Pino, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como carpintero. Desde hace 6 años que Sandra posee una granja en la cual se dedica a criar pollos y a engordar cerdos, los cuales posteriormente se encarga de vender. De esta manera también brinda los servicios de engorde de cerdos, trabajo en el que ella se compromete a criar este tipo de animales. Sandra solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más pollos y cerdos, así mismo comprar concentrado, vitaminas y antibióticos para el cuidado de ellos. Sandra cuenta con muchos clientes, ya que es una persona muy responsable quien desempeña su trabajo de la mejor manera, brindando un excelente producto. Sandra depende en gran manera de este negocio, ya que es así como junto a su esposo logran solventar todos sus gastos en conjunto.
texts.en:
Sandra Patricia J. is 23 years old, lives in Cantón del Plan del Pino, which is located in the district of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who is a carpinter. For the past six years, Sandra has owned and run a farm, raising chickens and feeding pigs, which she later sells. She also offers her pig-feeding services to others, helping to ensure the pigs get larger. Sandra is seeking this loan to buy more chickens and pigs as well as concentrate (food), vitamins, and antibiotics for their care. Sandra has many clients because she is a very responsible person who works diligently and offers high-quality products. Sandra truly relies on this business, which, along with her husband's income, provides for their expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and pigs

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en: Jargalsaihan is 37 years old and lives with his daughter in Tuv Province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in an apartment. His daughter, Altantsetseg, is 13 years old and attends a local secondary school. Jargalsaihan graduated as a carpenter in 1992, and he operates a carpentry business in his town. Jargalsaihan manufactures wooden furniture, such as doors and roof rings for gers. He has been operating his business since 1995, and has gained much experience. He operates his business on the weekends, and works as a machinist at the local heating utility during the week. Jargalsaihan has been planning to purchase automatic equipment which will make it easier for him to manufacture his products. He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~705 USD) loan to purchase large amounts of raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his business

loans.name: Souher

texts.en:
Souher is a forty-nine-year-old woman who lives in Saida, which is in southern Lebanon, with her husband. Souher has been working as a seamstress since 1996. She repairs and sews all types of clothes; she also does curtains, bed sheets, and more. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a sewing machine and thread for her work. This is her fourth cycle and she has always paid on time.

Souher's work is speciA.; she is known for her good and precise work. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties since she already had sewing machines. She learned the business when she was young, so she has always been sewing. She plans to continue improving in her work in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and thread for her work.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie S. is from Poblacion, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 43 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Rosemarie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 19th loan taken out by Rosemarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta N. est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 9 avril 2009 et a reçu 3 fois de suite un crédit et a toujours remboursé régulièrement. Elle fait un petit commerce de produits divers tels le poisson séché, du piment, de l'ail, du poivre et d'autre épices. Avec ce nouveau crédit elle va intensifier son activité en achetant plus de marchandises et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir mieux s'impliquer dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anta N. is 47 years old, married and the mother of five children, all under her care. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group since 9 April 2009 and has been granted three successive loans, all repaid in full. She runs a small business selling a variety of products such as dried fish, hot peppers, garlic, pepper, and other spices. This new loan will enable her to intensify her activity by acquiring more merchandise, increasing her profit margins, and allowing her to become more involved in supporting her family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capital

loans.name: Alejandro Jose

texts.es:
Don Alejandro es un hombre trabajador, padre de dos hijos, vive en el barrio Linda vista, juntos han construido su casa de concreto ya que ambos trabajan, y ahorran para poder hacer las mejoras. Su trabajo es la construcción desde hace varios años, inicio como ayudante y aprendió el cual ahora gana mejor y tiene un trabajo fijo en mantenimiento de la empresa. 
Hacen falta mejoras en su casa como poner el piso, hacer divisiones, mejorar las puertas. Su trabajo no es fácil, es cansado. Lo bueno es cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa. Tiene materiales comprado como: piso y cemento para poner en su casa,  pero aun le hace falta material el cual espera poder pegarlo pronto y lograr una mejor higiene en su hogar.
Con este financiamiento comprara herramientas que le ayuden en su labor cotidiana, como: cerrucho, cepillo, maquina de soldar entre otros, ya que son de altos costos y no logra comprarlas de un solo, es por eso compra a trabes del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a hard-working married father of two. He lives in the Linda vista neighbourhood, and together he and his family built his house out of concrete. They both work and save up to make home improvements. Alejandro has worked in construction for several years; he began as an assistant and learned from there. He now makes more money and has a steady job maintaining the business. He needs to make improvements to his house, such as laying a floor, making room divisions, and improving the doors. His job is not easy; he is tired. Luckily, he can count on the help of his wife. He has bought materials such as flooring and cement for the house, but he still needs more material and he hopes to get the improvements done soon in order to have better hygiene in his home. With this loan, he will buy tools to help him with his daily work, such as: a handsaw, a plane, and a welder, among others. These cost a lot and he has not managed to buy them on his own; thus, he will buy them with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: tools for home improvements

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 39 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children.

Three years ago, Shirley invested in farming and continues to farm today. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells at their local market. She says she is thankful for her farm because it helps provide for the increasing needs in her household.

Shirley joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Shirley is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and also other farm inputs. This loan will be her ninth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny C. is from the village of Brgy.Uno, Katipunan. She is 41 years old. Leny is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Leny plants and sells vegetables in the local community. Leny has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leny joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Leny is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leny from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Askarali

texts.ru: Шарипов Аскарали проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 28 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай. На полученную прибыль он хочет расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Askarali S. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 28 years old, married and has 2 children. He has a secondary education. Askarali has been involved in agriculture for over 6 years. He leases a plot of land, where he plants vegetables for sale. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers, in order to get a good harvest. He wants to use the resulting profit to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  buy more bales of used clothing for her stall

loans.name: Rahima's Group

texts.en: Rahima A. is the leader of the group. She is 57, married and has a son and two daughters. Her son is working and the daughters are at school. Rahima is a teacher at school and her husband works as a taxi driver. A year ago Rahima got a loan in the amount of 10,000 soms and started to breed livestock. Now she applied for a loan because she needs money to purchase sheep in order to increase the number of livestock. Gulnur A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 41, married and has two daughters and two sons. Her first son and first daughter are at school, and the other children are preschool age (under 7 years). Gulnur is a teacher at school and her husband works in construction. A year ago Gulnur got a loan in amount of 10,000 soms and started to breed cattle. Having sold a bull after fattening she made 12,000 soms. Now with money received from this loan, she wants to purchase a cow in order to increase the number of cattle. Alymkan B., 41, is married and has three daughters and two sons. Her first daughter works in a casino, her first son works as a security guard, her second son is at school and the other children are preschool age. A year ago Alymkan took a loan and purchased five sheep for breeding. She applied for another loan because she wants to purchase sheep to increase the number of livestock. Galina R. is a 63 year old widow and she works as a teacher at school. A year ago she got a loan and purchased a bull for breeding. She sold that bull after fattening and made a profit of 8,000 soms. Now she hopes to obtain a loan to purchase cattle for breeding. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 43 years old and a single mother of one. She has raised her child using the income from her salon.

Lucy’s business is located in a very busy environment and most of her customers are middle and low income earners. She hopes to stabilize the business, which she has been running for twelve years. She believes that, with a stable business, she will be able to employ more people.

Lucy has requested a loan of 70,000 Kes to buy plastic chairs, a hairdrier and mirrors. She wants her salon to look classic so as to attract more customers in the future. She describes herself as a hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs, a hairdrier and mirrors

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
el señor Margarito A. tiene 31 años de edad, esta casado y tiene un hijo de meses. su esposa se dedica a cuidarlo, ellos viven en la aldea el Zope a escasos 800 metros de la carretera que conduce a Coyolito.
el señor Margarito se dedica al negocio de pulperia desde hace 6 años, el comento que le va muy bien y que 
las ventas se mantienen a pesar de la crisis por que pasa el pais. En su negocio vende maiz, azucar, café, frijoles, jabon, pollo, jugos, harina de maiz, manteca y refrescos,  sus clientes son los vecinos y personas que visitan el lugar ya que se encuentra ubicado en una zona cerca de la playa, este lugar es visitado por turistas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para tener mas surtido su negocio y asi ofrecerles varios productos a sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hijo y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Margarito A. is 31 years old, he is married and he has a new born baby boy. His wife stays at home to take care of him. They live in the village of El Zope, about 800 meters from the road to Coyolito. Margarito has had a grocery store for the past 6 years and he says it has been very successful. He has managed to keep up his sales despite the country's crisis. In his business he sells corn, sugar, coffee, beans, soaps, chicken, juices, corn flour, lard, and soft drinks to his clients who are his neighbors and visitors to the village. The store is located close to a beach and it is a well visited tourist area. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to restock his business so that he may offer a variety of products to his clients. He needs this source of income to cover his son's expenses and those for the entire household.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, sugar, coffee, beans, soaps, chicken, juices, corn flour, lard, and soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Nelly Ludgarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MUJERES UNIDAS ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de  San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelly;   ella tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda; y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia es profesora cesante y desde hace 10 años se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de productos de belleza llamados natura, ella trabaja vendiendo estos productos y enseñando a las nuevas profesionales en belleza a ofrecer el producto. La socia es una mujer sumamente encantadora y nos cuenta que ella es socia antigua de Arariwa y esta con el sistema de bancos comunales desde hace 11 años y no quiere retirarse de este grupo ameno y desea seguir trabajando en la compra y venta de sus diferentes productos y para lo cual siempre cuenta con el apoyo de este crédito. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar productos y almacenarlos en su vitrina que tiene en casa para cuando sus amigas la vistan. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mayor producto de natura.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" [United Women] which is located in the district of San Sebastián, in the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Nelly, 65, who is a widow and has three children. The member is a unemployed professor and for ten years has sold beauty products called Natura. She works selling these products and teaching new beauty professionals to sell the product. The member is quite a charming woman and tells us she is a long-time associate of Arariwa and this with the system of communal banks for eleven years now. She does not wish to leave this enjoyable group but rather would like to continue retailing her various products and counting on the support of this loan. She needs the loan to buy products and store them in her display case that she has at home for when her friends come by to visit. The member needs the loan to invest in the purchase of more Natura products. 

The member appreciates and gives thanks for the loan provided by this means and likewise promises to make her payments within the established time period.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of more Natura products

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan S. is currently in the business of selling food items such as yams, sweet potatoes, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock more food items to sell.  Susan is 33 years old and is married to a policeman. She has three children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy some land.

loans.use: Stock more food items to sell

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: El señor Rafael Antonio G. C., tiene la edad de 35 años, habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla es casado, ellos tienen un hijo de 16 años que se dedica a estudiar la escuela de secundaria, su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 3 años, su esposa le brinda su apoyo administrativo, el negocio que se ha convertido en la principal fuente de ingresos de la familia G., dentro de las dificultades que  les han afectado ha sido una enfermedad inesperada que golpeo a toda la familia, es para su miscelánea que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de Abarrotes, Lácteos, Golosinas, gaseosas, etc. Que favorezcan a mejores ventas y los recursos a nuevos fuentes de ingresos para el mejor desarrollo socio económico de su hijo sobretodo que pronto entrara a la universidad y esperan tener las condiciones para favorecerlo en sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en: Rafael Antonio G. C. is 35 years old.  He lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla division.  He is married and has a 16 year-old son who is studying at high school.  His business is a small grocery store which he has had for 3 years.  His wife supports him in running the business.  It has become the main source of income for the G. family.  Amongst the difficulties which they have faced has been an unexpected illness which hit the whole family.  It is for his general store that he is requesting this loan so that he can purchase a larger inventory of groceries, dairy products, sweets, sodas, etc.  He hopes for better sales and new sources of income to improve the socio-economic development of  his son because he will soon start university and they hope to be able to be in a position to support him in his professional studies.

loans.use: To buy a larger inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María de 49 años, tiene un salón de belleza en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su  hijo de 14 años  en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas ya que en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

Hace 20 años atrás ella aprendió hacer manicura y pedicura para poder mantener a su hijo ya que su esposo la abandono, comenzó a hacer el trabajo de casa en casa hasta que con algunos ingresos pudo tener su propio local para tener su peluquería. En la actualidad tiene un salón de belleza donde trabaja sola y hace todo estilo de peinados, cepillados, alisados, tratamientos, pedicura, manicura etc.    

Para continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo esmaltes, tintes, tratamientos para ofrecerles más alternativas a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y terminar de construir su casa porque ahora es de caña.
texts.en:
María, 49, has a beauty salon in the front part of her house.  She lives with her 14-year-old son in an urban zone, called Orquídeas (Orchids), because when it was discovered there were a lot of flowers and now there is a park with those flowers.

Twenty years ago she learned how to do manicures and pedicures to be able to support her son since her husband abandoned them.  She started doing the work door to door until she was able to collect enough money to have her own place and have her barber shop.  She currently has a beauty salon where she works by herself doing all kinds of hair styles, comb outs, hair straightening, hair treatments, pedicures, manicures, etc.

In order to stay in business she wants to use the loan to buy nail polish, hair dyes and treatments to offer more alternatives to her customers.  In the future she wants to improve the construction of her house because it’s currently made from sugar cane stalks.

loans.use: For hair treatments, nail polish and dyes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single mother with one son who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

For over 10 years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells at wholesale to her neighbors and food vendors. Christine faces the major challenges of theft and seasonality in her business. She hopes to build her own home and purchase a pick-up van to use to transport her goods. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase 50 sacks of charcoal and pay for a business permit. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve her business and her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and pay for a business permit.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda F. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 40 years old. Imelda is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Imelda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand fishing business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, polos, casacas, blusas y chompas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) communal bank, located within the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Nancy is 32 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells clothing, such as pants, polo shirts, jackets, blouses, and sweaters.  She sells on foot from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM and wants to expand and improve her clothing sales business.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy clothing in large quantity.

She is happy about this loan and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta S. is from the village of Poblacion, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Marietta is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Marietta owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & toothpaste in the local community. Marietta has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marietta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Marietta is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and detergents. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marietta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & detergents

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie E. is a married woman who lives in Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  motorcycle transport and hog-fattening and duck-raising businesses. Her husband, Rusel E., who is 47 years old, works as a motorcycle transport operator to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. 

They have six children who are between 12 and 27 years old. 

Marjorie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marjorie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to pay for a motorcycle so that she can continue to save up for the future education of the children. Marjorie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Gerson

texts.en:
Gerson B. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. He is 50 years old. Gerson is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gerson owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts for copras in the local community. He is also making and selling coco charcoal. Gerson has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gerson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gerson is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconut shells for charcoal. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gerson from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconut shells for charcoal

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard M. is 26 years old.  He is from Pap Onditi, married to Lucia, and they have one child who is two years old.

Bernard has a retail shop that he has been running for the past four years.  He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client here.  

Bernard wants to buy soap, cooking oil, baking flour, etc. to add to his stock.   He is very optimistic that his business will do well after the loan investment.   He earns a monthly income of KES. 12,000.

His dream is to be able to have more stock than what he has today.

loans.use: Buy soap, cooking oil, baking flour to sell

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick has been doing mixed farming in Kitale Town in Western Kenya for over four years.  He is married and has one child. His produce of milk, eggs and vegetables are all sold to the local market. He solely relies on farming to support his family.

Fredrick has requested a loan amounting to 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the improved milk production possible through the purchase of the additional cow will go along way in improving his family's well-being – it will supplement family meals and create a better foundation for his children's education in the future. He hopes to add four more cows in five years time.

Fredrick says the challenges his business is facing are diseases and animal feed shortages.  However, he remains optimistic in his ability to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Kanybek

texts.en:
Kanybek D. is 59, married and has five grown children. For a long time, he worked as a driver in the local area but after the breakdown of the Soviet Union, he started his own business in cattle breeding and land cultivation. With starting capital of 5,000 KGS, he managed to develop a farm with eight cows and bulls earning a monthly profit of 5,000 KGS. With the revenues, he was able to provide a good education to his children.

Kanybek has now applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase cattle in order to broaden his business. In the future, he dreams of developing a big farm with a large number of cattle.

Bai-Tushum and Partners, one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan, use Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas, leading to increased employment and meeting the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Amanyire

texts.en:
Amanyire R. is an individual client from Kyenjojo. He is 30 years old and married with 3 children. He has a retail shop in Enjeru Trading centre that he has owned for 10 years that sells general items like sugar, soap, salt and waragi, a local brew. 

He is able to make 570,000 shillings as monthly income from his sales. He also owns cows from which he sells milk and meat and these supplement his income. Amanyire is standing on the right in a brown jacket with the Loan Officer of Pearl Microfinance on the left and being dedicated has enabled him succeed. 

He started his business with savings from his old motorcycle business and he now needs a loan to be able revive it by buying a new motorcycle for hire.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for hire

loans.name: Kavule Effort Development Group C

texts.en: Juliet N., age 42, has been engaged in a clothing and shoe sales enterprise for the past 12 years in Mukono Town. This happily-married mother of six says she was inspired by one of her closest friends to set forth in this business. Before that, she mostly performed odd jobs. Hard work and determination have been her pillars as she goes about her business. Her business generates 300,000 UGX per week as profit. With this loan, Juliet says she is going to purchase more bales of clothing and pairs of shoes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothing and pairs of shoes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets for the roof of his house

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela de 36 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución) su esposo es chofer. Y tienen dos hijos que estudian en colegios fiscales. Su actividad comercial es la ventas de comesticos.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás ya que ella quería trabajar y con el tiempo no le daba para cuidar a sus hijos que decidió escoger es actividad en las ventas de productos de belleza por catálogos. Labora diariamente después de dejar a sus hijos del colegio recorrer por todo el sector promocionando sus productos a a amigos y conocidos. Le afecta en su negocio son los ladrones ya que tiene que trasladar sus productos a diferente lugares y por todos lado esta peligroso. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería para poder aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro desea terminar su vivienda al 100% y ser directora de comesticos.
texts.en:
Manuela, 36, lives in the Primavera de Duran (city outskirts that used to be undeveloped, with some hills, creeks, and lagoons that still seem like a decaying natural area). Her husband is a driver and they have two children who are in public school.  Her business is cosmetics sales.

She began a while ago since she wanted to work, but she didn’t have much time because of having to take care of her children, so she decided to sell beauty products through catalogs.  She works every day after she leaves her children at school and she goes everywhere promoting her products to friends and acquaintances.  Thieves have affected her sales since she has to go to different places and it’s dangerous in many areas.  She would like to use the loan to buy more merchandise so that she can increase her income.  In the future she would like to finish her house and be a director in the cosmetics business.

loans.use: To buy supplies of  beauty products, creams, perfume, and makeup .

loans.name: Jorge Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto tiene 33, cuenta con casa propia en la cual reside con sus espsa y sus 2 hijos , sus casa está ubicada en el caserío Jesús Del Valle en el distrito de Tambogrande, este  caserío es  mediano con deseos de superación.

Ernesto se dedica a realizar labores agrícolas, el cuenta  con 1 hectárea  de terreno agrícola que sus padre le han dado como herencia en donde tiene limón en producción el cual lo cosecha semanalmente con lo cual asume sus obligaciones familiares y crediticias, además también se dedica a la crianza de ganado  ovino los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral.

 Ernesto está solicitando un  préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para que pueda compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y realizar labores de poda y deshierbo, además de compra de  alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales  y así poderlos vender a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su actividad. 

Ernesto es un hombre  bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que lo conocen lo consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.


.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 33 years old.  He owns his house where he lives with his wife and two children.  The house is located in the Jesús Del Valle hamlet in Tambogrande District.  This is a medium hamlet wishing to improve.

Ernesto is a farmer.  He has one hectare of farmland that his parents have given him as an inheritance.  He produces lemons that are harvested weekly and with which he’s able to cover family and credit obligations.  In addition, he also raises sheep that he later sells at the local market.  His wife raises barnyard fowl.

Ernesto is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy fertilizer for the lemons and to carry out pruning and weeding chores.  He will also buy feed for his animals so that he can sell them for a better price and continue growing in this business.

Ernesto is quite a hard working person who strives daily to get ahead and to have a better quality of life.  People who know him consider him to be a kind person who is always willing to help others.


.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, carry out pruning chores and to buy feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 39 years old and married with 4 children, ages between 7 and 18.  He runs a local food store in Waterloo near Freetown.

Hassan has been in this business for 7 years and sells cassava root, groundnuts and Palm oil at his store. This business is the only source of income. He says that the main challenge to his business is price fluctuation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchas local food stuff items. Hassan says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve the standard of his living. In the future, he would like to expand his business more.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnuts and palm oil.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 41 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four grown dependents. Vilma has a fishing business to earn a living. She sells fish in the local community. She has been doing this for five years. She earns a total monthly average of PHP 6,200 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 at GDMPC to pay labor costs for fishing boat repair. Vilma has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Vilma hopes to purchase additional fishing boats and gain more profit.

loans.use: To pay labor costs to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, aged 43, is married to Mukavi. They are blessed with three children, aged between eight and fourteen years. She does farming and has been doing this for seven years.The business earns her a monthly income of KES70,000.

This is her second loan term with KADET LTD. She has repaid the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan funds to buy maize seeds, tomato seeds and to pay hired labor. Agnes intends to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and hopes to be a renowned farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and tomatoes seeds for planting.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married and has three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a school messenger with a decent salary. Ilham wants to start a grocery store to help her husband cover the family expenses, since the income of the family isn't enough. Therefore, she needs to take a loan of $2,000 to support the family.

When Ilham gets FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to open a grocery store and buy some necessary goods. This will enable Ilham to have her own project, which will add value to the family income and enhance their living conditions. Ilham is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To establish a grocery store

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old single young man. He lives in Rafah city in Gaza Strip located in Palestine. Ahmad has a photography studio and he wants to make some decorations and internal repairs in addition to purchasing new photography equipment such as cameras, picture developing machine, etc. However, Ahmad doesn't have enough money to pay, so he is in need of a loan from FATEN for $1,000.

When Ahmad takes the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay for making decorations to the studio and have new photography equipment. Ahmad will work hard to generate more money, especially because he owns the only photography studio in the area where he lives. Ahmad's ambition is to become known and expand his work. Ahmad is photographed in his photography studio.

loans.use: To redecorate and repair the interior and purchase photography equipment

loans.name: Youssouf

texts.fr: Monsieur Youssouf est âgé de 43 ans .Il habite au Sénégal.  Il exerce la profession de militaire dans l’armée de l’air depuis 22 ans.  C’est une occupation qu’il a choisi par amour pour servir son pays. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est la discipline et la rigueur qui sont respectées dans ce corps de métier. Youssouf est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour les dépenses  de voyage de ses enfants qui doivent partir en vacance dans son village natal. Ce financement lui permettra d’assurer un certain. épanouissement  pour sa famille.
