texts.en: Youssouf is 43 years old.  He lives in Senegal.  He has been working as a soldier in the air force for 22 years.  He chose this work out of love for serving his country.  His favorite thing about his job is the respect for discipline and hard work in the profession.  Youssouf has been a member of one of the UIMCEC credit and savings unions since February, 2011.  He is asking for a loan of 150,000 francs to cover traveling expenses for his children, who have to return to his native village for vacation.  This financing will enable him to ensure his family’s personal fulfillment.

loans.use: to cover traveling expenses for his children, who have to return to his native village for vacation

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señorita. Johana es socia del banco comunal Fe y Alegría, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de sus calles, su estructura arquitectónica que se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, la variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es amable y mantienen la cultura de sus ancestros.
P> 
La Señorita. Johana tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Nuestra socia estudia en una universidad de la ciudad la carrera de Psicología Educativa. Para ayudar a sus padres tiene un puesto en un mercado de la ciudad donde vende todo tipo de ropa, lleva 8 años en este negocio solo vende días de ferias.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para surtir su mercadería. 

Su meta es culminar su carrera y ser profesional.
texts.en:
Johana is a member of the communal bank "Fe y Alegría" (Faith and Joy).  She lives in the city of Cuenca.  This city is recognized for the beauty of its streets, its architectural structure which combines colonial and modern styles, the variety of gastronomic delights that captivate the palates of locals and visitors, and its kind, friendly people who maintain the culture of their ancestors.

Johana is 26 years of age and single.  She lives with her parents, who don't have their own home but are leasing.  
 
Our member is studying Educational Psychology in the city's university.  In order to help her parents, she has a job in the city's market where she sells all types of clothing.  She has been working in this business for 8 years, selling only during her school's breaks.  
 
A year ago, she joined the community bank.  She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing to stock her merchandise. 

Her goal is to complete her studies and become a professional.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Baby Lee

texts.en:
Baby Lee is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Baby Lee has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Baby Lee is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Baby Lee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mary Maraga

texts.en:
Mary is a 38 year old married woman.  She has 5 children in ages ranging from 6 to 18 years.  She describes herself as a visionary. 

She operates a retail store where she sells sugar, rice, flour, detergents and other general items.  She has been involved in this business for 5 years.  Her business is located in a shopping center.  Her biggest challenge is inflation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her inventory.  Her business goal is to grow the small store into a wholesale business within 5 years.  In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land and put up rental houses on it.

loans.use: sugar, flour, rice, detergents etc

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel used his first loan to stock up his shop by buying flour, sugar and rice, and the business has been a success and profitable.Beside the shop he also started selling timber for building.

This is Daniel's second loan, which he plans to expand business of selling timber by  buying  more timber for resale.

In the future, Daniel hopes to become among the top timber dealers in the area.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Mahuklo Group

texts.fr: MAHUKLO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Catherine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 51 ans. Catherine est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Abraham. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Catherine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Catherine  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Catherine vend depuis une dizaine d’année, des produits alimentaires (maïs, farine de manioc et boisson locale) par le système de distribution. Catherine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Catherine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKLO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: MAHUKLO is a group of three people, of which the members live in the same area in Benin. The representative of the group, Catherine (whose hand is raised in the photo) is fifty-one years old. Catherine is married to a mechanic named Abraham. The couple has two children, both in school and in their care. Catherine lives together with her children and husband. Together, the couple provides for the various needs of the household. Catherine did not attend school. To cope with her various expenses, for a dozen years Catherine has sold food products (corn, manioc flour, and local beverages) through a distribution system. Catherine stocks up in Benin. In pursuit of the satisfaction of her clients and with an eye to the increase of her working capital, Catherine is requesting her third loan from Alidé, together with the other members of the MAHUKLO group. This credit will be used by them to better respond to the demands of their customers and to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy bags of corn and manioc flour, and local beverages

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур женат имеет двоих детей. Он трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Более 18 лет Баходур занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. В основном он выращивают овощи. Баходур также занимается виноградоводством и скотоводством. Он хочет улучшить свое жилищное условия и с этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 1500 Сомони. Он хочет использовать займ для закрытия кровля своего дома и покупки стройматериалов и рейки.
texts.en: Bahodur is married with two children. He is a hard-working and good-natured man. For more than 18 years, Bahodur has grown crops, mainly vegetables. Bahodur is also engaged in grape growing and raising cattle. He wants to improve his housing conditions and is asking for a loan of 1500 Somoni ($325). He wants to use the loan to close the roof of his house and for the purchase of construction materials and lumber.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials and lumber

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is 52 years old and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three daughters. For the past five years, she has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells women's garments. 

To help expand her business, Hiep would like to take a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. She hopes that this will help her to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for her family. Hiep hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the welfare of her children and continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo de 26 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, convive con Aydé, su incondicional pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 2 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en el distrito de Palcamayo. Todas las mañanas despierta con el canto del gallo, pues sabe que el trabajo del campo requiere mucho sacrificio y dedicación. En sus terrenos  cultiva papas, ollucos y oca, productos sanos y saludables, gracias a la excelente tierra de su zona. Por esa razón sus ventas son instantáneas en el mercado mayorista de Tarma.
Actualmente tiene sembrado alrededor de 25 sacos de papas de las variedades de color y blancas, las que venderá por saco de 30 a 50 soles, de acuerdo a la variedad.
En el caso del olluco la cosecha estará lista para agosto del año que viene.
A la vez se dedica a la compra y venta de carne de carnero, la que vende a 10 soles el kilo, ganando como 50 soles por cada cabeza de ganado. “Me dedico a esto solo para salir de apuros, si tengo alguna deuda, mato uno de mis carneros, por que con la agricultura me va bien”, explica.
La agricultura es una pasión para Alfredo, por ello, sus metas están alrededor de esta actividad. Quiere extender sus sembríos y aumentar su producción, con el pasar de los años. Este sería su préstamo número 15 de MFP. Da su palabra de ser exacto y preciso en el pago de las cuotas. En cuanto a su banco comunal, menciona sentirse más que contento, por el trabajo solidario que se ejerce. Invertirá todo el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos de 120 soles cada uno.
texts.en:
Alfredo, age 26, is a hardworking gentleman. He is in a common-law relationship with Aydé, his unconditional partner. They have two children, ages 7 and 2. Alfredo and his family live in their own home in the District of Palcamayo. Every morning, he wakes up to the crow of the rooster. He knows that farm work requires great sacrifice and dedication. Alfredo grows healthy products on his land such as potatoes, ulluco, and oca. He has some of the best land in the area. For this reason, he is able to make instantaneous sales at the wholesale market in Tarma.

Alfredo currently planted approximately 25 sacks of potatoes of various colors (including white). He will sell each sack between 30 to 50 PEN, based on the variety. The ulluco crop will be harvested next August. At the same time, Alfredo buys and sells mutton for 10 PEN/kilo. He earns around 50 PEN for each head of sheep. Alfredo explains, “I only sell meat when necessary. If I have any debts, I will butcher a sheep whenever the farming does not do well.” Farming is a passion for Alfredo, so his goals are related to his activity. He wants to extend his plantings and increase his production with each passing year.

This will be his 15th loan with MFP. Alfredo gives his word that he will be exact and precise with his loan payments. Regarding his Communal Bank, he says that he is very pleased with the work they do together. Alfredo says that he will invest all of the money in the purchase of sacks of compost that cost 120 PEN/each.

loans.use: to buy sacks of compost.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 19-year-old man, a freshman in one of the private colleges in Jordan. Amer is now majoring in hotel management. His course of study will take him two years to finish and graduate.

Amer has applied for a loan in order to pay his semester fees so he can start his studies and continue till graduation. He will be taking supportive courses that will help him achieve the best in the hotel management field.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Dolores; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de servcios de llamadas telefonicas,ella trabaja en forma ambulatoria,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia tambien vende productos naturales,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los servicios de llamadas y productos naturales . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar celulares y tambien para comprar productos naturales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is Señora Dolores. She is 47 years old, she lives with her partner and she has 4 children. The member is still working in her telephone call service business. She works as street vendor. The member works from 7:00 until 8:00 pm. She also sells natural products. Through these businesses the member is getting her children ahead in life. Her dream is to have a premises where she can sell her call services and natural products. The member is requesting the loan to buy cellular phones and also to buy natural products.

She is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones and also to buy natural products.

loans.name: Kheyrulla

texts.en:
Kheyrulla lives in the Sabirabad district of Azerbaijan. He is 51 years old, married, and has two daughters and a son. 

Kheyrulla has been involved in animal husbandry and meat sales for the last 10 years. He primarily breeds livestock at home. He is requesting this loan, in the amount of 1,000 AZN, for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: for the purchase of livestock

loans.name: Stuart

texts.en: Stuart is 41 years old, married, and a father of 4 children. For ten years he has been working as a civil servant. He faces a challenge of price fluctuation and yet the salary he earns does not increase with the current hyper inflation. He wishes to invest in self-education and he is requesting a loan to start working towards his dream of self education. Stuart needs the loan facility to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a single lady of 56 years. She has three children. Lilian operates a retail shop in Nagarariga in the outskirts of Limuru. She has been in business for thirteen years and gets a monthly income of 17,300 shillings.

This is Lillian’s fourth loan with KADET LTD; she plans to use the entire amount to buy cereals like rice, beans, maize etc for her business. In the future she would like to expand her business to become a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy cereals like rice, beans, peas etc

loans.name: Corazon De Florida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ILUMINADAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Modesta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa de lana, venta de comida, producción de fiambres, venta de CD’s, venta de fruta, artesanías, repostera, venta de chuño (papa deshidratada) y papa, tejido.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de chuño y papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al ayudar a su madre en su negocio, posterior a tener su independencia decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y chuño) que adquirirá en las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Iluminadas” (The Visionaries) will start its first lending cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal German Busch.  It is made up of eight members and overseen by a board of directors, of which Señora Modesta is the president.  The members' businesses are varied and include: wool clothing sales, selling food, making cold cuts, selling  CD’s, fruit sales, pastry-making, selling "chuño" (dehydrated potatoes) and potatoes and weaving. 

The loan the communal bank is taking out will benefit small, micro-entrepreneurs, of which Señora María is one.  She says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined at the invitation of a friend, who is a member of the institution.  Currently, Señora María has a business selling "chuño" and potatoes.  She says that she learned the business a few years back while helping her mother with her business.  After she became independent, Señora María decided to start her own business. 
 
The loan that Señora María is taking out is for increasing her capital (for the purchase of potatoes and "chuño") which she will acquire from the wholesale sellers in El Alto and re-sell from her sales post.  This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Señora María says that she likes the savings plan offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and "chuño" (dehydrated potatoes).

loans.name: Ife Ni Ibidoun Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE NI IBIDOUN est composé de trois personnes qui vendent dans un même marché. La représentante du groupe, du nom de H. Adèle Rachidath M.(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 29 ans est mariée à un revendeur nommé Inoussa. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge.  H. Adèle Rachidath M. vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. H. Adèle Rachidath M. a très peu fréquenté  l’école. Afin de participer aux divers besoins de sa famille, H. Adèle Rachidath M. vend des habits pour enfants depuis sept ans environ. H. Adèle Rachidath M. s’approvisionne à Lomé au TOGO. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, H. Adèle Rachidath M. sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFE NI IBIDOUN un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédemment reçu a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des habits pour enfant.

loans.name: Atome

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the seven members of the Jittoo Association, represented by their leader Atome L.. The Jittoo group describes their business as follows:

“This traditional cloth-dying and batik business is located in Oussouye, a town that is modernizing and developing rapidly. The population is around 10,000 inhabitants. Oussouye is 30 km from Cap Skirring, a traditional town that acts as a hub, attracting tourists in the Casamance region with its three bed-and-breakfasts. This has convinced us present to you this proposal for a loan to finance the business activities in which we have been engaged for several years.

The purpose of the loan is:

• To reduce the problem of migration of young women from rural areas to the big cities in search of employment

• To create employment for women

• To help improve nutrition and secure self-sufficiency in food

Our business activities are:

• The production of traditional hand-dyed cloth and batiks

These activities will be conducted here in Oussouye. The products will be sold both in Oussouye and in the numerous tourist hotels and campgrounds of the area.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet. : Ce projet de teinture et de battique est localisé à Oussouye commune, une ville qui se modernise et se développe rapidement. La population est d’environ 10 000 habitants. Oussouye est à 30Km de Cap Skirring site touristique de la Casamance et ville carrefour et traditionnelle ou passent beaucoup de touristes avec trois campements .Ceci nous pousses à vous présenter ce projet pour avoir un financement pour nos activités que nous exerçons depuis plusieurs années.

Objectifs du Prêt : L’objectif du projet est :

- Réduire le problème de l’exode rural des jeunes femmes vers les grandes villes à la recherche de l’emploi

- De créer de l’emplois pour les femmes

- D’aider à améliorer l’alimentation et à assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire

Activités : Les activités du projet sont :

• -La teinture et le battique

Elles se feront à Oussouye même. Les produits sont vendus à Oussouye et dans les nombreux campements touristiques du département. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of various types of fabric and dye colors; dying equipment such as wax, masks, gloves, tongs, and string; transportation of finished hand-dyed cloth and batiks to market

loans.name: Sakhlo

texts.en: Shakhlo is one of our first clients in the south of Tajikistan.  Shakhlo lives with her parents. She has one sister and two brothers. She helps her parents financially working in the market. She has been working at the market for over three years.  She likes the interaction with people. Her goal is  to purchase her own flat and to  prepare for her future family. She would like to expand her activity and to involve in her business her boyfriend who left for Russia to work ata construction site. They would like to get married this summer and need to arrange several issues regarding the wedding and their own house. Shaakhlo will use her loan to increase the assortment of goods that she sells. She would like to sell women’s underwear as well.

loans.use: Add new line of goods

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is married and the mother of 8 children. Her husband is a retired civil servant and receives a small pension benefit. Fatu's income from her firewood selling business helps with family exepnses. The firewood she sells is used by families in her village for cooking. With little working capital, Fatu can only buy a minimal amount of firewood stock at a time. With a loan from SMT, she will be able to increase her stock and save on transport costs, thus increasing her overall profit.

loans.use: Increase quanity of stock of fire wood

loans.name: Miguel Darío

texts.es:
Miguel Darío V. is 26 years old and he is married. His wife is named Sonia and she works at a well-known shoe store in the city. Miguel sells electronics products and videos. He has been selling electronics such as radios, DVDs, digital watches, calculators, and CD cases and wallets for 7 years. He has his stand on one of the most commercial streets of the city, and his sales are good, thanks to the good location of the business. He also sells to street vendors, who buy merchandise from him which they then sell. He works twelve hours per day without rest and has managed to consolidate and achieve economic stability. The product which he sells the most of, and from which he earns the most, is DVDs.

He has previously requested loans and he paid them back punctually and is an excellent client of the Foundation. He is now requesting a loan to increase his stock of merchandise, since in recent months he has experienced an increase in sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Miguel Darío V. tiene 26 años y es casado. Su señora se llama Sonia ella trabaja en una conocida zapatería de la ciudad. El se dedica a la venta de productos electrónicos y de videos. Hace ya 7 años que se dedica a la venta de productos electrónicos, como radios, dvd´s, relojes digitales, calculadoras, además de estuches porta cd´s, billeteras, etc. El monto su stand de ventas en una de las calles más comerciales de la ciudad. Posee muy buenas ventas, gracias a la buena ubicación del negocio, además el es proveedor para los vendedores ambulantes que compran de él las mercaderías para vender. Así es como trabaja doce horas al día sin descanso y ha logrado consolidarse y mantenerse económicamente estable. El producto de mayor venta y que más ganancia le otorga son los dvd´s. El ya ha solicitado anteriormente otros créditos que los ha pagado puntualmente, siendo así un cliente excelente de la Fundación; hoy día está solicitando otro crédito para aumentar su stock de mercaderías, pues en los últimos meses a experimentado un alza en sus ventas.

loans.use: T buy merchandise such as: radios, digital watches, and calculators

loans.name: Lucy Sesega

texts.en: Lucy is a mother of two children and she is proud of her business of elei printing (a traditional Samoan way of printing fabrics).  She is also grateful for her business as it helps the family. Both of her two children are attending school, and that’s why she works so hard to help her husband improve their family's finances.  Lucy owns a permanent block at the Flea Market in town, where she sells her products from Monday to Saturday.  She has no doubts about what she’s doing, because the sales she makes in one week are outstanding.  She’s hoping to use her next loan to buy more materials, so that she can produce more clothing.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria’s family consists of four children, three of whom are now on their own. One daughter, a student, remains in her care and helps her with her business on a daily basis. Her husband sells grain/cereals and, together, they help bring in income to pay for living expenses. Some time ago, Maria started out selling in the market, but due to relocation issues she had to find a location of her own to continue her business and helping to support her family. She asked the director of a medical center if she could market her goods outside on the sidewalk, which turned out very positively as it is a high-traffic area. Given the success of her business, she needs to make some purchases to help her meet her customer demand. She is asking for a loan that she will repay in six months. She hopes for your generous support toward the continued well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El hogar de María está compuesto por cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres viven fuera con sus respectivas familias y obligaciones, quedando sólo una hija bajo su protección que está en el colegio y apoya diariamente en la atención del negocio; vive con su esposo que se dedica a comprar y a rematar granos viajando por la carretera y por los ríos de su bella ciudad de esta manera ambos contribuyen satisfactoriamente con los gastos del hogar.Maria empezó vendiendo en el mercado del jirón Bellavista hace mucho tiempo, desde joven a raíz de los problemas de reubicación es que tuvo que ver la forma de poder continuar con su labor para solventar los gastos de su querida familia, como fue impronta la reubicación y no contaba con un local propio, se le ocurrió solicitar al director de la Posta Médica si podría ocupar la vereda para trabajar, cosa que le resultó positivo dándole más expectativas al crecimiento de su negocio por ser una zona muy transitada.Debido ahora al gran giro que dió su negocio al aumentar sus ventas, se encuentra en la necesidad de cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, solicitando un préstamo que será devuelto en un lapso de seis meses.María espera contar con el apoyo generoso de vuestra parte, para poder asegurar el desarrollo y bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase utensils/cookware, provisions for food preparation enterprise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products, especially those for the holidays.

loans.name: Yayat

texts.en: Yayat, 40-years-old, is the mother of 3 children. To earn extra income for the family she sells beverages at her house and also sells veils at her religious community, earning US$21 a month. Her husband, R., sells crispy snacks door-to-door and only gets a small income. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$125 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expand her beverages business

loans.name: Omina

texts.en:
Omina N. is 36 years old, and is the loving mother of 4 children. Omina's husband is currently working in Russia.

Omina sells dried fruit, such as apricots in the local market. At the same time she also breeds cattle. She has two cows, one of which is a dairy cow. Omina works hard, as she wants her children to have what they need, and dreams of providing all of her kids with a higher education.

Omina is planning to purchase more dried fruit in order to enlarge the range of goods for sale. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan of 300.00 US Dollars for a term of 4 months. This is the first loan for Omina and she would like to assure everyone supporting her that she will do her best to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase dried fruit for selling

loans.name: Ygnolly

texts.es:
Mrs. Ygnolly is 34 years old, she belongs to the Community Bank ”Los Entusiastas” (The Enthusiastic Ones) in the district of Campo Verde. She works selling ice and has a son who is the love of her life. She has a dream to become an important distributor of ice in her area. To be able to achieve this goal, she needs to purchase a freezer and increase the capital that her business has. With your support you will help this mom fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ygnolly de 34 años de edad, pertenece al banco comunal “Los Entusiastas” en el Distrito de Campo Verde, ella se dedica a la venta de hielo y tiene un hijo que se ha convertido en la luz de su camino.Tiene el deseo de convertirse en una importante distribuidora de hielo de su localidad y para este fin necesita adquirir una congelado e incrementar su capital de trabajo.Tu importante aporte hará realidad los sueños de esta noble mujer.

loans.use: Buy a freezer and increase capital for her business.

loans.name: Nhiv

texts.en: Mrs. Nhiv P., a 34-year-old widow, makes about $4 per day as a teacher at the Tapong Secondary School in Battambang Province. She supplements her income by selling groceries. P. lives with her three children, all of whom are students, in the Kork Kduoch Village, Battambang Province. P. seeks a $300 loan to expand her business. With this loan, she hopes to generate more income and improve her family’s financial stability.

loans.use: To enlarge her grocery-selling business

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Mrs. Irene wishes very much to continue to work and is very young at heart. She takes care of her grocery store daily and through her daily efforts can achieve her own support and also has the satisfaction of providing the support for her five children. Her wish to improve her store and this way be able to increase her income is what is motivating her to seek this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Irene, tiene muchos deseos de continuar trabajando y lleva la juventud dentro de su corazón. Ella atiende diariamente su bodega y con su labor diaria puede conseguir su auto sustento, ya que tiene la satisfacción de ser el sustento de sus 5 hijos. Su deseo de mejorar su tienda para así poder incrementar sus ganancias la conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of products.

loans.name: Zenaida María

texts.es:
Mrs. Zenaida María B. P. is from the city of Bluefields, Nicaragua. She is 32 years old and married to Mr. Claudio José Aguilar, who works as a security guard at an ophthalmologist’s clinic, where he earns minimum wage, but it doesn’t cover all the basic expenses. They have four children together, all of whom attend secondary school. Mrs. B. has sold used clothing for 3 years and has many passer-by customers who prefer to buy from her because of her clothing variety (children’s clothing, sheets, men’s clothing, and women’s clothing for all ages). With the income from her business, she pays for her children’s schooling. Mrs. B. has a great demand for bedding (sheets) and at the moment she doesn’t have enough capital to purchase more bales of sheets. For this reason she would like to buy one bale of sheets at $300 per bale, and with this investment she will increase her earnings and be able to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Zenaida María B. P. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Claudio José Aguilar quien trabaja como guardia de seguridad de una clínica oftalmológica el cual devenga un salario mínimo que no cubre todos los pagos de los gastos básicos, ambos tienen 4 hijos menores de edad que cursan estudios secundarios. La Sra. B. vende ropa usada hace 3 años teniendo como clientes a los transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de ropas (ropa para niños, sabanas, ropa para hombres y mujeres de todas las edades) con el ingreso de su negocio paga los estudios de sus hijos. La Sra. B. tiene mas demanda de ropa de cama (sabanas) y por el momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar mas pacas de sabanas y por esta razón quiere comprar 1 paca de sabanas a $ 300.00 dólares la paca, con esta inversión aumentara sus ganancias y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase a bale of sheets

loans.name: Taualagi

texts.en: Taualagi T., 50 years of age, is married with 7 children. She has 2 years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Taualagi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to fund businees improvement. Her husband does the farming.

loans.use: To get what is needed for her taro plantation.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 32 years. She is a married woman with one four year old child. Anna is a meat seller. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

Anna now hopes for a loan to buy more meat for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more meat for her business to increase sales.

loans.name: Guillermo Nicanor

texts.es:
Guillermo, 56, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua. He's married and has a daughter, 15, who is in high school. His wife works at home. Guillermo makes a living selling wood and also has a cart and a cart horse. His wife often helps him with the wood-selling business when he's at work hauling loads in his cart. The loan application is for buying materials to install a toilet because Guillermo and his family only have a latrine now. The addition will be more sanitary and greatly add to the family's comfort. Guillermo hopes to always have work so that he can help his daughter continue her studies and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Guillermo tiene 56 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casado y le tienen una hija de 15 años de edad, que esta estudiando en la secundaria, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Guillermo se dedica a la venta de leña y también tiene un carretón con caballo de acarreo su esposa siempre lo ha apoyado con las venta de leña cuando él está trabajando en el negocio del acarreo. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para instalar y comprar un inodoro ya que no tiene solo letrina y así mismo poner las aguas negras. Para darle a su familia más comodidad y más higiene. Desea tener siempre trabajo para poder ayudar a su hija que se prepare con los estudios para que tenga un nivel de vida mejor.

loans.use: Add a toilet and waste water system.

loans.name: Aniva

texts.en: Aniva T., 44, is divorced with 7 children. She has many years of experience in the taro plantation business as well as making and selling ice cakes. She sells to the general public and villagers 5 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 480 Tala (~200 USD). SPBD loans are Aniva's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Aniva's business is the main source of income in their family. She divorced from her husband 3 years ago and is supporting her children alone with help from her relatives sometimes.

loans.use: Purchase purchase chemicals, taro tops, foam cups, weed killer

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti has owned a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her sales and profit.  

Siti is 45 years old, married, and has seven children: ages 7, 10, 15, 20, 21, 23, and 27.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is a wife of M. B. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 11 years. Zubaida baji’s husband is a milk man with 21 years of experience. Zubaida baji is a mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Zubaida baji has been collecting animal waste to generate fire for cooking because gas is not available. She successfully repaid her three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s milk business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for the milk business.

loans.name: 35 Tân Sơn-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 35 consists of seven poor women, all of whom live in Tan Son Commune, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Lam is the lead borrower of the group. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children: an 8 year old son and a 4 year old daughter. This is her first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women and she will use the proceeds to buy shoes that she will then sell in the market.

Mrs. Lam will use the profits from her loan to pay her son's school fees, to buy chickens, and to provide for her family.
The loan will be split equally between all seven borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows:

* Mrs. Ly is borrowing 1,626,900 Vietnamese Dong (~ US$100) to buy 10 hats and 5 handbags to sell in the market.
* Mrs. Thuy will use her share of the loan to buy 15 pairs of shoes to sell in the market.
* Mrs. Loan will buy and raise two pigs. After 3 months she will sell the pigs and buy another two pigs.
* Mrs. Hong will invest in photographic film and paper that she will resell.
* Mrs. Yen will use her share of the loan to buy vegetables for resale.
* Mrs. Nguyen is borrowing to buy clothes that she will sell in the market.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, pigs, shoes, hats, clothes, handbags.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio C. Z. necesita un préstamo para pagar la luz llego el recibo con una cantidad muy alta a la que normal paga y con esta crisis de Enero no completa para pagar su servicio de Luz ya que para el es muy dispensable. Con lo poco que le sobre utilizara para arregla un cerca que tiene en su casa. 
El trabaja como tablajero en una carnicería muy conocida en la ciudad y con estos ingresos pagara la cantidad prestada.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio C. Z. needs a loan to pay his electricity. The electrical bill was much higher than usual and because of the crisis of January he was unable to pay the electricity, which he is able to do without. For what little electricity he will need, he will make arrangements with a neighbour. He works as a cashier in a well-known butcher shop in town and he will repay the loan from his income.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the electrical bill

loans.name: Azdar

texts.en: Azdar K. is 45-year-old tailor who lives with his wife and three children in the small village of Imishli city. He started his business in 2003 and since that time he gained a number of clientele who trust his experience. Azdar sews different clothes such as shirts, trousers, but the highest demand is for coats. Azdar`s business is the only financial source in his family, and he tries his best to accomplish his main goal, to provide an excellent education for his children who are in school now. Azdar starts his day at 7 in the morning and works till 9 p.m. Now Azdar thinks it is time to improve his working conditions, and for this purpose he applied for $1200 to purchase a modern sewing machine. Azdar and his family count on you for your help.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica P. is forty years old. She is married and the mother of two; currently, both her children have completed senior high school. She lives with her husband and the children in two-room apartment in Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana.

Monica has been selling coconut oil for nine years now. Coconut oil is produced from coconut fruits; she produces it and supplies it to food vendors to prepare their meals and she even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods elsewhere when demand becomes very high.

Monica wants to use the loan to buy more bags of coconuts and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency so as to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to help her husband provide food for her family and finance her children's education. Monica belongs to a village bank called ‘Joy’. She hopes to receive GHS 600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more bags of coconuts and an electric milling machine

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Pablo D. y su esposa la señora María Esther Ortiz tiene dos pequeños hijo a los cuales quieren lo mejor para ellos. En esté momento están pagando renta donde viven  y desean ya tener su propio patrimonio y darles un lugar más estable a sus niños. Don Juan Pablo se dedica a la reparación de autos, este es el ingreso de su familia. 
Están solicitando este préstamo para pagar la diferencia de una casa por medio de un crédito gubernamental, así tener su propia casa y dejar de pagar la renta.
En la foto aparece su esposa la señora María Esther y uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Pablo D. and his wife, María Esther Ortiz, have two small children for whom they wish to provide the best. Currently, they are paying where they live and wish to own their own home so they may provide their children a more stable place to live. Don Juan Pablo repairs automobiles for a living, which is his family’s source of income. They are requesting a loan so they can pay the balance on a house through a government loan program. This way they will own their own home and won’t have to pay rent anymore. This is a photo of Mrs. Maria Esther and one of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Balance on a down payment for a home

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity O. is 28 years old, married and the mother of four children. Through the help of government free compulsory education, it has been possible for her to send all her kids to school. She lives at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. Charity trades in peas, pineapple and tiger nuts and sells through hawking. It is believed that tiger nuts can help those with sexual weakness. She travels to the surrounding communities to buy her stock of goods. Demand for her goods is on the higher side; for that reason she is requesting a loan to buy more peas, pineapple and tiger nuts. Charity wants to save more money for her children's education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘He lives’.

loans.use: To buy peas, tiger nuts, pineapple and others.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina said, “Success is something to be work for; not to be waited for.” She took this as her inspiration in carrying out her plans and ambitions in life. She aims to become successful so she can provide the best education for her children. She is married to Alex and they live in Manamtam Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya.

Like most of the other residents, farming is their main source of livelihood. They plant rice and vegetables as their major crops which is very appropriate for the weather in Nueva Vizcaya. With their patience and sacrifices, they have been able to gain an average net income of 15,000 Philippine Pesos per harvest. They use it for their household’s needs and for the education of their two children. They want to increase their profit by maintaining their farming business. For this, Marina is requesting for a loan of 15,000 pesos from the Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to purchase farm supplies they need.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 35 and has been operating a grocery shop for the past six years. She is married with five children who are currently in school.

Millicent’s experience in trading has made her one of the most successful traders. She sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc.

She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

Millicent belongs to the community group called “Blessing Trust Group”. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and supply peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
"Before, I was just a plain housewife who stayed at the house and earned no income. Because of that, I started my seaweed farm. My husband and I have been engaged in this seaweed business in order to be able to satisfy the needs of our three children," says Teresita A., thirty-seven-year-old entrepreneur from Bien Unido, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan of Php 18,000 from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will use the loan to buy seedlings for her seaweed farm. In doing so, she believes that she will be able to improve her farm and earn better income for her family.

CEVI helps seaweed growers in Bien Unido to better maintain their standard of living. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for her seaweed farm

loans.name: Abdul Samy

texts.en:
This is A. Samy the son of A. W.. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 51, married, and the father of five children.

A. Samy is a vegetable-seller and has a shop in which he is busy working seven days of the week. He dreams to have a progressive business and to be successful. He has full familiarity with this business because, from childhood, he worked with his father.

A. Samy has requested a loan of 30,000 Afghani to buy vegetables which are in demand a lot in the market. 
He is glad that, through this process, he can improve his business.

loans.use: To purchasing more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Wafic

texts.en:
Wafik is a 37-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Wafik has been working as a carpenter since 2004. Wafik has requested a loan of $1,000 from A. Majmoua in order to buy a car. This is his fourth cycle and he always paid on time. He works upon request which is better than preparing and waiting to sell.

Wafik is speciA. in his work because of his reputation and the fact that he knows what to do. His clients are his friends and neighbors. The tenuous situation of his country was the only obstacle he faced, but his business itself is successful. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy a car for business use

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce depuis 2004 le commerce de charbons de bois, elle y a associé le commerce de tubercules. Elle est en rupture de stock de charbons de bois, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois et 15 tas de tubercules. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays ce qui lui permet de réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes.
Etant célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Since 2004, this woman has been selling charcoal, and also yams. She's out of stock of charcoal, and want to resupply. She's therefore seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 20 sacks of charcoal and 15 piles of yams. She gets her supplies in the interior of the country, which enables her to increase her profit margin. Being unmarried, it is with the income of her business that she provides for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of charcoal and 15 piles of yams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of ingredients as well as to renovate the facilities.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Jesús es viuda, tiene 69 años y 6 hijos, Jesús tiene un puesto en el mercado Santa Elena en donD. venD. ropa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Jesús venD. leña en el mismo lugar.
Jesús necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. chompas, ropas interiores.
Los sueños D. Jesús son construir su casa.
texts.en:
Jesús is a member of the Despertar Community Bank. Jesús, 69, is a widow with six children. Jesús has a stall in the Santa Elena market. She sells various clothing items there; she does this every day. Also, Jesús sells wood in the same place. Jesús needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy sweaters and underwear. Jesús’ dream is to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweaters and underwear

loans.name: Medad's Group

texts.en:
(The person in the small photo is M. Medad and he was interviewed, and in the photo, Charles N. was missing at the time of photo taking)

M. Medad is the leader of this lending group in Mubende. He is 28 years-old and married with four children aged between two and twelve years. He is a business man involved in the sale of alcohol from his bar as well as his home. Before opening the bar three years ago through the help of a loan, Medad made and sold alcohol from his home. His bar is located in Kazinga and generates approximately 80,000/= profits a week enabling him to look after his family and pay the children’s school fees. He has a dream of increasing his capital base by accumulating sufficient savings to enable him to have a decent life. Medad is asking for a loan to purchase a greater variety of alcohol for resale.

loans.use: To buy alcohol

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 01 en camino, vive en el Barrio Apillani, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 2 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar aves de corral, para comercializarlos en el mercado de Yunguyo.

Su mayor deseo es poder tener una granja de aves de corral.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Alto Alianza Communal Bank in the Yunguyo district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 21, in a common law marriage, and has a baby on the way. She lives in the Apillani neighborhood. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost two years. Her initial loan was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling sheep. She currently needs a new loan for 1,000 PEN, which will allow her to buy poultry to sell at the Yunguyo market. Her biggest wish is to be able to have a poultry farm. She likes the meetings and the punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila B. is from the town of Sepac in Sapangdalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Mila is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mila plants, harvests, and sells coconut. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Mila is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used grow more coconuts. This will be Mila's 11th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to start a business buying and sell junk items. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more coconut trees to plant

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Mr. Prak V., age 34, makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community. He currently earns an average of $4 a day and has been running his service for more than four years.

Prak V. is the father of two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend school. His wife, Ot Sovany, sells snack cakes at the market. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious meals. He and his wife appear in the photo.

Prak V. requested a loan in order to purchase a machine which will enable him to make fish paste during this coming fish paste season.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for making fish paste

loans.name: Azimkul

texts.en:
G. Azimkul is 42 years old. He is married and is the loving father of two children. Azimkul is a farmer. He is strong both physically and spiritually and plows the land to the best of his abilities. Thanks to his energy and high spirit, he has been able to support his family for six years and to offer them an education as well.

Azimkul sows wheat. Each year he grows sufficient crops for the consumption of his family and for selling. Now his business is stable, Azimkul believes that in future it will be the main income for him and his large family as his dearest children are growing up and accordingly, the expenses are rising too.

Today, Azimkul requests 4,000 Somoni in order to purchase seed and mineral fertilizer. He thanks everyone who trusted him and is supporting him today. He promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

Be an important part of the growth of Azimkul’s business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Christian Maykoll

texts.es:
El señor Christian tiene 29 años de edad él como primera actividad es técnico en veterinaria en la zona en la que vive. Ayuda y trabaja en la zona al mismo tiempo se dedica a la producción de leche.

El está acostumbrado al trabajo en el campo porque siempre desde niño ayudaba a su madre porque el padre los abandono cuando él era pequeño y  vive con ella y siempre está pendiente de su madre, Christian tiene un niño de tres años de edad el no está casado pero el niño vive con él y con su abuela que es la que lo cuida porque su madre trabaja como profesora en la ciudad y no puede hacerse cargo de él.

Con el crédito que solicita el comprara una vaca y construirá un establo para alojar ganado porque se viene la época de lluvia y el quiere darles mejor comodidad a sus vacas para que la producción de leche sea mejor. El es muy responsable a la actividad que se dedica la cual le gusta mucho.
En un futuro Christian quiere terminar la carrera de veterinario y de esa forma darle una mejor vida a su hijo y a su madre.
texts.en:
Mr. Christian is 29 years old. He works as a veterinary technologist in the area where he lives. At the same time he works in a dairy. He is used to working in the countryside because, since he was a child, he has helped his mother. His father abandoned his family when he was little. He lives with his mother and he has always lived with her. Christian has a three-year-old child. He is not married and his child lives with him and his mother. His mother takes care of the child because the child’s mother works as a teacher in the city and cannot care for the child. With the loan he is asking for, he will buy a cow and build a barn to house cattle. The rainy season is arriving. He would like his animals to be comfortable because when they are comfortable they produce more milk. He is a very responsible businessman and he enjoys his work. In the future, Christian would like to finish his veterinary studies and create a better life for his son and his mother.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow and construct a barn to house his cattle.

loans.name: Mawaydom

texts.fr: Cet homme n’est pas marié et a appris un métier d’un genre particulier : la menuiserie d’aluminium. Cette activité lui a permis d’être connu de nombreuses personnes, il fabrique des tables et des meubles avec de l'aluminium et des vitres qu'il expose devant son atelier. Il dispose des apprentis en grand nombre ; la plupart de ses clients apprécient la qualité de ses services ; en cette période de fin d’année, il reçoit beaucoup de commandes. Il a besoin de renouveler son stock de verres en aluminium ; raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter  des matériels de menuiserie en aluminium et des vitres. Il n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This man is unmarried and is trained in a specific profession: aluminium carpentry. This business has allowed him to be known by many people. He has a large number of apprentices, and the majority of his clients appreciate the quality of his services; during the current end-of-the-year period, he has received many orders. He needs to renew his stock of glass and aluminium, which is why he is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy aluminium carpentry materials. He has no children in his care.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy modern carpentry supplies

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Reyna es casada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Reyna tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días, además junto a su esposo tienen una imprenta en un local alquilado.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azúcar, arroz.
Los sueños de Reyna son tener una imprenta mas grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) community bank. She is married, is 32 years old, and has 3 children. Reyna has a store in her home where she sells general groceries, an activity that she carries out every day. In addition, she and her husband have a printing shop in a rented space.

Reyna needs a loan of 2000 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of milk, sugar, and rice.

Reyna's dreams are to have a bigger printing shop and for her children to have careers.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is married and the mother of three children who are all currently in school. She is 57 years old and lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. She works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor. Hannah prepares and sells rice with stew. She sells the food on a tabletop by the roadside in her community. She buys her raw materials from nearby towns. Hannah has been in business for over 30 years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mulikat

texts.en: Mulikat sells natural medicines to make a living in her community. Natural medicines are essential in Nigeria and the demand for them is high. She makes the natural medicines by herself, using herbs and roots. She hopes to own a natural medicine clinic in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more herbs to make more natural medicines to sell. She has been in this business for a considerable number of years. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more herbs to make more natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 32-year-old divorced man who lives in the Bekaa with his two children. Ali has been working as a van driver for over 10 years. Working as a van driver is his day job; Ali is also a DJ. He plays in the evening at different parties. His second job is more a hobby that he does for different occasions like anniversaries, weddings, diner parties, and more. Ali requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van that he uses for his daytime transportation. The van also allows him to transport his DJ equipment when he has an occasion. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time. Ali is speciA. in his work because of his punctuality as a driver and his good taste in music. His clients can be anyone. He decided to do both his businesses because he wanted to have independent work and improve his family’s income. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work and to purchase more sophisticated tools for his DJ business.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his van .

loans.name: Irma Guadalupe

texts.es: Irma Guadalupe R. D. B. D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 11 y 9 años D. edad. Irma posee una venta D.  productos alimenticios y D. primera necesidad para el hogar, tales como: pan, huevos, leche, granos básicos y otros más. El negocio cuenta con muy buena ubicación, debido a que se encuentra frente al punto D. microbuses que llevan D. San Salvador a San Martín, esto le beneficia en gran manera, ya que le permite contar con muchos clientes fijos, ya que es un lugar el cual siempre esta lleno D. muchas personas. Irma solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar sus productos, D. manera que pueda ofrecer más a sus clientes. Este negocio es D. mucha importantita para ella ya que es la única fuente D. ingresos con la que cuenta para sostener a sus dos pequeñas hijas.
texts.en:
Irma Guadalupe R. D. B., 38, lives in the town of Ilopango, in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her two children, 9 and 11 years of age. Irma has shop selling food and basic necessities for the home, such as bread, eggs, grains, and more. The business is in a good location, across from the bus stop for the microbuses that carry people from San Salvador to San Martin. This location has helped Irma establish a regular clientele, as this place is always full of people. Irma is seeking a loan to increase her product line, to offer more to her customers. This business is very important to her, as it is the only source of income she has to raise her two small children.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy inventory for store

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: Jane T. is from the village of San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 55 years old and is the group leader of a twelve-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Jane is married and has three adult-aged children. She owns and operates a business providing tailoring services to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. Jane plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida L., 59, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Salvador L., a retiree, and they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own fish stall for quite some time.

Zenaida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her fish business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 14,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used to buy more quantities and species of fish to increase her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can branch out and try new businesses. She also envisions a car for her and her family.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities and species of fish to increase her current product inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es: Constantina tiene 37 años de edad, comparte su vida con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos en su haber. Vive en la hermosa selva cusqueña, en la comunidad de Palestina Alta, donde tienen su casa propia. Constantina manifiesta que ha tenido una vida difícil, comenzó a ayudar a sus padres desde su adolescencia como agricultora. Por las mañanas iba a su colegio, y por las tardes se dedica a la siembra, esa era su rutina diaria. Su madre estaba delicada de salud y su padre comercializaba sus productos de cacao, pero dentro de sus posibilidades le dieron a Constantina las comodidades básicas que necesitaba. Es por ello que Constantina se esforzó duro y parejo para sacar adelante la producción de cacao que sus padres le dejaron, ahora junto a su esposo labraron la tierra, para darle mayor impulso a su producción y con el tiempo rindió sus primeros frutos y de buena calidad. Posteriormente su producto es vendido en los centros de acopio,  dándole buenos resultados económicos; no contentos con ello decidieron instalar una pequeña bodega con la finalidad de ampliar su economía, por lo que ya van tres años de muchas satisfacciones personales y emocionales. Es así que anhela ampliar su bodega, con el propósito de introducir nuevos productos para ofrecer. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente en sus pagos respectivos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en comprar una cantidad determinada de mercadería, para así abastecer a su bodega, con el propósito de captar más clientes.
texts.en:
Constantina, 37, shares her life with her partner and their 4 children. She lives in the beautiful Cusco backcountry in the Palestina Alta community where they own their own home. Constantina relates that her life has been difficult; as an adolescent she helped her parents with their farming chores. In the morning she would attend school and in the afternoons she cared for the crops; this was her daily routine. Her mother was in poor health and her father was a cocoa bean merchant and they were able to provide Constantina with what comforts were within their meager means. Because of this, Constantina has worked hard and fast to succeed with the cocoa bean production her parents left her. Now, together with her husband, she works the land to produce higher yields and, in time, has had the first high quality fruits of her labor. Once harvested, the product is sold to area consolidating centers yielding good profits. Not satisfied with this, however, they decided to establish a small store with the goal in mind to improve their finances. They have gotten much emotional and personal satisfaction from this for three years now. Constantina would like to expand her store by introducing more merchandise into her inventory. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she assures us that she will repay in a timely fashion. She will use the funds to buy certain quantities of merchandise to stock her store in order to acquire more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grocery items

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: Byambasuren B. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son attends a local middle school and her daughter goes to kindergarten. Byambasuren operates a retail business in her town. The family began the business in 2009 and since then they have been gaining experience. Her husband is a singer in the local culture center. She purchases food in bulk, such as candy, chewing gum, and soft drinks to sell by the piece. Byambasuren is a hardworking and optimistic person who has a plan to build her own house. She is requesting a 200,000-MNT loan to purchase a large amount of food and goodies.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda L. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Imelda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El Señor Feliciano E. P. tiene 48 años y está casada con la Señora Salome Choque de E. por más de 20 años, tienen 3 hijos dependientes que estudian en primaria. Don Feliciano E. P. y su familia viven en una comunidad llamada Pico Central a 68 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero. 

La actividad principal es la agricultura, ellos producen papa, haba, oca en su terreno en la comunidad de Pico Central, la esposa ayuda en la actividad agrícola, y en el cuidado de ganado y de los hijos. Don Feliciano E. P. necesitaba dinero para comprar abono orgánico para la siembra de papa, según él va ampliar la producción de papa en 2 hectáreas porque tiene terrenos sin cultivar y así ahorrar dinero para que sus hijos terminen el colegio en  Colomi pues en la zona donde viven solo existe escuela de nivel primaria, todo los niños solo tienen educación primaria por falta de recursos económicos.  Los padres no pueden pagar el gasto de estudio hasta nivel secundaria de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 48 years old and has been married to his wife, Salome, for more than 20 years. They have three children who are in primary school. Feliciano and his family live in the community of Pico Central, 68 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba, so it's difficult to go to the bank for a loan. The family makes a living in agriculture, producing potatoes, broad beans and other items on their plot of land. Feliciano's wife helps out and takes care of the livestock and the children. Feliciano is requesting the loan to purchase organic fertilizer to plant with his his potatoes, which he believes will increase his potato production by two hectares because he has some uncultivated land. This will help him save money for when his children complete their primary education, since there are only primary schools in the area where they live and all the children only have that level of education due to a lack of resources. Parents can't afford higher levels of education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 60 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijas en su casa propia. Hace 21 años prepara diferente platos típicos, en el cual los vende en la puerta de su casa. Desde entonces y todas las la mañanas realiza esta actividad y por las tardes, su esposo la apoya  en distribuir estos alimentos a los casas o comercio donde se ubican sus clientes. Cada  día  tiene una rutina diaria, además al término del día debe conseguir los materiales y productos necesarios para la preparación de comida del siguiente día. Su puesto de ventas se ubica en su misma casa, ubicada frente a una avenida muy transitada de su ciudad, eso le da la ventaja que sus ventas sean exitosas. En adelante planea mejorar su negocio en un local de ventas más amplio. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles, como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, fideos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Delia, 60, lives with her husband and two daughters in her own house. For the last 21 years she has prepared typical regional foods that she sells in her front yard every morning and afternoon. Her husband helps her deliver some of the meals to homes and businesses where some of her customers are located. Her daily routine is the same. At the end of each day she must get the supplies and ingredients for next day’s preparation. Her sales stand in located in her home which is along one of the city’s busiest streets.
