This is an advantage for her and leads to successful sales. For the future, she’d like to set up her business in a larger space. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she has financial support because she has always been very responsible with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she is requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy non-perishable ingredients like: rice, sugar, pasta, vegetables, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta and vegetables.

loans.name: Risa Oleku

texts.en:
Risa is 27 years old, he practices livestock farming in Naivasha.  He buys, rears, and later sells the animals at a profit during the peak season. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy ten goats and five sheep which he will sell later at a profit.

Risa hopes to have his own farm on which he can rear his animals and to be a major supplier of meat in Naivasha town.

loans.use: buying goats and sheep

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 55-year-old married woman from Tyre, Lebanon, who is the mother of a single child.

Since 1999, Fatima has worked in the distillation of herbs. Other than her husband’s work, it’s her main source of income and she helps him in supporting the family.

This is Fatima’s fourth loan. She’s requesting the loan in order to buy special herbs and flowers and bottles necessary to save the distilled herbs. Her clients are her neighbors, relatives, friends and friends of friends, or anyone interested in such industry.

Fatima is an expert in her work, and that’s what’s keeping her strong in the market. She hopes to open her own factory to produce her products under a registered trademark.

loans.use: To buy special herbs, flowers and bottles

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia a lado de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales el mayor trabaja, mientras ella se hace cargo de los 2 menores. Juntos habitan en un barrio comercial ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Desde muy joven empezó a desempeñarse en distintas labores, pero jamás dejó de trabajar. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos nutrientes de una reconocida marca a nivel mundial, que por medio de catalogo realiza el pedido de estos productos. Manifiesta que gracias a este negocio ha obtenido regulares ganancias, eso le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos.  Es así que viaja de vez en cuando a provincias, logrando vender la mercadería a sus clientes. Como es una mujer emprendedora, siempre esta en busca de nuevos negocios, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de venta de productos nutrientes y naturales, de esa manera logrará adquirir mejores ganancias. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere decepcionar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Juana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería en productos nutrientes, pues quiere aprovechar las ofertas para ofrecerlos más adelante a mayores precios.
texts.en:
Juana, 49, lives in her own home with her 3 children. The oldest of her children works, while she is in charge of the 2 minor children. They live together in a commercial neighborhood located in the northern part of the city. Since the time she was very young, she has held a variety of jobs, but she never stopped working. Now she is selling nutritional products from a brand that is well-known throughout the world through a catalog, taking orders from her customers. She states that thanks to this business she has been able to have regular earnings, and this has allowed her to provide for her children. At times she travels to the provinces, where she manages to sell the merchandise to her customers. As she is an enterprising woman, she is always looking for new business opportunities. In the future, she plans to set up a nutritional and natural products store so that she can achieve better earnings. This is the 3rd loan that she has taken with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time, as she does not want to disappoint all of the people who made this loan, which will allow her to continue to make progress with her business, possible. Juana plans to use the proceeds of the loan she requests to buy a large quantity of nutritional products, since she wants to take advantage of the sales so that she can sell the products later at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to acquire more nutritional products

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 62 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Huabal, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura, pertenece al distrito de Chepén y se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se ha dedicado a trabajar en labores relacionadas a la agricultura desde que era joven, el suele sembrar granos y cereales como arroz y maíz. De esta actividad depende su sustento y el de toda su familia, por ello siempre trata de mantener sus campos de cultivo de la mejor manera posible. Actualmente ha sembrado arroz y está trabajando arduamente para conseguir una buena cosecha.

Siguiendo su objetivo, Rafael ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes y herbicidas con los cuales planea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo.

Rafel es un hombre bastante honesto y trabajador. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y bastante confiable.
texts.en:
Rafael is 62 years old and lives with his family in the Huabal settlement, a rural area dedicated mainly to agriculture.  It belongs to the Chepén district and is located in the province of the same name, in the La Libertad region, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He has worked in jobs related to agriculture since he was young.  He generally sows grains and cereals like rice and corn.  Rafael depends on this activity to support him and all his family.  For this reason he always tries to maintain his fields in the best possible manner.  Currently he has sown rice and is working very hard to get a good harvest.

Pursuing this goal, Rafael has seen fit to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 800 new soles, which he plans to use to buy fertilizers and herbicides for maintaining his field.

Rafael is quite an honest and hardworking man.  The people who know him consider him to be calm and quite trustworthy.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and pesticides to maintain rice field

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina K. is currently in the business of selling beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell.  Edina is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a police man. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of twelve members. They are located in Damrei Chhlang village, Kandal province. This village selected Mrs. K. Yan, 50 years old, as the village bank president. The members of this village bank hope that the loans will be improve their families' living conditions. 

Mrs. K. Yan and her husband, Mr. Leng Som, are fishermen who are able to earn an income to support the family. They also receive some income from two of their children. But their house is getting old. Thus, Mrs. K. Yan would like to ask for a loan to fix her house up. 

This couple has three children: one is a motorcycle taxi driver and one is a construction worker while another is attending the local school

loans.use: To fix the house up

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
Commerçante marié de 49ans vendant des ustensiles de cuisine depuis 16ans. Elle à fait preuve d’un bon remboursement lors du premier prêt.  
Le prêt passé lui à permis de mieux gérer son stock  ainsi que de pouvoir bien contrôler  son revenu journalier. Ses recettes par jour sont passées de 10000frs à 350000frs.
Le prochain prêt lui permettra de mieux s’étendre sur le marche en renforcer son stock en allant acheter la marchandise à Kinshasa.
Femme entreprenante , elle contrôle ses recettes chaque jour en tenant son journal de caisse.
Elle est fière de pouvoir améliorer ses conditions de vies ainsi que de ses enfants en les scolarisant dans des bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
Justine N. is a businesswoman, married and 49 years old.  She has sold cooking utensils for 16 years.  She has a proven record of reimbursement since her first loan.  Her last loan allowed her to better manage her stock and allowed her to monitor her daily sales.  Her sales each day have increased from 10,000fr to 35,000fr.

The next loan will allow her to expand in the market and replenish her stock by going to purchase goods in Kinshasa.  As a woman entrepreneur, she controls her daily sales and manages her receipt books.  She is proud of her ability to improve the quality of her life and those of her children, by putting them through school comfortably.

loans.use: Purchasing cooking utensils, pots, cups, glasses, and table settings

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees for his younger siblings. 

He has operated a charcoal selling business for over six years, selling at wholesale and from door to door to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge in the business is competition from other charcoal business operators. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business. With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo S. is from the village of Maluno Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. He is 50 years old. Ricardo is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Ricardo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Ricardo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ricardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ricardo is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ricardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge T. is from the town of Surallah. He is 31 years old. Jorge is married and has two children aged two and four. To make a living, Jorge owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jorge wants to be a progressive farmer. He hopes to have a stable income to sustain his family. 

Jorge joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jorge has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jorge is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: She wants to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Stephen Njenga

texts.en:
Stephen Njenga K. is 33 years old. He runs a medical clinic in Mwandoni and has been in this business for the last three years. This will be his first loan from KADET LTD. Stephen plans to use the loan to purchase medicine for the clinic. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the replenishment of stock in his business. His hopes and dreams are to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for his clinic

loans.name: Rubylyn

texts.en:
This is Rubylyn G..  She is 33 years old and is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo G. and is the mother of a college-aged child. At this time, Rubylyn is working hard to be able to continue supporting her child all the way through college.  This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Rubylyn, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance that parents can leave to their children.

Rubylyn operates a ready-to-wear clothing business. She mainly offers new clothing designs like casual wear and tropical wear. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more varieties of clothing designs to sell. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Rubylyn dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes that her business will continue to grow and be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of clothing designs to sell

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit A. was born in 1978. He lives in Kapan with his parents, his wife, and his two sons. Davit’s elder son is 7 years old and his younger son is 5 years old. Davit’s wife stays at home and takes care of their children. 

Davit works as a driver at a telephone company and at the same time he keeps poultry and sells agricultural produce. Thanks to his various activities over the last few years, Davit was able to buy a van, which he uses to haul chicken feed and agricultural produce from villages to the town of Kapan. 

This is Davit’s 4th loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a $1,900 to buy chicken feed and a new sort of chickens for his farm. He intends to spend part of his loan repairing his van.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and a new sort of chickens for his farm and repair his van

loans.name: Sosten Kipsang

texts.en:
Kipsang Sosten, age 40, operates a cereal shop in the Kaprirsang trading centre in Kapsabet town. He has been in this business for a period of eight years and his monthly profit is KES. 8,000. His wife, Christine, is a poultry farmer. They have five children between the ages of eight and 19.

He has applied for his second loan from KADET Ltd, after successfully paying his previous loan consistently and promptly. He intends to use the entire loan amount to purchase 20 more bags of maize to offer for sale at market. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for his children and to improve the business. His hopes and dreams are to grow his business and to offer his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of maize to offer for sale at market

loans.name: Erkinbek

texts.en:
Erkinbek U. is 45 and married with four children. For the past 18 years, he has been engaged in breeding cattle. This is the only means of sustenance for his family. Begininng with the initial capital 2,000 KGS, Erkinbek has developed a farm that now has three cows, six sheep and eight goats. In addition, with the revenues from selling milk and meat products, he has been able to buy a car. 

Erkinbek has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase sheep. He plans to continue to expand his business and start to build a house for his family.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married woman living with her husband.  She has 15 years of experience working in the agriculture field; in 2001, she bought her land and executed her own farming work. She cultivates all types of vegetables according to the season and distributes her goods to different agricultural markets.  She cooperates with her husband who has been working as a taxi driver for 11 years, to be able to have good living conditions.  

Today, she is requesting to borrow $ 500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy agricultural seeds and herbs in addition to an electric saw. This will allow her to better monitor her product cultivation and growth. She is very positive about her future plans and wishes to earn extra money for her family.

loans.use: buy agricultural seeds and herbs in addition to an electric saw.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary K. K. is 36 years old. She is single and has two children, ages 24 and 20. Her business is located at a busy, growing trade center called Kinanie, and she is served by the Kitengela branch. She owns a grocery store in which she sells fruits and vegetables to the local people. She has been in this business for ten years. She says that the business is profitable and that the only major challenge is that there are many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 80,000 KES to buy more kale, tomatoes, capsicums, and other vegetables to expand her business and to meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and even open a retail shop. She describes herself as a very innovative lady.

loans.use: to buy more kale, tomatoes, capsicums, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Hilaria

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y hacendosa. Ella vive en la parte rural del distrito de Mórrope – Lambayeque, una comunidad netamente agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 3 años María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, contando con ganado vacuno, ovino y con aves de corral. Esta actividad la realiza desde su domicilio.  María ya cuenta con una clientela establecida, que abarca más  allá que pobladores de su colectividad. Como una ganancia adicional , María también se dedica a vender comida repartida a domicilio.
 
María solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de animales, en el alimento de estos y finalmente en el arreglo de su corral. María necesita hacer esto debido a que la demanda de su clientela es cada vez mayor, puesto que no tiene competencia en su zona.

María es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación, ella espera ampliar su negocio para mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
María, age 34, is a hard-working, energetic woman.  She lives in the rural area of the district of Mórrope - Lambayeque, an agricultural and livestock farming community.

For three years María has raised and sold livestock, such as cattle, sheep and chicken.  She has her business set up in her home.  María's established customer base goes beyond the local population.  For additional income she also has a food catering business with home delivery.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy livestock, animal feed and to fix up the stable.  She must do this since demand is growing and she doesn't have competition in the area.

María is very set on getting ahead.  She wants to grow her business and make a better life for herself.

loans.use: To buy livestock and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna vive en el estado de veracruz en el municipio de Tierra Blanca o mejor conocida como la novia del sol, la cual se caracteriza por ser una zona ganadera y sus abuandantes calores en verano  de hasta 54°c. Doña Reyna tiene la edad de 74 años, ella no estudio ya que nos platica que cuando ella era joven solo los hombres estudiaban y  a las mujeres se les enseñaba a cocinar y a realizar las labores del hogar, ella solo tuvo dos hijos los cuales ya estan casados y en algunas ocaciones la ayudan economicamente.

Doña Reyna nos platica que siempre a tenido que trabajar para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante pero hace un poco mas de 45 años se compro un trisiclo y inicio a vender ropa casa por casacon sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ademas de la ropa tambien vende escobas, chiles rellenos, tamales y aprendio a tejer abanicos con palma los cuales tambien vende.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa para dama y caballero, chiles, cebolla, maiz, tomates, carne, aceite y gas para la elaboracion de sus tamales y chiles para posteriormente venderlos.

Ella espera que con la inversion de este credito su negocio prospere para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y tener mas ganacias para seguirlas invertiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna lives in the town of Tierra Blanca, better known as the “Bride of the Sun”. The area is known for its livestock industry and the abundant summer heat that can reach as high as 54°C. Doña Reyna is 74 years old and did not receive an education. She says that when she was a young girl, only the boys could study. The girls were taught how to cook and take care of the household chores. Reyna has two children who are married and occasionally help her with her finances.

Doña Reyna says that she always had to work so that her children could get ahead. A little more than 45 years ago, she bought a tricycle and started selling household clothing to her friends and neighbors in the community. In addition to clothes, she sold brooms, stuffed chili peppers, and tamales. She also learned how to make fans out of woven palm fibers, which she sold as well.

Reynda needs this loan to invest in the purchase of clothing for women and men, chili peppers, onions, corn, tomatoes, meat, oil, and natural gas for preparing her tamales and stuffed peppers to sell. She hopes that the investment from this loan will help her business prosper so that she can have a better quality of life and more income to continue reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is working for state government as a village consultant and she also sells cow horns. She lives with her mother, one brother and one sister. Her income is $5 per day, and she has to spend $124 on food, and $13 on electricity per month.  

Because the income is not enough to support the family, she would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy land to plant corn so that she can get the benefit from that planting.

She learned a lot about the career she is doing now (selling cow’s horn) from her mother but this career can earn only a small amount of money, so she needs to find other ways to get more income as now she is in charge of supporting the family. 

With this loan, she expects to buy more planting land so she can plant more corn to get more profit to buy a better house.

loans.use: To buy land to plant corn.

loans.name: Divina Gracia

texts.en:
This is Divina, 59, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow and the mother of three children, all of whom are already working, and two of whom are settled down with their own families. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Divina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands (dishes) cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 730 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Divina Gracia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have her own house and lot in a prominent subdivision in a nice location. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products and ingredients used in her business.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en: Ramona is 76 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with 6 children. She has a shop where she sells clothes. She has had this business for 35 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase more clothes for her shop. Ramona has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her shop

loans.name: Jaime De Jesús

texts.es:
Poco capital de trabajo, un local ubicado en la casa de sus padres y las ganas de salir adelante y de ofrecerle a sus vecinos un lugar tranquilo donde tomarse un refresco o una cerveza, fueron lo que motivó a Jaime a darle vida a su propio negocio, una salsamentaria que poco a poco y gracias a su dedicación ha ido creciendo. 

En el futuro Jaime espera ampliar su negocio y posicionarlo aún más en el sector. Actualmente este emprendedor de 55 años oriundo de Medellín-Colombia, necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido propio de la canasta familiar y así ofrecer otro tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Little working capital, business premises located in his parents' home and a desire to get ahead and offer his neighbors a quiet place where they could enjoy a soft drink or a beer were what motivated Jaime to give birth to his own business, a delicatessen which, thanks to his commitment, has gradually grown.

In the future, Jaime hopes to expand his business and position it even better in the sector.  This 55 year-old entrepreneur, who is from Medellín in Colombia, currently needs a loan to buy basic household products so that he can sell other types of product.

loans.use: to buy basic household products

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married and has four sons and two daughters. Mariam lives in Rafah city, Gaza Strip in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a low salary. Mariam and her husband manage a poultry farm, which is one of the few farms in the area where she lives. Mariam wants to purchase poultry fodder, cages and medicines that will improve the productivity of the project, but due to the decent income her husband makes, she is in need of a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. FATEN's loan, which is disbursed in a short period of time, will enable Mariam to pay for the project needs. That will enhance and develop the potential of the project, especially since Mariam is looking forward to become a poultry-breeding expert. Mariam is a religious conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To  purchase poultry fodder, cages and medicine

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 48 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has 7 children. Four of her children are currently in school. She has had a business selling small silver fish for over 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Safia has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase silver fish for resale. With the help of the loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Safia hopes to expand her business. Safia is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business such that she has managed to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase silver fish for resale.

loans.name: Cherli

texts.es: Cherli, de 37 años es una mujer muy activa, siempre esta buscando alguna actividad que realizar para así poder generar ingresos para la educación de sus tres hijos con quienes vive junto a su pareja en casa de su madre.El trabajo de Cherli consiste en la compra y venta de joyas de plata y oro, además de la compra y venta de ropa, ella envía dinero a la ciudad de Lima, de ahí le envían los productos que ella se encarga de vender en la ciudad entre sus amigas y vecinas, lleva ya con este trabajo un promedio de nueve años, lo realiza sola y tiene una muy buena cartera de clientes.Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder estar realizando otras actividades, lo que no le gusta es que a veces las personas se demoran en pagar, pero siempre tiene clientes y lo bueno es que como ya tiene años en el negocio sabe a quien dar y a quien no, a Cherli le gustaría mas adelante poder poner una tienda da platería y oro en la ciudad.Este es el cuarto préstamo entre Cherli y la institución MFP, esta muy contenta de trabajar con nosotros y espera poder seguir haciéndolo, además se siente a gusto con su grupo ya que siempre se muestran preocupados de los demás.Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, ella comprara mas joyas, para así poder seguir realizando su trabajo y poder generar mas ganancias e ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Cherli, 37, is a very active woman; she’s always looking for something to do to generate income for her three children’s education.  She lives with her spouse and children in her mother’s house.  

Cherli’s work consists in buying and selling silver and gold jewelry.  She’s also a clothing merchant.  She sends money to the city of Lima and the products she orders are sent to her from there and then she sells them among her friends and neighbors in the city.  She’s been in this business on average nine years.  She works alone and has quite a good customer base.  What she enjoys the most about it is that it leaves her with time to do other things.  What she dislikes about it is that sometimes people take their time to repay her but she always has customers and since she’s been in business for a long time she knows who she can give credit to and who she can’t.  Later on, Cherli would like to be able to open a silver and gold shop in the city.

This is the fourth loan between Cherli and MFP.  She is very happy to work with us and hopes to continue to do so.  Besides, she feels very comfortable with her group because they are always concerned about each other.  She will use the requested 1500 soles to buy more jewelry to continue doing her work and generating more profits and income for her home.

loans.use: to get more jewelry.

loans.name: Cristo Del Consuelo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cristo del Consuelo está conformado por 8 mujeres quienes son personas luchadoras, trabajadoras y muy alegres a pesar de las dificultades de la vida. Laboran en diferentes actividades,  las mismas que les han permitido salir  adelante y aportar a la economía de sus  hogares. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió pero el corazón de su gente es muy cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, la ciudad de Cuenca es admirada por su arquitectura colonial.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora. María Blanca, vive en las afuera de la ciudad de Cuenca.
 
Tiene 40 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de 17, 15, 14, 12, 10, 4 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y estudian a distancia, su tercer y cuarto hijo estudian en el colegio y su hijo de 10 años estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la rama de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad siendo el sacrificio del trabajo conyugal.
 
Doña María Blanca se dedica a la venta de frutas hace 18 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, su producto lo vende ambulantemente. En su casa cría pollos, cuyes y chanchos a los que los vende en la ciudad.

Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y pollos.

Su sueño es tener un vehículo. 

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una socia que por motivos personales no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank of Cristo del Consuelo consists of 8 women who are determined, hardworking and very cheerful despite life's difficulties. They work in different jobs, that have allowed them to move forward and contribute to their household finances. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate but very warm-hearted people who maintain the culture and traditions of their people. The city of Cuenca is reknowed for its colonial architecture.

One of the members of this group is Señora María Blanca. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. She is 40 years and married. She has 7 children from the marriage: 17, 15, 14, 12, 10, 4 and 3 years of age. Her two eldest children work and study by distance learning; her 3rd and 4th child studies at school and her 10 year old son studies as a small school in the city. Her husband works in the construction industry as a builder. The house she lives in is her own property, bought through the sacrifice of the couple both working.

Doña María Blanca has been selling fruit for the last 18 years. She works Mondays to Saturdays from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening. She is a street vendor. At home she raises chickens, guinea pigs and pigs which she sells in the city. This is her 4th loan and she is going to invest it in the purchase of pigs and chickens. Her dream is to have a vehicle

The small photo attached is of one of the members who for personal reasons was inable to be present when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Moriba S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the institutions in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone.  This group of teachers has come to Kiva partner SMT, based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 20,000,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay SMT/Kiva lenders, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayments and pays SMT/Kiva lender on their behalf.

Moriba is the leader of this group. The 39-year-old was born in Kenema, married and has 4 children who are attending primary school. Moriba has been a teacher for 15 years now. He has requested this loan in order to educate his children. He will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Nevaditas De Chijini Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NEVADITAS DE CHIJINI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lucia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de lana hilada, tienda de barrio, artesanía en aguayo, tejido de mantas, venta de tucumanas, venta de repuestos de autos, elaboración de masitas.

La señora Lucia,  indica que es primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de hilado de vicuña que viene trabajando hace un año y medio atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana de vicuña) que adquirirá de la feria 16 de julio y posteriormente elaborado lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.

En la fotografía no se encuentran dos socias, Ana e Irene, ya que se fueron a consulta médica
texts.en:
Nevaditas de Chijini Communal Association will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Cascada.  There are nine members and it is run by a board headed by Lucia.  The businesses managed by the members of the communal association are varied, including selling spun wool, a neighborhood store, traditional craftwork with wool cloth ("aguayo"), woven blankets, selling auto parts, and pastry making.

Lucia indicates that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, and that she joined on an invitation from friends.  Currently she has a business selling vicuña yarn that she has been working on for the past year and a half.

She will use this loan to increase her capital buying vicuña wool, which she will acquire from the 16 de Julio market and later will sell in the markets.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family in any way possible, since she is married and has eight children.
 
When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings.

Two members, Ana and Irene, are not in the photograph, since they had medical appointments.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool.

loans.name: Adoline

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme célibataire qui tient une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques et de mercerie. Située dans l'enceinte du marché central, la boutique est très fréquentée par les tailleurs et la clientèle féminine.L'emprunteuse a étudié jusqu'au lycée avant d'arreter les études du fait des mauvaises conditions d'hebergement et d'entretien dans lesquelles elle se trouvait.Elle a préféré retourner dans son village et se lancer dans le commerce.Aujourd'hui, sa boutique lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge, de satisfaire aux besoins de ses trois soeurs et d'appuyer son père dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Elle sollicite un pret de 500000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en cette période de forte demande en achetant notamment du popeline, des fils à coudre, des tissus, des boutons et d'autres produits divers.Son ambition est de devenir grossite.
texts.en:
This borrower is a single woman who has a store where she sells cosmetics and sewing supplies.  Her store is located within the central market and is very popular with tailors and female customers.  The borrower studied up to high school level before she stopped her education due to bad housing conditions and lack of support.  She preferred to return to her village and start a business.  Her store currently makes her income which she uses to support herself, meet the needs of her three sisters and support her father in covering the family's expenses.

The borrower is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to strengthen her business during this period of high demand by purchasing, in particular, poplin, sewing thread, fabrics, buttons and other miscellaneous products.  Her ambition is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy poplin, sewing thread, fabric, buttons and other miscellaneous products

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Rosanna is peddling & selling a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy dried fish to sell.
Rosanna has been a  member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Rosanna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is a 41-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. She and her husband earn a living running a general store. 

Hang would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as cooking oil, eggs, snack foods, toiletries, and confections to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as cooking oil, eggs, snack foods, toiletries, and confections to stock her general store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel de 29 años de edad, es un hombre soltero y sin hijos. Vive en la casa de sus padres, con quienes trabaja, en Pueblo Pardo en el distrito de Chanchamayo. La vida le ha enseñado a Samuel, que para subsistir y buscar el progreso tiene varias opciones de trabajo honrado y dignificante, por esa razón se dedica a la agricultura, con el sembrío de cítricos como: carambolas, naranjas y tanyarinas; frutos que crecen saludables y pulposos gracias al clima de la parte baja de la selva.
Y como él es un hombre que no descansa, en los días libres trabaja como operario de otros sembríos ó como peón en distintas obras de mantenimiento y construcción. 
“Hay distintas maneras de ganarse la vida y yo no hago problemas de trabajar en lo que sea, con tal de que sea honrado”, comenta entre risas.
Como agricultor le va muy bien, por eso, mas adelante quisiera contar con un negocio de frutas de su propia producción y otras que adquirirá de sus vecinos; y para no descuidar sus cultivos contratará personal para que trabajen sus tierras. Con su ayuda, Samuel accedería a su crédito número 7 de MFP. Da su palabra de ser pagar las cuotas los días señalados. En cuanto a su banco comunal, manifiesta sentirse muy satisfecho con el sistema de trabajo. De adquirir el préstamo, podrá comprarse una sierra a motor, así como bolsas de abonos orgánicos
texts.en:
Samuel, 29, is a single man with no children. He lives with his parents, whom he works with in Pueblo Pardo, Chanchamayo District.

Life has taught Samuel that there are many fair and honest employment options to choose from in order to survive and succeed, and that is why he earns a living from agriculture, growing citrus fruits like carambolas, oranges and tangeries, which grow healthy and pulpy thanks to the climate in the lower part of the jungle.

Since he is a very industrious man, on his days off he works as an operator in other sown fields or as a building laborer in different maintenance and construction works.

“There are different ways of earning a living and I am willing to take up any job, as long as it is worthy,” he says between laughs.

As an agricultor he is doing really well, so in the future he would like to have a business with fruits from his own production and other fruits he will get from his neighbours. In order not to neglect his crops, he will hire labor to cultivate his land. 

With your help, Samuel would obtain his seventh loan from MFP. He promises to pay his fees on the fixed days. As to his communal bank, he says he is very pleased with their work system. If he gets this loan, he will be able to buy an electric chainsaw and some bags of organic manure.

loans.use: To buy an electric chainsaw and some bags of organic manure.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 46-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her two children who are still studying. She has been working as a teacher in a local school for the past twenty-one years. In parallel, she has also been teaching at a local university for three years. 

She’s working really hard to be able to fulfill her family needs and cover her children’s educational fees. Today, she’s looking to borrow $ 2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay her children’s university fees.  She notes that this will allow them continue their education in a proper way. In the future, she plans to earn money in order to enhance their way of living and offer her children a better future.

loans.use: to pay her children’s university fees.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Sra. María, este comité siempre supo salir adelante a pesar de tener algunos problemas; ahora es un grupo activo con ganas de trabajar y salir adelante. Todas son mujeres muy activas y trabajadoras que al máximo se esfuerzan por lograr sus metas.
Dionisia es una de las miembros, ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de carbón. Dice que tiene muchas ventas ya que el carbón ha sido un medio alternativo, pues el gas está muy caro. Gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo a podido ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón en cantidad, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más productos en stock. Agradece a la fundación por esta oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Señora María.  This group has always known how to get ahead in spite of having difficulties.  It is now an active group that is willing to work to get ahead.  They are all hard-working active women who work hard to achieve their goals.  

Dionisia is one of the members.  She tells us that she sells charcoal for a living.  She also says that she makes a lot of sales as charcoal is an alternative to gas since gas is very expensive.  Thanks to her hard work she has been able to support her family and cover the expenses that arise daily.  

She is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of charcoal so she can stock more product.  She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity that they have given her.

loans.use: purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 29-year-old married woman with four children; two of the children are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan, for one year.

Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 39 years old. He is from Nyahururu and is married to Lucy. They have two children who are in school.

Daniel is a farmer and has been in this business for the past three years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

He hopes to diversify into cattle rearing in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be honest woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more cereals to sell. Her business goal is to add more cereals to her business stock so as to sell to customers to meet their high demand within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. Edinah is in farming which increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.en:
Born in 1979 at Tsévié, Mr Yaovi A. is issued from a poor and numerous family. After the class of middle upper six, he was trained in electronics. Encountering with all difficulties to find the spare parts for his work, he has decided to open a house of electronics spare parts. It is in that context that he has benefited from his first credit of $550 which was already repaid. This has shown her ability to well manage her activity. Married, he has beside her own child, her two (02) sisters. Dynamic and very undertaking, he seizes all the opportunities presented to her to growth her businesses. For the current project, Mr Yaovi A. requests a credit of $1200 which will serve to buy spares and used electronics machines such as: television, sets, VCD and DVD drive at the port of Lomé and to resell them at Tsévié. This will allow him to growth his incomes in order to better up keep pres family and to assure his children and sister education.

Né en 1979 à Tsévié, Monsieur A. Yaovi est issu d’une famille pauvre et nombreuse. Après la classe de 1ère, il a fait une formation électronique. Eprouvant toutes les difficultés pour trouver des pièces de rechanges pour son travail, il a décidé d’ouvrir un établissement de vente de pièces détachées électroniques. C’est dans ce cadre qu’il a bénéficié de son premier crédit de $550 qu’il a déjà remboursé. Ceci a démontré sa capacité à bien gérer son activité. Marié, il a à sa charge, en plus de son enfant, ses deux (02) sœurs. Dynamique et très entreprenant, il saisit toutes les opportunités qui se présentent à lui pour accroître ses affaires. Pour le présent projet, Monsieur A. Yaovi sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui servira à acheter des pièces détachées et des appareils électroniques d’occasion tels que : les postes téléviseurs, amplificateurs, des lecteurs VCD et DVD au port de Lomé pour les revendre à Tsévié. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux entretenir sa famille et d’assurer la scolarisation de son enfant et de ses sœurs.

loans.use: to buy spares and used electronics machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Felista intends to buy 30 bunches of bananas

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mrs Min S. is a hard working mother of four children who lives in Kampongcham province, Cambodia. She is struggling to earn income by growing a variety of crops, raising animals and selling them to the market. Min S., 33 years old, typically makes about $7 /day, and her husband makes around $5/day from working as a driver in a small private company. S. requests a loan for $500 so she can purchase more rice seeds and more animals. The increase in rice and animal products will enable her to replace her old rice mill and increase her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and animals

loans.name: Blás

texts.es:
Blas is married, he is 52 years old and he lives with his 45-year-old wife. His wife is a clothing designer who has built a very good clientele to whom she designs outfits upon request. He has three daughters who are 23, 16 and 8 respectively. All three are in school and the eldest one is about to graduate from college. Blas says that he started his career approximately 25 years ago when an uncle taught him everything that he now knows. He is able to build different kinds of furniture such as: wardrobes, dressers, chairs, etc…. Pieces are built upon request only. He tells that he is always busy because he puts in the effort to make sure that his products are of the best quality and that his customers are always satisfied. He also manufactures furniture to wholesale buyers. He was able to build a house thanks to his diligence at work. His carpentry business is done from this house, which is equipped with all the necessary tools to build furniture. He proudly states that his profession provided his three daughters the opportunity to get an education. Due to the fact that he does not have a son to take over the business, he had to double his efforts to make sure his daughters could graduate from college and be able to afford a living once they were on their own. Today, he requests a line of credit so that he can purchase more wood. One of his wholesale buyers has ordered a large quantity of pieces of furniure and to fulfill the order he would need an extra wood supply.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Blas es casado, tiene 52 años y vive con su esposa Celestina que tiene actualmente 45 años. Su esposa es modista, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya formada a quienes les confecciona ropas por pedido. Tienen 3 hijas de 23,16 y 8 años respectivamente. Todas están estudiando y la mayor de ellas ya está por culminar una carrera universitaria. Blas comenta que se inició en la actividad hace aproximadamente 25 años aprendiendo la profesión con un tío que le enseñó todo lo que sabe. Elabora muebles de todo tipo como roperos, cómodas, sillas, etc., todos sobre pedido. Cuenta que siempre tiene trabajo porque se esfuerza para que sus productos sean de la mejor calidad y que su clientela salga siempre satisfecha, también fabrica muebles para clientes mayoristas. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo logró construir su casa propia. En dicho lugar funciona actualmente su carpintería que está equipada con todas las herramientas necesarias para desarrollar su actividad. Cuenta con orgullo que su profesión le ha dado la posibilidad de hacer estudiar a sus tres hijas. Debido a que no tuvo ningún hijo varón que le siga en la profesión debe redoblar esfuerzos para que las mismas, el día de mañana, puedan tener la posibilidad de terminar una carrera universitaria para poder ganarse el sustento diario. Hoy está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más maderas, pues uno de sus clientes mayoristas ha solicitado una gran cantidad de sus muebles y para cumplir con el necesita la madera.

loans.use: Compra de madera al por mayor

loans.name: Taikoke

texts.en: Tiakoke has to wake up extra early every day. Her home is quite a distance from town, where her flea market business has been for almost a decade now.  One of the oldest members of Luatuanuu center, Atikoke has managed to expand her handicraft business by opening another stall. With her next loan she’s hoping to look at the overseas market to export her goods.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Mrs. Matilde J. Olmedo is a 52-year-old widow and mother of two living in San Ignacio, Paraguay. Her two daughters are ages 18 and 16 respectively. Both daughters are currently in high school and help their mother when they are not studying. Matilde is thankful for the help of her daughters, as maintaining her business and family has been difficult since the death of her husband in 2001. Mr. Olmedo died of cancer at the age of 45. This was a tremendous loss for the family and also left Matilde with the debt incurred due to the operations and treatment her husband undertook to try and cure him. For this reason Matilde works extremely hard to cover the debt she has as a result of her husband’s death.

Her store, a small grocery, is very well-stocked and well-managed due to the time and effort Matilde dedicates to it. She sells rice, noodles, oil, sugar, flour and eggs. Having had this store for 14 years, she understands how to make things run smoothly. She has asked for a loan to buy articles of clothing. She wishes to expand her store to also sell clothing. It is her hope that with the summer months and added inventory she will be able to increase her sales. By expanding her store Matilde wishes to pay off her debt faster.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
My house has a wooden roof, but it is quite damaged due to the weather. My house is very damp during this rainy season, so I would like to knock this roof down and build a concrete roof in order to prevent my family from getting sick. I am requesting $1,200.00 to build a concrete roof for my house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un techo de madera en mi vivienda pero ya esta muy dañado por el tiempo y en estas temporadas de lluvia mi casa esta muy húmeda, me gustaría tumbarlo y construir un techo de concreto para evitar que mi familia enferme debido a tanta humedad” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para construir el techo de concreto en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of concrete roof

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Mavluda was born in Dushanbe. She is not married. Currently she lives with her parents. She has a stable business and she has been doing it for the past 10 years. Her shop is close to the market “Sahovat”. She began her business with a small inventory, slowly increasing her turnover. After a while, Mavluda was able to save money and opened her own shop. In 2003, she rented a stall (in the picture). Currently, she has wide range of products: baked goods, which she purchases in the local bakeries and confectioners shops as well as soft drinks and juices from local manufacturers. The rest of her goods she purchases at local wholesale markets. Her inventory is worth $1000 and she is applying to KIVA with a request for a loan of $1200 (5000 Somoni) for 6 months for the purchase of her next batch of products.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Мавлюда родилась в Душанбе,незамужем.В настояшее время живет с родителями. Имеет стабильный бизнес и занимается этим делом на протяжении 10 лет.Её магазин расположен около рынка "Саховат".Она раньше продавала не большую партию товара.Постепенно она расширила свой ассортимент и смогла накопить деньги на магазинюВ 2003 году она арендовала магазин где вы сейчас можете её увидеть.В данное время она имеет широкий выбор товаров.Мучные продукты она закупает в местных кондитерских цехах, напитки привозят с лиманадных цехов и заводов.Остальной товар она закупает на оптовом рынке.Она имеет в обороте $1000 и в данное время она обратилась в КИВА с просьбой на 5000сомони на 6 месецев для заукпки очередной партии товара.

loans.use: Buying food porducts.

loans.name: Trik

texts.en:
Mrs. Trik H., 48, is a farmer and owns a plot of land growing a variety of vegetables. She makes approximately three dollars per day. Her husband, Mr. Ang Savon, 47, works in a rice field.. He earns about two dollars each day. This couple has three children. Two of the children work at a factory and have an income of $70.00 a month.

Mrs. H. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport rice and vegetables from the field to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport rice and vegetables from the field to the market.

loans.name: Milka

texts.es:
Mrs. Milka is 34 years old and the mother of 4 children. She works every day in a small location offering an enormous variety of products to her customers. She sells cookies, sweets, soft drinks and other food products that are the fascination of all the local children. Her work has enabled her to better manage her home. She has decided to ask for a loan so that she can set up a better sales location. She would like to have her workplace ready for the beginning of the school year, as the children are her main source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La señora Milka de 34 años de edad, tiene 04 hijos, su labor diaria la desempeña en un pequeño espacio en el que oferta una inmensa variedad de galletas, dulces, gaseosa y demás comestibles que son la fascinación de los más pequeños. Con esta labor ha podido extender las satisfacciones en su hogar y decidido solicitar un préstamo para implementar y acondicionar mejor su espacio de ventas a fin de iniciar una buena faena en cuanto inicie la labor escolar, fuente de sus ingresos diarios.

loans.use: To set up a proper sales location

loans.name: Plong

texts.en:
Mrs. Plong N. is 54 and is married with ten children. Five of her children are married, two are farmers who breed cows and grow rice, and the rest cook food for their household. Mrs. Plong N. is a widow. Since her husband passed away many years ago, Plong N. has to carry the burden of covering all of her family’s expenses by herself.

She has a stand at a market selling various kinds of vegetables and she, normally, she can make about $1 to $2 of net income each day. She has humbly requested a loan to expand her vegetable booth. With the leftover money, she will purchase another plot of farmland to expand her family’s crops.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable booth and purchase another plot of farmland

loans.name: Ongaroi Jua Kali Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Rosemary I. is an average woman aged 30 with 3 children. She also lives with 1 orphan child of her late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Rosemary started her business 3 years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place in a local hospital located in Busia town. She currently deals in ladies' shoes but would like to diversify to include children's and men’s collections as well. Being the bread winner for her family, it would enable her to support both her children and her husband, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that she gets from the business, Rosemary still struggles to pay her house rent and to feed and clothe her children. But with the help of her loan, Rosemary will be able to add more stock of second-hand shoes and increase her monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Chon Erm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people in Preak Thom Village make up one Village Bank and Mrs. Chon E. is the Village Bank President. She grows different kinds of vegetables in the village.

Her plantation business activity now is not performing very well because the field is infertile. In order to make her plantation crop more productive, Mrs. Chon E. would like to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field.

Her husband, Mr. Yang Sam, is a vegetable farmer. Mrs. Chon E. is the mother of two children, both of whom are attending a local school. Mrs. Chon E. now has a swollen leg and she spends unforeseen expenses. People who stand at the right are not in these Village Bank members.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan S., 20, is single with no children. She has many years of experience in the elei business making Samoan screen-printed material. She sells to the general public and villages 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 430 Tala (~179 USD). SPBD loans are Joan’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will be able to use it for the business.

loans.use: Purchase fabric clothes, paints, brushes and threads.

loans.name: Rosas Rojas Group

texts.es:
Hello.  We are part of a group called Rosas Rojas, or Red Roses.   We all work selling everyday household items and groceries from two shops we run.    Guadalupe del Carmen D. sells her snacks in the neighborhood.  Her customers appreciate the high quality of her products and the reasonable prices.    Marta G. sells merchandise from the shop.  As it's located on a main street, she benefits from a good customer base and is well known in the community.  And Ciriaca G. also works in the shop.  As a single mother, this income from this business helps her take of her 3 children.  

 They are all requesting financial help to continue to grow their respective businesses and improve the quality of life for their families.  


hola nosotras somos el grupo Rosas Rojas, nuestra actividad es el comercio, vendemos mercaderia y tenemos dos pulperias de ventas de productos de consumo popular.

nuestras activiades son:
Guadalupe del Carmen D.: mi actividad principal es el comercio, en la cual vendo oro enchape de manera ambulante, mis clientes me prefieren por la atencion que les brindo y por la buena calidad de mi producto a un bajo costo.

Marta G.: la actividad de ella es la venta de productos de consumo popular, dicha pulperia esta ubicada en la calle principal de la comunidad de sartenejas, jamastran. ella cuenta con un local muy agradable para sus clientes ya que por ello es muy reconocida por todos los habitantes de nuestra comunidad.

Ciriaca G.: cuenta con una pulperia que esta ubicada en la comunidad de sartenejas, jamastran, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, dicho negocio le ayuda a salir adelante con su familia.

todas nosotras solicitamos ayuda para que nos permitan crecer con nuestros negocios y mejorar nuestras condiciones de vida.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for their respective businesses, increase their income and continue to improve the quality of life for their families.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is 45 years old and divorced. She owns and runs her own shop and she has been a soup seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 9AM to 6PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Habiba now hopes for a loan to buy more items to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to expand her business.

loans.name: Vaeula

texts.en:
Vaeula M., 27, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience growing cabbages, cucumbers, pumpkins, beans, and tomatoes. She sells to the public and to villagers 3 days per week.

She has taken 2 previous loans from South Pacific Business Development (SPBD). She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 410 Tala (~$170 USD). SPBD loans are Vaeula's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks. She will also use the loan to buy iron roofs to repair the roof of her home. Her husband is working to help with the family's needs and funding the business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, chemicals and vegetables seeds

loans.name: Inomdjon

texts.ru: Каримов Иномджон житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст 21 год, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Уже один год занимается такси. Имеет свой автомобиль , который использует в качестве транспорта. Ему необходим кредит для того , чтобы сделать ремонт автомобиля. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Inomdjon K. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 21 years old, married and has a child. He has been in a taxi business for one year and owns a car. Inomdjon needs a loan in order to make repairs on his car. He will be able to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia baji is the wife of M. and lives in Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in a two room brick house for the past 20 years. Shazia baji is a mother of five children: three daughters and two sons. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Shazia baji’s husband has owned an animal food selling business for the past ten years.  Shazia baji owns a milk selling business. She gets milk from her buffalo and sells it at different milk shops. Her elder daughter helps her by filling the milk in milk pots. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to help buy more animal food for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy animal food

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed A. is a hard-working man who strives to provide for his wife and seven children. Majed sells a variety of goods from his small store. He also works as a messenger at the governmental office earning about $200 per month - an amount insufficient to meet basic family expenses.

Majed wishes to take a loan of $1200 to increase his inventory in order to increase sales. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: To increase the inventory in his store.

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: Doña Maria es gerente de una tienda desde hace cinco años, tiene 57 años de edad, y reside en  barrio de Memorial Sandino, tiene una hija de 23 años de edad, que esta en la universidad, anteriormente se desempeñaba en ventas pero con su buen desempeño la promovieron a gerente, lo cual se siente sastifecha por sus logros, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada de asesor administrativo y siempre ha tenido su apoyo, la Sra. Martha ha hecho tres préstamo en Afodenic en los cuales ha invertido en las mejoras de la vivienda, con este préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para construir la cocina  y estar cómoda y gozar de una vivienda digna.  Sus objetivos es segur remodelando su casa para dejarle un buen patrimonio a su hija, a si como seguir apoyándola con sus estudios
texts.en:
Doña Maria has been the manager of a store for the past 5 years. She is 57 years old, and she lives in the neighbourhood of Memorial Sandino. She has a daughter who is 23 years old who is in university. Previously, she worked as a saleswoman, but her good work promoted her to manager, which makes her feel happy for her achievements. Her husband works in a private business of administrative consultants and she always has his support. Sra. Martha has had three loans with AFODENIC in which she invested in improving her home. This loan would go to buying construction materials to construct a kitchen and to be more comfortable and to enjoy a dignified home. Her objectives are to remodel her home to give a good patrimony to her daughter, and so continue to help her with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for the kitchen

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Mambo ("Hello!") from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Jessie M. from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is single and has no children. However, she is responsible for supporting one dependent, because his parents cannot care for him. Jessie has been running a hair salon since 2008. Her salon is a place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair or blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at her business for 5-8 hours per day, seven days per week, and is assisted by two employees. Jessie currently earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for making food. In the future, she plans to open another business. Jessie thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making food

loans.name: Charles

texts.es: Charles de 23 años de edad, es casado y  tiene una hijita de 4 años la cual está estudiando. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar, da todo de sí en las labores que realiza, desde hace 4 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, es propietario  de un motocarro, con el cual se moviliza por las calles de su ciudad en busca de pasajeros, gustándole el conocer varios lugares y relacionarse con muchas personas, porque es muy amistoso y su gran carisma ha hecho que su servicio gane fama, siendo muy cotizado por las personas del lugar, lo que le es muy rentable. Charles administra su dinero separándolo para comprar cosas para su familia y para hacerle algunos arreglos a su principal herramienta de trabajo, porque él quiere seguir creciendo en el negocio del transporte y para ello tiene que tener en muy buenas condiciones a su moto. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y le gusta mucho  trabajar con su grupo ya que son muy unidos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar repuestos para mandar a reparar su mototaxi en lo que gastará un aproximado de1000 soles, y que gracias a ello pueda lograr mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el resto del dinero lo invertirá en pequeño taller de soldadura que atiende en sus ratos libres.
texts.en:
Charles is 23 years old, married and has a small daughter aged 4 who is already studying. He is a very hard-working man who has always devoted himself to his work and gives his all in the labours he undertakes. For the last four years he has worked transporting passengers, as he is the owner of a motor-bike which he drives through the town's streets looking for passengers. He likes knowing different places and interacting with many people, because he is very friendly and his great charisma means that his services have become famous, and he is much sought-after by people in the area. This means his business is very profitable. Charles manages his money, dividing it to buy things for his family and for making some repairs to his main tool of trade, because he wants to continue expanding his transport business and for that he need to keep his motor-bike in excellent condition. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he likes working with his group very much, as they are all very united. With the money that he has asked for he wants to buy spare parts to make repairs to his taxi, which will cost around 1000 soles. Thanks to this he will be able to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life. He will invest the rest of the money in a small soldering workshop which he deals with in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Neftalí

texts.es:
El señor Neftalí C. actualmente vive en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de Leñon donde se dedica a su actividad economica de ganadería con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su familia compuesta por su esposa y su pequeño hijo para brindarles un techo digno donde vivir y haya seguridad.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de un novillo y por esto es que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así salir adelante en su actividad ganadera que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mr. Neftali C. currently lives in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of Leñon where he raises livestock with the purpose of bettering the living conditions of his family. His family consists of his wife and young son and he wants to give them a decent place to live where there is security.

It is important to emphasize that today he has asked for the support of Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan for the purchase of young bull; for this purpose he hopes that his loan will be granted and then he will be able to forge ahead in his business that very much requires your support.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of cattle

loans.name: Valentine

texts.fr:
G. Valentine est née le 14/02/1970 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Valentine est célibataire avec cinq enfants dont quatre scolarisés. Valentine vend du maïs, de la farine de manioc, du haricot, de l'huile de noix de palme, de galettes d'arachide, de charbon de bois, du riz et de savons. Valentine est dans le commerce depuis quinze (15) ans environ mais c'est avec les prêts qu'elle a eu de ALIDé que Valentine a vu son activité grandir. Pour renforcer son activité afin de mieux satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants Valentine sollicite un nouveau prêt auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
G. Valentine was born on February 14, 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is unmarried and has five children, four of whom are in school. She sells corn, cassava flour, beans, palm nut oil, peanut galettes, charcoal, rice, and soap. She has been in this business for about fifteen years. And with the Alidé loans she had, she's seen her business grow. To bolster her business, so as to do better in supporting herself and her children, Valentine is requesting a new loan from Alidé.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, corn, peanuts, and beans, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en:
“Success is the fruit of sacrifice” says Fredelyn D., an electronic load retailer in the village of Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Michael and they have a three-year-old daughter named Regielyn Rose. Fredelyn believes that one must really experience pain and difficulties for life to become successful. The couple is trying to start saving something to send their child and future children to school.

The couple strives to provide a better life for their family. Engaging in the electronic load business is quite easy because Fredelyn can sell loads to her customers while taking care of their daughter and doing household chores. Her husband is planting vegetables and root crops. She started the business with a small capital and she generates a monthly income of PHP1,500.
